Celso P. is 41 years old and is married. He and his wife, Damiana Aquino, have an 8 year old son who attends a public school in their neighborhood. Celso's wife sells men's and women's clothing and perfumes door to door.

Celso owns a locksmith shop located in the center of the city and has 12 years of experience in the trade. His business enjoys an established client base and generates sufficient income to cover the family's expenses. In spite of his many responsibilities and his age, he makes an extraordinary sacrifice to continue studying. He's currently in his last year of law school at one of the city's best private universities.

His biggest dream is to complete his studies and to practice law, which will enable him to improve his family's quality of life and allow him to provide better opportunities for his son.

He's requesting a US $300 loan to invest in a motorcycle, because most of his business consists of house calls. Having this mode of transportation will allow him to provide better service and also to get to his law school classes on time.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

El Seor Celso Pez tiene 41 aos, esta casado con la Seora Damiana Aquino, la pareja tiene un hijo varn de 8 aos de edad y que va a una escuela pblica del mismo Barrio. Su seora vende ropas y perfumes para damas y caballeros, actividad que la realiza casa por casa, pues no cuenta con un local fijo para la venta. Celso es propietario de una cerrajera en pleno centro de la ciudad, con una antigedad de 12 aos en el ramo, con buena clientela formada lo que le genera ingreso suficiente para cubrir gastos familiares. A pesar de las enormes responsabilidades que posee y de su edad, l realiza un sacrificio extraordinario para seguir estudiando, actualmente est cursando el 4to. Ao de la carrera de Derecho (Leyes) en una de las mejores universidades privadas de la ciudad. Su mayor sueo es poder culminar su carrera y ejercer la profesin, de esta forma mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y dar mayores oportunidades a su hijo. Solicita un crdito de $ 300 que los invertir en la compra de una motocicleta, ya que la mayora de sus trabajos los realiza a domicilio, este medio de transporte lo ayudar a agilizar y mejorar sus servicios, adems que le servir como medio de transporte para llegar a tiempo a las clases de la facultad.

loan.use: To purchase a motorcycle for business use

loan.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.en:
Maria del Socorro is a very hard working, enthusiastic woman who's been raising her three children on her own. Because the small pension she received wasn't sufficient to cover the family's basic expenses, she decided to start her own business selling cosmetics. Little by little, she gained more clients and increased her sales. Her wish to provide for her children and offer them a good education is what motivates her each day to improve and grow her business.

Maria del Socorro needs a loan in the amount of US $375, to be repaid in five months, to purchase merchandise for the new season and continue growing her business. She hopes you will want to play an important role in her business' growth and in the life of her family, and she thanks you for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria del Socorro es una mujer muy trabajadora y entusiasta, ella sola ha tenido que sacar adelante a sus tres hijos, como la pensin que reciba era muy baja e insuficiente para cubrir todos los gastos de su hogar decidi emprender su propio negocio con la venta de cosmticos, poco a poco fue incrementando sus ventas y gracias a su buen servicio su nmero de clientes tambin. El deseo de darle a sus hijos todo lo necesario y poder ofrecerles una buena educacin es lo que la motiva cada da a mejorar y hacer crecer su negocio.

En estos momentos Maria necesita un prstamo de $ 375 dlares que utilizar en la compra de mercanca para poder ofrecer a sus clientes productos de la nueva temporada y continuar creciendo con su negocio, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 5 meses. Se parte importante tanto en el crecimiento de este negocio como en la vida de Maria y su familia, ellos agradecen sinceramente tu apoyo.

loan.use: To purchase merchandise for the new season

loan.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is married, has three children - two of whom are married themselves - and lives in Apodaca in Nuevo Leon. Three years ago her husband was laid off from his job and they used his severance pay to invest in a small grocery store. Since then, they have expanded their inventory to better serve their customers and, as a result, their business has continued to grow. Her husband helps run the store in the morning and works as a blacksmith in the afternoon. Together they have forged ahead and provided a better life for their family.

Gloria is requesting a loan of US $550 to purchase additonal merchandise to meet the demand of her current customer base. She intends to repay this loan over a period of six months. Please be a part of her growing business. Gloria and her family sincerely thank you for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Gloria es casada, tiene tres hijos, dos de ellos ya estn casados, y vive en la localidad de Apodaca en Nuevo Len. Hace tres aos, despus de que su esposo perdiera su empleo, la liquidacin que recibi la utilizaron para invertir en su propio negocio con la venta de abarrotes, y poco a poco han ido surtiendo mejor la tienda para ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes y poder crecer. Ahora su esposo le ayuda por las maanas y por las tardes hace trabajos de herrera, juntos han logrado salir adelante con su familia y mejorar su calidad de vida.

Para poder continuar creciendo Gloria necesita un prstamo de $ 550 dlares que destinar a la compra de mercanca, esto le permitir cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes y conservar su preferencia, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Forma parte de los logros de Gloria, ella y su familia agradecen sinceramente el apoyo que les brindas.

loan.use: To purchase merchandise

loan.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo is a responsible and hard working man; he's married and has two small children. His wife works as a secretary. Seeking a better life for his family, he struck out on his own and began leasing a taxi cab five years ago. Since then, he's acquired many regular customers and has increased his income. His family's welfare is what motivates him to work hard each day.

He's seeking a loan in the amount of US $475, to be repaid over six months, which will be used to perform preventive maintenance on his taxicab. Your help can make a huge difference in his business and Eduardo and his family thank you for your trust and support.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Eduardo es un hombre muy trabajador y responsable, es casado y tiene dos pequeos hijos y su esposa trabaja como secretaria. En busca de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia decidi independizarse y trabajar por su cuenta rentando un taxi hace cinco aos, gracias a buen servicio que ofrece ha logrado tener clientes seguros e incrementar los ingresos que obtiene. El bienestar de su familia es lo que lo motiva a mejorar y esforzarse ms cada da.

Para continuar trabajando Eduardo solicita un prstamo de $ 475 dlares que emplear en el mantenimiento del taxi para evitar cualquier tipo de accidente que pudiera presentarse, l se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Tu ayuda es de mucha utilidad para este negocio, Eduardo y su familia agradecen sinceramente tu confianza y apoyo.

loan.use: Taxi maintenance

loan.name: Mario Alberto

texts.es:
Mario is married and has a 3 year old son. Facing a lack of jobs and the need to secure an income, Mario began selling snacks from a table he set up in front of his house. His home faces a plaza frequented by many people, and his business grew as a result of that traffic. When his wife became pregnant with their second child this summer, Mario sought to increase their income by selling yuckis, a drink made of crushed ice and flavored syrup, similar to a slushie. This was very well received in the summer months.

Mario is requesting a loan in the amount of US $750, to be repaid in 6 months, to purchase a cart to carry his products around to other plazas in the vicinity in order to increase his sales. He hopes you will want to support his growing business and thanks you for your assistance.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Mario es casado y tiene un pequeo hijo de 3 aos de edad. Ante la falta de empleo y la necesidad de contar con un ingreso Mario comenz a vender botanas en una mesa afuera de su casa y como enfrente hay una plaza su negocio comenz a crecer ya que pasan muchas personas por ese lugar, en este verano su esposa se embaraz de su segundo hijo y para poder lograr mayores recursos Mario incorpor a su negocio la venta de yuckis, que es una bebida a base de hielo picado con jarabe de sabores, muy consumido en temporada de calor, por lo que tuvo buena aceptacin de sus clientes.

En estos momentos Mario est solicitando un prstamo de $ 750 dlares que utilizar en la compra de un vehculo que le permita desplazar sus productos para venderlos en las plazas cercanas y poder hacer crecer su negocio, l se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Se parte importante en el crecimiento de este negocio y ayuda a quien ms lo necesita, muchas gracias.

loan.use: To buy a food cart and supplies/inventory

loan.name: Adelia

texts.en:
Adelia S. is married and has two children. Her husband's name is Pablino Gonzalez and he's 31 years old. Their children are minors and currently attend one of the city's public schools. The family lives in a rented house; the couple's fondest dream is to buy their own home, a goal towards which they are currently working.

Adelia is a trained seamstress and she specializes in curtains. She worked several years for a well known curtain manufacturer in the city. Because her salary wasn't enough to cover basic home expenses, she decided to start her own curtain business from home. She was soon joined by her husband and together they've developed a large clientele based on the high quality of their work.

Adelia is requesting a loan of US $200 to purchase fabric in order to accommodate a large order from one of her clients

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

La seora Adelia S. es casada y tiene 2 hijos, su marido se llama Pablino Gonzlez y tiene 31 aos. Sus hijos son menores de edad y actualmente estn estudiando en una escuela pblica de la ciudad. Ellos viven todos juntos en una casa alquilada; el mayor sueo de la pareja es poder adquirir su casa propia, para lo cual estn trabajando. Adelia es confeccionista y su especialidad son las cortinas, ella trabajo varios aos en una cortinera muy reconocida de la ciudad; como la remuneracin que perciba no alcanzaba para cubrir los gastos de la casa, ella decidi trabajar de forma independiente desde su casa junto con su marido que tambin se dedica a la confeccin; pronto adquirieron una buena cantidad de clientes ya que sus trabajos son de muy buena calidad. Adelia solicita un crdito de $ 200 que los invertir en la compra de telas, ya que ha recibido un pedido grande de cortinas de uno de sus clientes.

loan.use: To buy fabric

loan.name: Paola Yesenia

texts.en:
Paola is married and has been in business selling clothing and bedspreads for four years. The reason she started her business is that she and her husband have three small chidren and they have a lot of expenses. They currently rent a house and have been saving money from their jobs to buy a home of their own. Paola sells her merchandise at several markets four days a week while her mother watches her children.

Paola is requesting a loan in the amount of US $750, to be repaid over 6 months, to purchase additional merchandise for the new season; this will allow her to increase her sales and save more money towards a down payment for their home. She and her husband want to express their gratitude for your support of their effort and hard work.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Paola esta casada y tiene un negocio de venta de ropa y edredones, el cual inicio cuatro aos atrs. El motivo por el cual ella inici con su negocio fue por que ellos tienen tres hijos pequeos y el gasto es muy elevado, adems, como rentan el lugar donde viven el gasto es an mayor y estn juntando dinero de sus dos trabajos para poder comprar una pequea casa dando su enganche y as pagar mes a mes por algo que va a ser de ellos en un futuro, ella va cuatro das a la semana a vender a los mercados y su mam le cuida a sus pequeos hijos.

Paola esta solicitando un prstamo por la cantidad de US $ 750 para comprar pacas de ropa de temporada e incrementar sus ventas y as poder ahorrar ms para el enganche de su casa, ofreciendo pagar el crdito en 6 meses. Ella y su esposo te agradecen mucho por el apoyo que le brindas para poder tener un patrimonio propio a base de trabajo y esfuerzo.

loan.use: To buy additional merchandise

loan.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria T. R. , 38, has a little store (a tienda) up in the hills above Nebaj. Her house and store are surrounded by cornfields, but her family does not own any land beyond their house. She opened the tienda two years ago when she received her first loan. In her tienda she sells water, juice, bananas, oil, salt, fruits and other staples that her neighbors will stop by and purchase. Because there is not much work for the people in her town, they did not have money to buy her weavings so she turned to operating a tienda as a continuing source of income.

Maria is married and has 7 children. The youngest two school-age children have not started school yet because she does not have the money for clothes and school supplies. She herself never attended school and therefore cannot read, write, or do addition. Her older children help her in the tienda when there are sums to be done. Their schooling is already paying off.

Maria does still do some weaving. Her specialty is weaving huipils, a traditional top worn by most women in the village of Nebaj. She can produce one in 15 days and sells in the market for up to US$200.

Even though her husband makes money driving a little three-wheeled taxi (called a tuc-tuc, pronounced Tuuk-Tuuk), her dream is to have enough food daily to feed her family. A major struggle is buying medicine for when a member of her family is ill which luckily is not often. As they say here, "Gracias a Dios." Even aspirin and anti-acid medicine are extra expenses that are hard to fit into the family's limited budget.

Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva fellows

loan.use: To purchase stock for her store and yarn for weaving

loan.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana C. R., 37, raises goats. She also has one pig and sells cans of juice in the streets of Nebaj. When she receives this loan, she will take the bus to a fairly distant village to buy as many baby goats as she can she's hoping to get several. She will then walk home for many hours with the goats instead of taking the bus because she would be charged about US$3/each to bring the goats back by bus. She will leave at 3:00 in the morning and will arrive home well after dark.

Juana has been Friendship Bridge for the past 3 years. During a previous loan she had bought chickens to sell when full grown. The chickens all died after a brief illness so she decided to change to goats and pigs.

Her life has been hard and shows in every way possible. She is trying to work her way out of deep poverty she has experienced for all her life.. Both of her parents died in the Guatemalan civil war of the 1980s and early 1990s. And she lost most of the use of her right hand, including three fingers, in the war years.

She is married to a husband who works in the corn fields and they have 5 children. Though she is resource poor she is resourceful and looking forward to a brighter future.

Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows

loan.use: To purchase goats, pigs and juice to sell

loan.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena R. S. is 47 years old and weaves the beautiful Mayan tops called huipiles that are famous throughout the world. She can spend as much as a month weaving one, and then can sell it for about US$180, making a profit of about US$140. With this loan she will buy yarn for her weaving, as she has in four years of successful loans with the microfinance partner Friendship Bridge.

Elena has six children aged 16 to 27, and four grandchildren. Her fundamental goals in life are just to get her kids established, keep the younger ones in school, and somehow have a little bit of extra cash for food shortfalls and emergencies. Elena and her family do have some land they work several small plots of corn, and that helps with food for the family. Elena is a member of the group of women "Flor de Nebaj", or "Flower of Nebaj".

Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows

loan.use: Purchase yarn for weaving huipiles

loan.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria C. C., 42 years old, weaves traditional Mayan womans clothing, including belts called fajas, exquisite tops called huilpiles and head dressings called cintas. One huilpil can take up to two months to make depending on the design, and sells for up to US$200. Some of the designs tell a story of the region and others are unique designs created by the artist. A hair piece called a cinta can take up to 15 days to create and can sell for US$35. As with all traditional women's clothing in the mountains of Guatemala, the special designs signify what village a woman comes from.

This loan will be used to buy more yarn for weaving. Before joining Friendship Bridge Maria had no access to credit and it was difficult to make money weaving just because the yarn was so expensive, costing up to US$40 for the yarn to make a huipil.

Marias husband died a couple of years ago when he got drunk and drowned in a lake nearby. With a total of seven children, she must now raise the five youngest by herself. The two teenage daughters who still live at home are also weavers and help support the family. They attend school on the weekends so they can work during the week. All the school age children attend school, something Maria never had the opportunity to do. She never learned to read or write, speaks just a little bit of Spanish, and signs her name with a thumbprint impression. Her native language is Ixil.

Maria's adobe home has a dirt floor and has electricity and water but the water must be boiled before consuming.

Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows.

loan.use: Purchase yarn for her weaving

loan.name: Zafar

texts.ru:
Zafar is 29 years old and has 2 children. He and his wife sell personal care products. These include shampoo, tooth paste, hair coloring, products to take care of the body and many other things. Demand for these types of products is high and brings steady profits. In addition to selling his products at the markets, Zafar sells his products from home where he has a small store. Recently his business had a hard period, when the tax authorities demanded that he get a special license to sell self-care products. The costs of such a license are too high and would not have allowed Zafar to earn a profit. This type of license is used for wholesale dealers. Today, the issue has been resolved and the special license is not necessary.

A year ago Zafar received a loan from MicroInvest and included more expensive shampoos and soaps in his inventory. This attracted many customers and increased profits. He purchases his products by traveling to wholesale markets and also receives deliveries from wholesale dealers. Business is going very well and Zafar would like to take out a new loan to purchase additional products.

Zafars wife is pictured in the photo.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

. , , , . . , . , . . . . . . . . . P.S. 29 2 .

loan.use: to purchase more goods

loan.name: Salomat

texts.ru:
Salomat is 48 years old. Her husband passed away and left her with 7 children. In addition to her there are 16 other members of her family that live together: 2 sons with their families and 4 non-adult daughters. The oldest daughter recently got married and lives with her husband.

Sources of income need to be found to feed such a large quantity of people. The two sons drive people in vans on local routes, while Salomat sells traditional Tajik flatbread at the market. She has been doing this for several years. Early in the morning one of her sons drives the flatbread to the market, helps her to arrange it on the counter and then leaves for his job. One of the daughters helps Salomat to sell. Salomat has many regular clients and she sells all of her flatbread in 3 hours. 5 months ago the price of flatbread increased slightly and Salomat decided to get a loan from MicroInvest. The loan brought additional profits and since then she has been borrowing continuously. She plans to use the new loan to further expand her business.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

48 . 7 . 16 . 2 4 . . . 2 , ( ). . , . . 3 . 5 , . . .

loan.use: to expand business

loan.name: Muattar

texts.ru:
Muattar is a teacher by profession and works in a high school. She is 44 years old and is married, but does not have children. Her husband is in Russia earning money. A teachers salary is not enough to live on, so she sells goods at the markets. Her sister Nasiba helps her. Muattar specialized in childrens clothing and footwear. The profits from her business help her to cover part of the family expenditures.

Her past loan from MicroInvest helped Muattar to expand her small business. She plans on using the new loan to purchase school uniforms. In the photo is her sister Nasiba. Muattar was teaching school on the day that the photo was taken.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

. 44 , , . . . . . . . . , .

loan.use: to purchase school uniforms

loan.name: Dilbar

texts.ru:
Dilbar and her husband are businesspeople. Dilbar sells socks and various small goods and her husband sells spare auto parts. She is 33 years old and has 3 small children. Her business experience of around 6 years is relatively large. Dilbar started in business by selling childrens clothing, but soon transitioned to selling small goods (mens and womens socks, handkerchiefs, etc.) since this brings higher profits and there is no leftover inventory. Dilbars mother-in-law watches her children so that Dilbar can work at the market.

Dilbar has been borrowing money from MicroInvest for 2 years. She started by borrowing $100. Slowly she increased the amounts that she has borrowed until she had reached her current loan request of $1000, which she will use to increase her inventory.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

. , . 33 3 . 6 . , ( , ..), . . 2 , . $100. $1000. .

loan.use: To increase quantity of goods

loan.name: Husen

texts.ru:
Husen works on a collective farm. He is married and has 3 children. At home he has farm animals and every year his family and he dry apricots. He takes apricots from the collective farm that are allocated to him for his work. He also purchases apricots from other farmers in order to increase his profits. The prices for dried apricots increase as winter gets closer and Husen then sells them. The profits go towards family expenditures.

Last year Husen got a loan from MicroInvest for the purchase of apricots. That loan brought him good profits. This year he plans on getting a new loan for the processing and storage of dried apricots. In the photo is Husens family processing apricots.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

. 3 . . , . . , . . . . . .

loan.use: for purchase, drying and storage apricots

loan.name: Boltaboi

texts.ru:
Boltaboi and his wife have been retired for a long time, but they cant sit at home doing nothing. Boltaboi is 60 years old and his wife is 56 years old, they have 4 children. Boltaboi and his wife have been selling at the markets for several years. They sell onions, potatoes and carrots. These products are in high demand as they are a necessity. Boltaboi brings the products and his wife sells them. During one market day Boltaboi sells up to 150 kilograms of potatoes, and 200 kilograms each of onions and carrots. Profits are small, but they have no other source of income.

Boltaboi is a recent client of MicroInvest, but he has already shown himself to be an exemplary client. He plans to use the requested loan to purchase potatoes and onions.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

, . 60 , 56 . 4 . . , . , . . 150 , , 200 . . , . , . .

loan.use: to purchase potatoes and onions

loan.name: Suon

texts.en: Mrs. Suon S. is a 62 year old widow living in Kampong Cham Province with her daughter and son-in-law (pictured here). She works at a small cereal shop in her village and earns about $3/day. Her daughter is a merchant at the local market, and her son-in-law runs a business recharging vehicle batteries in their home. These business combined give the family enough income for sustaining their lives, but they would like to expand their businesses. This loan will be used to purchase a trailer so they can more easily transport their goods.

loan.use: To purchase a trailer for business transportation

loan.name: Angela, Ricarda /joc

texts.en:
Angela Maria R. and her sister, Ricarda, were born in the town of Nagua, about 80 miles north of Santo Domingo, the capital of the Dominican Republic. They ran a beauty parlor there for several months before relocating to Santo Domingo with their families. Their shop has been in its new location for 8 months and is doing very well. Angela Maria has four children and Ricarda has one child (seen here in photo). They all live together in the same house with their mother, and the salon is located in an extension of the house. Even though the shop is small, they can work on at least two customers at the same time.

Angela and Ricarda have applied for a loan in part to buy a small power generator so that their shop can continue to operate during the eight to ten hours a day when the electricity is out in their neighborhood.

They are also interested in opening up a new business with their partner, Jocelyn B., to sell natural and herbal remedies produced by a company called Natura International. To make this possible, Angela and Ricarda have applied for loans of $350 each, and Jocelyn for a loan of $200, for a total of $900.

Sale of natural and herbal remedies is a recent development in this area, but the activity sounds very promising. Until this business has proved itself, however, securing loans will be difficult. But we believe the fact that these three women are working together to make it happen is a good sign that bodes well for repayment of the loan. Also, the beauty parlor is profitable and can help them withstand early losses from the newer herbal business. That's one reason why, for purposes of this loan, we are considering these women as part of one team.

loan.use: Emergency power plant and sales of herbal medicine.

loan.name: Hai

texts.en: Mrs. Hai H., 32 years old, lives in Kampong Cham and earns a living selling fish and raising pigs. She earns about $5/day from her business activities, and her husband (pictured here) earns $5/day as well working as a mechanic. This income allows the couple to send their 3 young children to school, something they are very proud of. This loan will be used for Mrs. Hai H. to purchase more pigs and build a pig pen to handle the animals. She hopes to continue growing her business by buying more and more pigs.

loan.use: To purchase more pigs and to build a pig pen

loan.name: Chab

texts.en: Mrs. Chab Y. is 59 years old and lives in Kampong Cham with her husband and their 4 children. Mrs. Chab works as a farmer, growing rice crops and fresh vegetables. She will use this loan to purchase bean seeds for her family's farm.

loan.use: To purchase bean seeds to grow in her farm

payment.comment:
Congratulations! Chab Yun has repaid this Kiva loan early!
Thanks to lenders like you, entrepreneurs around the world have access to low-interest loans to help them support their small businesses and daily expenses. We hope that you will continue investing in Kiva entrepreneurs.
Sincerely, Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loan.name: Nidia

texts.en:
Nidia N. is a young, newlywed woman who comes from a broken home. Her father left soon after she was born, and her mother abandoned her when she was one year old to flee to Panama. Nidia has hoped to meet her mother for as long as she can remember, and prays that she will not leave earth without first doing this.

There are two ways in which Nidia can achieve this dream. The first is from a local television progam, which is holding out the hope that it may sponsor a trip. The second is by raising the money on her own, although this will mean that she and her husband, Jose, may not be able to have children for a while. But Nidia and Jose are willing to put this off so she can realize her dream of meeting her mother.

In the past, Nidia operated her own beauty salon, but today has worked out an arrangement with a business partner who puts up all the capital in exchange for her doing all the work. Nidia would like to go back to operating her own salon because that would allow her to keep everything she earns, and also because she believes that her partner is not very knowledgable about the business they are in.

Nidia has requested a loan of $350, which will permit her to open her own business, using equipment she has at home. This will allow her to fulfill her dream of being self-employed, and also give her the opportunity to raise enough money to one day meet her mother in person.

loan.use: Business set up

loan.name: Mich

texts.en: Mrs. Mich T., 48 years old, lives in Kampong Cham and sells vegetable and fruit for a living. She earns about $2/day in her sales activities and her husband earns $2.5/day working as a teacher. The couple also supports Mrs. Mich T.'s mother and their 2 children. This loan will be used to purchase sugarcane and a motorcycle for transporting her product.

loan.use: To purchase sugar cane for her inventory and a motorcycle for her business transportation

loan.name: Elman

texts.en: Elman I. was born in 1951. He is married with four children, and lives in Khaladj, in the Salyan region of Azerbaijan. Elman has bred sheep for 10 years and he is applying for a loan of $825 to buy fodder for them.

loan.use: To buy feed for his animals

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To expand her paint business

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To expand her clothes-selling business

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To expand her used apparel business

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To start a grocery shop

loan.name: Yous

texts.en: Mrs. Yous C., 25 years old, lives in Kampong Cham province with her husband, a construction worker, their two children, and her parents. Mrs. Yous C. works as a farmer, raising mostly pigs and growing some other crops. She will use this loan to purchase pigs and feed for her farm. In the future, she hopes to raise more animals like ducks and chickens.

loan.use: To purchase pigs and feed to raise on her farm.

loan.name: Roth

texts.en: Mrs. Roth N. is 53 years old and lives in Kampong Cham with her husband (pictured here) and their 5 children. She works on the family's farm and also sells Khmer noodles to local villagers. She earns about $1/day selling noodles and the family earns $2/day from their farming activities. Three of the children work at a garment factory and help to supply the house with income. This loan will be used to purchase a pump for cultivating their crops.

loan.use: To purchase a pump for cultivating their crops

loan.name: Te

texts.en: Mrs. Te P. is a single 35 year old living in Kampong Cham. She works selling fish at the local market, and earns $1/day. She is hoping to expand her business, and this loan will help her to purchase more fish. She is confident that this will help to increase her income and she hopes her business continues to grow.

loan.use: To purchase more fish

payment.comment: Te Phar has successfully paid off her Kiva-financed loan early! Thank you for helping her to expand her business!

loan.name: Ten

texts.en: Mrs. Ten S. is 24 years old, married, and has 2 children. She works selling a variety of fruits, giving her $4/day income. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver and can earn $2/day. This loan will be used to purchase more fruits for her business. She hopes she can continue to expand her business so that she can support her children.

loan.use: To purchase more fruit for her business

loan.name: Him

texts.en: Mrs. Him S. is 38 years old and lives in Prey Veng Province with her husband and their 7 children. She currently works selling sugar cane juice at the market, and can earn $2/day. Her husband is an electrician and earns $2.5/day. The family would like to use this loan to build a store for the electrical business, because the husband and three of their children are all electricians. They hope this loan will help to start their business where the entire family can work together.

loan.use: To build a store

loan.name: Pich

texts.en: Mrs. Pich S. is 34 years old and lives in Phnom Penh with her husband and their two children. She works part-time at a garment factory, and part-time renting out rooms. Combined, she can earn $4/day, while her husband earns $6/day working as a bodyguard. This loan will be used to build more rooms for renting.

loan.use: To build rooms for renting

loan.name: Mom

texts.en: Mrs. Mom D. is 42 years old and lives in Phnom Penh. She works selling groceries, and earns $5/day, while her husband (pictured here with one of their children) works as a tuk-tuk driver. The couple is able to support their 3 children and send them to school everyday. This loan will be used to purchase more grocery items for selling.

loan.use: To purchase grocery items

loan.name: Heng

texts.en: Mr. Heng V. is 35 years old and works as a mechanic in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. He earns $3.80/day, and his wife earns $2.70/day working at a nearby garment factory. This loan will be used to build a home for the couple and their only child.

loan.use: To build a house

payment.comment:
Congratulations! Heng Veasna has fully repaid this Kiva loan early.
Thank you for your support of Cambodian entrepreneurs. Lenders like you allow entrepreneurs around the world access to low-interest loans to finance their small businesses and support their families.
We hope you will continue your support by reinvesting in another Kiva entrepreneur.
Sincerely, Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loan.name: Ky

texts.en: Mrs. Ky S., her husband, and their four children (two of them pictured here) live in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. Mrs. Ky S. currently works as a grocer, earning $8/day, while her husband earns $6/day working as a motor-taxi driver. They will use this loan to build rooms for renting, a business they hope to expand in the future.

loan.use: To build rooms for renting

loan.name: Sok

texts.en: Mrs. Sok L. is 45 years old and lives in Phnom Penh with her husband and their 3 children (one of their sons is pictured here). Mrs. Sok wells water convolvulus (a semi-aquatic plant) and earns $8/day. Her husband is a construction worker and also works on the family farm to raise the crops. This loan will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizer for their farm so that they can continue producing profitable crops.

loan.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer for her farm

loan.name: Sak

texts.en: Mrs. Sak S. is 38 years old and lives in Phnom Penh with her husband and their 7 children. She works selling vegetables, a job that earns her $4/day of income. Her husband is a fisherman, and earns $3/day. One of Mrs. Sak S.'s sons is a moto-taxi driver, and she will use this loan to purchase a motorbike for him. This will increase his income, as well as the family's income.

loan.use: To purchase a motorbike for her son's business

loan.name: Firuza

texts.en:
Firuza is young business lady. She is 19 years old. She lives with her parents. She is a very cheerful girl. She wants to earn money and help her parents.

Her business is sellling perfumes, located on second floor of the Panjshanbe market. She is renting a little place outside of the shops, from which she takes goods and sells them in her trading place.

Firuza is one of the new clients of Micro Invest. She became a client in 2006. Her first loan was $ 00. She spent it for expanding her assortment.Today she has several regular clients and she always tries to meet their needs. In future she wants to include new kinds of goods in her business. For this purpose she is requesting $300.

loan.use: Add to her assortment of merchandise

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To expand her loose tea-selling business

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To expand her food-selling business

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To expand her food and charcoal sales business

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To expand her charcoal-selling business

loan.name: Ivan

texts.en:
Ivan is married and has a daughter who is seven years old. Two years ago, he left his job to go into business as a self-employed taxi driver because he wanted a stable daily salary. The move has paid off. Currently he makes around $30-$40 a day in gross profit, and even after expenses he is still able to earn a good income. Ivan is working to pay off the loan on his car, and has partnered with a taxi-dispatching company which provides him with a steady supply of good customers.

Ivan has requested a loan of $500 to help purchase a license to operate his taxi, which he needs to continue driving, and to repair his cab's meter. This is the second loan Ivan has requested from Nadiya Ukraine. We are confident that he will continue to be a great client and repay this loan on time.

loan.use: Purchase a taxi license and repair his taxi

loan.name: Mariya

texts.en: Mariya is a widow who lives in Mukachevo, a small city in the western Ukraine. She supports herself by running a little grocery store, which gives her an income of about $800 per month. Mariya has been in business for eight years and has developed a very stable enterprise. She has requested a loan of $1,200 to increase her working capital so that she can purchase new inventory and take care of some expenses. Her goal is to continue to build her business and increase her profits and income.

loan.use: Increase working capital

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To expand her charcoal-selling business

loan.name: Abdusamad

texts.ru:
Abdusamad is 32 years old, he is married and has 1 child. Abdusamad began his business 5 years ago by offering computer services to the clients. Eventually, he expanded the business and added new services, such as connecting to mobile operators and increasing the balance on special cards that are used to add money to the account. Because of the technologies involved, this business requires capital investments. In addition, the business employs two people that receive salaries. With his first microcredit from MicroInvest, Abdusamad purchased a fax machine, a scanner, and cards to add money to the account. Currently, he is planning to purchase a new computer and is, therefore, asking for a new microcredit loan.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva Volunteer.

32 , 1 . 5 . , . . 2 , . , . .

loan.use: to purchase new computer

loan.name: Eusebio

texts.es:
Mr. Eusebio A. lives with his wife in his own home in the Sopocachi neighborhood of La Paz. Eusebio is a construction worker, who depends on building jobs,and his wife runs a small grocery store from their home.

With previous loans from IMPRO, he demolished two rooms made of adobe that were in danger of collapsing, and constructed a structure of two floors with new rooms. The requested loan is to do the rough construction of two rooms using brick. Due to his payment history with IMPRO, he is considered a "preferential customer" and is approved for a new loan.

Translated by Ramon F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer

Original description in Spanish:

El seor Eusebio A. vive en casa propia en la zona de sopocachi de la Ciudad de la Paz con su esposa. Eusebio trabaja como empleado de la construccin, dependiendo su trabajo de las obras de edificacin que pueda construir, y su esposa tiene una pequea tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio. Con crditos anteriores en Impro procedi a demoler dos habitaciones de adobe que se encontraban en peligro de derrumbe, y construy la estructura en dos niveles para habitaciones nuevas. El crdito solicitado ser destinado a la construccin de dos habitaciones de ladrillo en obra gruesa. Su antecedente histrico con Impro, lo califica como cliente preferencial y puede acceder un nuevo crdito.

loan.use: to construct 2 rooms

loan.name: Kate

texts.en: Mrs. Kate Ewhrudgakpo is 36 years old and has 4 children. She lives in Nigeria, specifically Benin City in Edo State. She is a fashion designer. She needs this loan to buy an additional machine and fabrics. She has been in this business since 1995.

loan.use: To buy an additional sewing machine & tailoring materials

loan.name: Pablo

texts.es:
Mr. Pablo Mendizbal lives in his own home in the Pasankeri district on the western end of the city of La Paz with his mother and his 8 year old daughter. Pablo is a teacher and works in the school district of the City of La Paz. With his previous loans with Impro he constructed a retaining wall to help stabalize his home. The loan requested will be used to complete the construction of an additional room of brick and stone. His past history with Impro and the socio-economic analysis qualify him as a preferred customer and he is able to accept a new loan. The two previous loans with Impro have been paid in full.

Translated from Spanish by Christian Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

El seor Pablo Mendizbal vive en casa propia en la zona de Pasankeri ladera oeste de la Ciudad de La Paz con su madre y su pequea hija de 8 aos; Pablo es profesor y trabaja en el magisterio de la ciudad de La Paz. Con los crditos anteriores en Impro construy un muro de contencin para estabilizar su vivienda. El crdito solicitado ser destinado a la construccin completa de una habitacin de ladrillo sobre loza de hormign armado. Su antecedente histrico con Impro, y el anlisis socio econmico lo califica como cliente preferencial y puede acceder un nuevo crdito. Los dos creditos anteriores con IMPRO han sido cancelados en su totalidad.

loan.use:
Construction of an additional room

Construccion de una habitacion

loan.name: Jessica Ayekohien

texts.en: Mrs. Jessica O. is 26 years old, married and has no kids. She lives in Benin City in Edo state in Nigeria. She owns a chemist store. Jessica plans to buy more drugs with her next loan. She has been with LAPO for four years.

loan.use: To buy more drugs to sell

loan.name: Romer

texts.es:
Mr. Romer Alarcn lives with his parents in their home in the Pasankeri district on the western side of the City of La Paz with his wife and 3 and 1 y.o. sons. Mr. Romel works for a security business in our city and his wife is a housewife. The family currently occupies a room borrowed from his parents that can be uncomfortable. The requested loan will be used to construct a room in the rear of the home that will be more comfortable and will be the start of future loans that will allow them to build a small, seperate home. This is their first request for a loan and the socioeconomic analysis conducted favorably qualifies them and allows them to achieve greater credit worthiness.

Translated from Christian Garcia by Christian Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

El seor Romer Alarcn vive en casa de sus padres en la zona de Pasankeri ladera oeste de la Ciudad de La Paz con su esposa y sus hijos de 3 y 1 ao de edad; el seor Romel trabaja como empleado en una empresa de seguridad de nuestra ciudad y su esposa es ama de casa. Actualmente ocupan una habitacin cedida por sus padres que ocasionan cierta incomodidad a la pareja como a sus progenitores. El crdito solicitado ser destinado a la construccin completa de una habitacin en la parte posterior de la vivienda que les dar mayor comodidad y ser el inicio para con futuros crditos puedan edificar una pequea vivienda independiente. Esta es la primera vez que solicitan un prstamo y el anlisis socioeconmico realizado los califica favorablemente y puede acceder un nuevo crdito.

loan.use:
Construction of a room

Construccion de una habitacion

loan.name: Magda

texts.es:
Like many Bolivian women, Magda is a single mother. She has a three-year-old daughter. Magda has no family and lives with her guardians, who reared her since she was two years old. She sells cow's milk and also has a small truck farm where she raises vegetables, which she sells in the city of La Paz. These are the primary sources of income for her and her young daughter.

They live in the region of Palomar Rio Abajo, to the south of La Paz and about an hour and a half from the city.

She would use the loan to buy a milk cow so that she can increase production. This is her first loan with IMPRO; The evaluation conducted qualifies her to receive this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio and Sarah Padial, Kiva Volunteers

from the city.Magda, como muchas mujeres bolivianas es madre soltera de una hija de tres aos de edad, no tiene familia vive con sus tutores que le criaros desde sus dos aos de edad. Es productora de leche de vaca y se dedica a la pequea agricultura de hortalizas que comercializa en la Ciudad de La Paz; estos son sus ingresos principales con que se mantiene ella y su pequea hija. Vive en la Comunidad de Palomar Rio Abajo (Ubicado al Sur de la ciudad de La Paz, a una hora y media de esta ciudad). El crdito le invertir en la compra de una vaca de raza mediana para incrementar la produccin de leche. Es el primer crdito con Impro, la evaluacin realizada le califica para otorgarle el prstamo.

loan.use: To buy a milk cow

loan.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia has a small dairy and grows vegetables, which she sells in the city of La Paz. Her husband has a minibus, which he drives for the interprovincial public transportation system. These are the primary sources of income with which they support their two school-age children, fifteen and sixteen years old.

They live in the region of Palomar Ri Abajo, to the sourth of La Paz and about an hour and a half from the city.

She would use the loan to buy a milk cow so that she could increase production and raise the family's income. This is her first loan with IMPRO. The evaluation conducted qualifies her to receive this loan, with which she hopes to improve her family's living standard.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio and Sarah Padial, Kiva Volunteers

Lidia, es productora de leche de vaca y es agricultora de hortalizas, las mismas que comercializa en la ciudad de La Paz; el esposo tiene su minibs que trabaja de transporte pblico interprovincial; estos son los ingresos principales que les permite la manutencin de sus dos hijos de 16, 15 y 12 de edad que estan en la edad escolar. Vive en la Comunidad de Palomar Ri Abajo (Ubicado al Sur de la ciudad de La Paz, a una hora y media de esta ciudad). El crdito lo invertir en la compra de una vaca de raza mediana para incrementar la produccin de leche y mejorar sus ingresos familiares. Es el primer crdito con Impro, la evaluacin realizada le permite acceder al prstamo y de esa forma mejorar sus condiciones de vida su familia.

loan.use: To buy a milk cow

loan.name: Esther

texts.en: Mrs. Esther O. has been the union leader for LAPO for seven years. She is 50 years old and is married with six children. She is from the urban area of Benin City in Edo State, Nigeria. She sells wholesale and retail raw food items. She needs this money to buy more raw food items to sell.

loan.use: To improve her business

loan.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
Cecilia sells cow's milk, home-grown vegetables, and flowers for commercial resale. Her husband is a salaried driver for the intreprovincial public transportation system. These are the main sources of income with which they support their five children, 21, 20, 17, 15, and 12 years old. One child attends the university; the others go to school.

They live in the region of Palomar Rio Abajo, to the south of La Paz and about an hour and a half from the city.

They would use the loan to buy a milk cow so that they can increase production and raise the family's income. This is her first loan with IMPRO. The evaluation conducted qualifies her to receive this loan, with which she hopes to improve their standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio and Sarah Padialk, Kiva Volunteers

Cecilia, es productora de leche de vaca y es agricultora de hortalizas y comerciante de Flor; el esposo es chofer asalariado de transporte pblico interprovincial; estos son los ingresos principales que les permite la manutencin de sus cinco hijos de 21, 20, 17, 15 Y 12 de edad, uno esta en la universidad y los otros estn en edad escolar. Vive en la Comunidad de Palomar Ri Abajo (Ubicado al Sur de la ciudad de La Paz, a una hora y media de esta ciudad). El crdito lo invertir en la compra de una vaca de raza mediana para incrementar la produccin de leche y mejorar sus ingresos familiares. Es el primer crdito con Impro, la evaluacin realizada le permite acceder al prstamo y de esa forma mejorar las condiciones de vida su familia.

loan.use: To buy a milk cow

loan.name: Santusa

texts.es:
Santusa runs a small dairy and farm where she grows vegetables such as parsley, lettuce, sweet corn, turnips, and so on. Her husband is a salaried driver for the interprovincial public transportation system. They derive their family income from these efforts, and they support a 16-year-old son, who helps out on the farm.

Santusa lives in the region of Palomar--Rio Abajo, to the south of La Paz and about an hour and a half from the city.

She would use the loan to buy a milk cow so that she can increase production. This is her first loan with IMPRO. The evaluation conducted qualifies her to receive this loan, with which she hopes to increase the family's income.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio and Sarah Padial, Kiva Volunteers

Santusa, es productora de leche de vaca y es pequea agricultora de hortalizas como ser el perejil, lechuga, choclo, nabo, etc., el esposo es chofer asalariado de transporte pblico interprovincial. Sus ingresos familiares provienen de estas actividades, con lo que se mantienen, tiene un hijo de 16 aos que ayuda con el trabajo del campo. Santusa vive en la Comunidad de Palomar Ri Abajo (Ubicado al Sur de la ciudad de La Paz, a una hora y media de esta ciudad). El crdito lo invertir en la compra de una vaca de raza mediana para incrementar la produccin de leche. Es el primer crdito con Impro, la evaluacin realizada le permite acceder al prstamo y de esa forma incrementar sus ingresos familiares.

loan.use: To buy a milk cow

loan.name: Fausto

texts.es:
Fausto has a small dairy and grows vegetables and fowers, which his wife sells in the city of La Paz. They derive their income from these efforts, which is just enough to make ends meet. They have two children who help out on the farm and no longer go to school.

They live in the region of Palomar--Rio Abajo, to the south of La Paz and about an hour and a half from the city.

He would use the loan to buy a milk cow to increase his production and raise his income. This is his first loan with IMPRO. The evaluation conducted qualifies him to receive this loan, with which he hopes to improve his family's standard of living.

Translated from the Spanish by Antonio and Sarah Padial, Kiva Volunteers

Fausto, es productor de leche de vaca y es agricultor de hortalizas y flores que su esposa comercializa en la Ciudad de La Paz; sus ingresos provienen de estas actividades y alcanzan exactamente para mantener a su familia; tiene dos hijos que le ayudan con el trabajo del campo y ya no estn estudiando. Vive en la Comunidad de Palomar Ri Abajo (Ubicado al Sur de la ciudad de La Paz, a una hora y media de esta ciudad). El crdito ser utilizado en la compra de una vaca de raza mediana para incrementar la produccin de leche y mejorar sus ingresos familiares. Es el primer crdito con Impro, la evaluacin realizada le permite acceder al prstamo y de esa forma mejorar sus condiciones de vida su familia.

loan.use: To buy a milk cow

loan.name: Doris

texts.en: Mrs. Doris Omoragbon is 40 years old and is happily married with five children. She hails from Benin City in Edo State in Nigeria. She has been with LAPO for four years as a union leader. She sells provisions and food stuff. This loan will be used to buy more food stuff and provisions.

loan.use: To buy more goods to sell

loan.name: Gregorio

texts.es:
Gregorio grows vegetables and also works for other vegetable growers. He derives his income from these efforts, with which he supports himself.

He lives in the region of Palomar--Rio Abajo, to the south of La Paz and about an hour and a half from the city.

He would use the loan to buy a milk cow, to restart the small dairy he had in the past but is currently not in business. He hopes to increase his income by means of this newly restarted business.

This is his first loan with IMPRO. The evaluation conducted qualifies him to receive this loan, with which he hopes to enter a new phase as a micro-entrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio and Sarah Padial, Kiva Volunteers

Gregorio, es pequeo agricultor de hortalizas y realiza trabajo como empleado para otros productores de hortalizas. Sus ingresos provienen de estas actividades con lo que se mantiene. Vive en la Comunidad de Palomar Ri Abajo (Ubicado al Sur de la ciudad de La Paz, a una hora y media de esta ciudad). El crdito lo requiere para comprar una vaca de raza mediana para reactivar la produccin de leche que tenia en el pasado, pero que actualmente esta paralizada. Con esta nueva actividad espera mejorar sus ingresos. Es el primer crdito con Impro, la evaluacin realizada le permite acceder al prstamo y as empezar una nueva etapa como micro-empresario.

loan.use: To buy a milk cow

loan.name: Rocio

texts.es:
Rocio runs a small bakery where she makes all kinds of baked goods (cakes, cookies, pastries, bread, and so on). Her home and bakery are in the La Merced neighborhood of La Paz. She is single and has more than twelve years of experience in this line of work.

This is her first loan request. She would use the loan as investment capital (to buy an oven, flour, sugar, and so on). Her work history qualifies her for this loan. She has experience in pastrymaking and brings in enough money to cover the loan as well as her personal expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio and Sarah Padial, Kiva Volunteers

Rocio tiene un horno donde elabora todo trabajo referente a repostera (tortas, galletas, masitas, pan, etc.) Su domicilio y su horno se encuentran ubicados en la zona de Villa La Merced de la ciudad de La Paz; es soltera y tiene experiencia de trabajo ms de 12 aos.. Es la primera vez que solicita un crdito. El monto solicitado ser destinado para capital de inversin (compra de horno, y harina, azcar, y otros) Su trabajo le permite acceder a este crdito ya que tiene experiencia en la repostera, actividad que le da ingresos para cubrir tanto el prstamo como sus necesidades personales.

loan.use: To buy an oven, flour, sugar, and so on

loan.name: Juliet

texts.en: Mrs. Juliet U. is happily married with four children, she is 44 years old and is from Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. She is a tailor and would like a loan to buy a new sewing machine machine and fabric.

loan.use: To buy sewing machines and fabric for her tailoring business

loan.name: Milton

texts.es:
Milton has a Nissan that he uses as a radio-dispatched taxi for the Apolo Radiotaxi Company.

His house is in the Villa Armonia district of La Paz. He is single and has one year of experience in this line of work.

This is his first loan request. He would use the loan to buy a two-way dispatch radio for his taxi; currently he rents the radio he uses. In this way Milton could avoid the monthly payment for rental of his radio, and he would benefit by having a mountain of extra change in his pocket.

His work qualifies him to receive this loan, because he has experience in transportation and he has sufficient income to cover loan repayments and personal expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio and Sarah Padial, Kiva Volunteers

Milton tiene un vehiculo Nissan que trabaja como radio taxi en la Compaa de Radio-taxis Apolo. Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de villa Armonia de la ciudad de La Paz; es soltero y tiene experiencia de trabajo de un ao. Es la primera vez que solicita un crdito. El monto solicitado ser destinado para capital de inversin (compra de radio de comunicacin) ya que actualmente el alquila una radio. De esta forma Milton podr evitar el gasto mensual de alquilar una radio y se vera beneficiado con un monto extra de dinero en su bolsillo. Su trabajo le permite acceder a este crdito ya que tiene experiencia en transporte, lo cual le da ingresos para cubrir el prstamo y sus necesidades personales.

loan.use: To buy a two-way dispatch radio

loan.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos has a Toyota that he uses in his work with the Apolo Radiotaxi Company. His wife is a businesswoman. They have one school-age son.

Their house is in the Villa Armonia district of La Paz.

This is Juan Carlos's second loan with IMPRO. His history with IMPRO qualifies him as a first-tier client; that is, his repayment history is excellent. He would use the loan to repair the engine, buy tires, and perform general maintenance on the the vehicle. His credit and work history qualify him to receive this loan; he has experience and his work generates enough income to allow loan repayment.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio and Sarah Padial, Kiva Volunteers

Historia del Cliente: Juan Carlos tiene un vehiculo marca toyota, trabaja como radio taxi en la Compaa de Radio-taxis Apolo; su esposa es comerciante y tienen un hijo en edad escolar. Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de villa Armonia de la ciudad de La Paz. Es segunda vez que solicita un crdito de IMPRO. Su historial en nuestra institucin lo califica como cliente 1, es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su obligacin. El monto solicitado ser destinado para la arreglo de motor, compra de llantas y un mantenimiento completo del vehiculo. Sus antecedentes crediticios y trabajo le permiten acceder a este crdito ya que tiene experiencia en su negocio, el cual le da ingresos para cubrir el prstamo.

loan.use: Auto maintenance

loan.name: Sadatu

texts.en: Mrs. Sadatu B. is 36 years old and married with four children. She hails from Benin City, Edo State in Nigeria. She sells men's & ladies' wear and she needs the above amount to buy clothes, shoes and bags to sell. She has 15 years of experience in her business.

loan.use: To improve her business

loan.name: Janelia

texts.en:
Janelia A. is a single mother of four living in Trou-Du-Nord, Haiti. She supports her four young children through her local community food business. Although Janelia only has the equivalent of an elementary school education, she has proven to be very resourceful in meeting the needs of her customers by providing a mobile delivery service. Since she lacks a physical storefront, Janelia is often seen walking the streets of her community, faithfully delivering her customers' orders to their homes. She will use this first loan to expand the inventory of her store with foods such as rice and nuts.

Note: Janelia is one of five microentrepreneurs in her Bank of Hope solidarity group, all of whom have gone through Esperanza's business training courses. Each of the five members will receive a share of this $750 loan for his or her respective businesses and will be accountable to each other for repaying his or her share of this loan together. This group-lending methodology ensures that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their businesses and families.

loan.use: Expand her inventory with rice and nuts.

loan.name: Tina

texts.en: Mrs. Tina O. will buy more provisions and food stuff with her next loan. She lives in Benin City, Edo state in Nigeria. She is 39 years old and is single. She has been with LAPO for two years.

loan.use: To buy more goods to sell

loan.name: Isoken

texts.en: Mrs. Isoken E. is 48 years old and is happily married with 8 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State in Nigeria. She has been with LAPO for two years. She sells ladies' wear and needs this loan to buy more clothes, shoes and bags to sell.

loan.use: To improve her business

loan.name: Ajanatu

texts.en: Mrs. Ajanatu J. is fifty years old and is happily married with seven children. She lives in the urban area of Benin City, Edo State in Nigeria. She sells drinks, both wholesale and retail. She needs the above amount to buy more drinks to sell. She has been a LAPO member for five years.

loan.use: To buy more goods to sell

loan.name: Luzanie

texts.en:
Luzanie S. is a dressmaker in the town of Trou-Du-Nord, Haiti. Through her home-based business, Luzanie is able to supplement her husbands income and provide for their three children. With this first loan, she will purchase supplies and materials to expand her dressmaking operations. She hopes that this will improve their current standard of living.

Note: Luzanie is one of five microentrepreneurs in her Bank of Hope solidarity group, all of whom have gone through Esperanza's business training courses. Each of the five members will receive a share of this $750 loan for his/her respective businesses and will be accountable to each other for repaying his/her share of this loan together. This group-lending methodology ensures that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their businesses and families.

loan.use: To purchase supplies and materials for dressmaking.

loan.name: Milouse

texts.en:
Milouse B. is the owner of a general store in Trou-Du-Nord, Haiti, where she supplements her husbands income by selling miscellaneous products to her community. Milouses business is essential to her ensuring the well-being of her four children. With this first loan, Milouse will expand her current inventory to better serve her neighbors and enhance her business operations.

Note: Milouse is one of five microentrepreneurs in her Bank of Hope solidarity group, all of whom have gone through Esperanza's business training courses. Each of the five members will receive a share of this $750 loan for his/her respective businesses and will be accountable to each other for repaying his/her share of this loan together. This group-lending methodology ensures that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their businesses and families.

loan.use: Expand the inventory of her general store.

loan.name: Fumilayo

texts.en: Fumilayo I. is 34 years old, and has three children. She lives in Benin City, Edo state, in Nigeria. She has been with LAPO for four years. Fumilayo would like a loan to expand her business, and purchase an additional drier, weavon, and hair creams and relaxers.

loan.use: To improve on her business

loan.name: Favor

texts.en: Pastor Favor O. is 36 years old. She lives in Benin City, Edo state, in Nigeria. She has been with LAPO for the past eight years. Favor sells provisions and food items. She would like a loan to purchase additional foods for her business..

loan.use: To improve on her business

loan.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy A. is 40 years old, married, and has seven children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She is a fashion designer and also sells drinks to her community. She needs a loan to purchase more drinks and sewing material, to improve and expand her business.

loan.use: To buy more drinks and sewing materials

loan.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine S. is 48 years old, married, and has 7 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, in Nigeria. She sells groundnuts, onions, and sweet potatoes to her community. She will need a loan to purchase more goods for sale, and will be grateful if her request is granted.

loan.use: To invest on my business

loan.name: Enogie

texts.en: Enogie O. is 57 years old, and is the single mother of three children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, in Nigeria. She has been selling foods for seven years. She needs a loan to purchase more provisions for her business.

loan.use: To buy more foodstuffs for sale

loan.name: Velina

texts.en:
Velina R. is the owner of a small general store in Trou-Du-Nord, Haiti. Although she doesnt have any immediate family in the area, Velinas business enables her to be very involved in her local community. She will use this first loan to expand the inventory of her store with a variety of essential goods.

Note: Velina is one of five microentrepreneurs in her Bank of Hope solidarity group, all of whom have gone through Esperanza's business training courses. Each of the five members will receive a share of this $750 loan for his/her respective businesses and will be accountable to each other for repaying his/her share of this loan together. This group-lending methodology ensures that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their businesses and families.

loan.use: Expand the inventory of her general store.

loan.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 24 years old and has a restaurant in Kirkuk. He has applied to get $1200 to purchase an oven and new furniture for the restaurant. He lives with his mother and father. He wants to enhance his living standard and develop his restaurant.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loan.use: Purchase oven and purchase new furniture

loan.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 28 years old and has a welding business in the Kirkuk market. He has applied to get $1200 to purchase a new welding machine. He has a small family consisting of his wife and two children. He wants to enhance his living standard and increase his income.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loan.use: Purchase new welding machine

loan.name: Ivanese

texts.en:
Ivanese D. is a proud mother and business owner in Trou-du-Nord, Haiti. Operating her business out of her home, Ivanese sells a variety of essential cosmetic and hygienic supplies, such as toothpaste, soap, and hair care products. She will use this first loan to expand her inventory of supplies to better meet the needs of her community. When not tending to her business, the 68-year-old Ivanese enjoys spending time with her husband, Granvil, and her four children.

Note: Ivanese is one of five microentrepreneurs in his Bank of Hope solidarity group, all of whom have gone through Esperanza's business training courses. Each of the five members will receive a share of this $750 loan for his/her respective businesses and will be accountable to each other for repaying his/her share of this loan together. This group-lending methodology ensures that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their businesses and families.

loan.use: Increase her inventory of cosmetic and hygienic supplies.

loan.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa M. C. is just twenty years old but has a bright future. She is just one month from finishing her complete high school education and getting a diploma as a bilingual elementary school teacher in her two languages, Ixil and Spanish. Next year she'll be sent to a remote village to teach kids who are getting and education and thus their first chance to break the cycle of poverty here in the Guatemalan mountains.

Rosa's business is weaving she weaves the traditional women's top called a huipil and also several other items of traditional women's dress. A huipil takes her about two months to weave and will fetch about US$65 in the local market. With this loan, as she has for the last two years, she'll invest in yarn for her weaving.

Rosa lives with her mom in a two-room block house with a good roof. Her two older brothers send money to help with their living expenses, including Rosa's tuition, which has been more than US$12/month for many years.

Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows.

loan.use: Purchase yarn for her weaving

loan.name: Noradin

texts.en:
Noradin G. is a divorced mother of two and a business owner in Trou-du-Nord, Haiti. Operating her business out of her home, Noradin sells a variety of different types of clothes, such as shirts, pants, and undergarments. The 29-year-old Noradin will use this first loan to expand her inventory of clothing to better meet the needs of her community.

Note: Noradin is one of five microentrepreneurs in his Bank of Hope solidarity group, all of whom have gone through Esperanza's business training courses. Each of the five members will receive a share of this $750 loan for his/her respective businesses and will be accountable to each other for repaying his/her share of this loan together. This group-lending methodology ensures that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their businesses and families.

loan.use: Expand her inventory of clothing.

loan.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria B. B. weaves traditional Mayan shawls to sell in the Nebaj market. The women use then to stay warm in the cold, dry in the rain, shaded from the sun or as a cargo carrier which is balanced on the women's heads or slung on their backs. The multi-colored wrap will take 3 days to make and she can sell it for one hundred quetzals (13 US dollars). The large ones she makes are for the women to carry babies on their backs.

In her 40 years Maria has had incredible struggles. She was the only one in her family who survived the Guatemalan civil war in the 1980s. She was left in orphan when she was 12. Her struggle still continues as an adult. She lives far up a muddy path amongst the cornfields above Nebaj. The place she lives is made of miscellaneous pieces of wood and is danger of collapsing in the next major storm. The floors are dirt and she has no doors or windows, no electricity, and the water spigot is up the hill. She does not consider this a house and she would very much like to have a house.

Her husband works in the cornfields and together they have 4 children. The two oldest are in school and the two younger are not yet of school age. Maria did attend school for a couple years when she was young and learned to read and write, but just barely. Her big goal in life is to make sure her children get a good education so they do not have to struggle as she has. With an education perhaps they will have more opportunities to break out of the great poverty she has known for too many years.

With this loan she will buy yarn for her weaving, two pigs, and eight turkeys, all which she will sell in the local market.

Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva fellows

loan.use: Purchase yarn for weaving, also 2 pigs and 8 turkeys

loan.name: Candelaria

texts.es:
Candelaria, 36, is married with 3 children; her husband is an agente municipal (municipal employee/policeman, possibly). She has a grocery store in her house. She belongs to the Lourdes 1 group along with dona Merida Velasco Molina (who sells shoes from catalogs). With the loan, they want to invest in their businesses: Candelaria, in buying merchandise--beans, rice, sugar, milk, pastas and non-perishable foods--and Merida will try to set up a small shoe shop in her house in which she will sell shoes that she will bring from Tuxtla where she can get a wider range of shoes that she can now order from catalogs.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

CANDELARIA, tiene 36 aos, casada, 3 hijos, su esposos trabaja como agente municipal. Ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa. Pertenece al grupo Lourdes 1 junto con doa MERIDA VELASCO MOLINA (vende zapatos por catlogos) Ellas con el prstamo esperan invertir Candelaria comprando mercadera como porotos, arroz, azcar, leche, pastas y alimentos no perecibles, en cambio Mrida intentar Poner en su casa un pequeo local de venta de zapatos los que traer desde Tuxtla, solicitando mayor cantidad que lo que hoy pide por catlogos.

loan.use: Grocery store.

loan.name: Minerva

texts.es:
Minerva, 36, is married with 4 children; her husband is a farmer. She has a grocery store in her house. She belongs to the Lourdes 1 group along with dona Eloina Fonseca Ozuna who also has a grocery store in her house. Both hope to use the loan to reduce the costs of their merchandise by buying stock for their stores in bulk and so increase their earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

MINERVA, tiene 36 aos, casada tiene 4 hijos, su esposo trabaja como agricultor y ella tiene en su casa una tienda de abarrotes, pertenece al grupo Lourdes 1 junto doaELOINA FONSECA OZUNA que tambin tiene en su casa una tienda de abarrotes. Ambas esperan comprar con el prstamo mercaderas en el mayoreo para rebajar los costos de compra y as abastecer sus negocios y obtener ms ganancias.

loan.use: Grocery store.

loan.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie S., a 38-year-old business owner in Trou-du-Nord, Haiti, has overcome the limitation of her illiteracy by operating a meal preparation business. Left single after a previous marriage, Rosemarie supports herself by providing cooked meals -- often comprised of plantains, rice, and locally grown vegetables -- to her community. Her business is adjacent to the main bridge entering town, a prime location in Trou-du-Nord for a business such as hers. Rosemarie will use this first loan to expand her inventory of food and supplies to better meet the needs of her community.

Note: Rosemarie is one of five microentrepreneurs in his Bank of Hope solidarity group, all of whom have gone through Esperanza's business training courses. Each of the five members will receive a share of this $750 loan for his/her respective businesses and will be accountable to each other for repaying his/her share of this loan together. This group-lending methodology ensures that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their businesses and families.

loan.use: Increase her inventory of supplies and food.

loan.name: Epifania

texts.es:
Epifania, 56, is married with 8 children. Her husband works at growing maize. She has a grocery store in her house and raises chickens. With the loan, she hopes to buy more merchandise to stock her business, as well as more birds which she will raise and sell in the city market, either live or ready for cooking. She belongs to the Lourdes 1 group.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

EPIFANIA, es casada tiene 8 hijos y 56 aos, su esposo trabaja en la siembra del maz,Ella tiene en su casa una tienda de abarrotes y tambin se dedica a la crianza de pollos, con el prstamo espera comprar mas mercadera para abastecer su negocio y adems comprar mas aves, las cuales despus de su crianza vender en el mercado de la ciudad vivas o para consumo alimenticio. Pertenece al grupo Lourdes 1.

loan.use: Grocery store.

loan.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es:
Maria Del Rosario, 39, is married with 3 children. Her husband is a farmer and she currently works at home selling fruits and vegetables from a small shop where she sells her products to people in the surrounding neighborhood. With the loan, she hopes to plant and harvest her own vegetables. She belongs to the Lourdes 3 group with Mercedes Zuniga Val (clothes sales) and Reyna Fonseca Rodriguez (fruit and vegetable sales). They hope to use the loan to invest, dona Mercedes in a larger inventory of clothes for sale from her house, but also to go out to sell in nearby neighborhoods, and dona Reyna hopes to set up a small shop for selling fruit at her house.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

MARIA DEL ROSARIO, tiene 39 aos, casada, 3 hijos, su esposo trabaja como agricultor y ella vende frutas y verduras en su casa ya que tiene un pequeo local donde vende sus productos a las personas que viven a los alrededores, con el prstamo espera sembrar y cosechar sus propias verduras . Pertenece al grupo Lourdes 3 junto con: MERCEDES ZUIGA VAL (vende ropa) y REYNA FONSECA RODRIGUEZ (vende frutas y erduras) .Ellas esperan con el prstamo invertir doa Mercedes en mayor cantidad de ropa para tener en su casa y adems salir a vender a las comunidades cercanas y doa Reyna espera instalar un pequeo localcito de venta de las frutas en su casa.

loan.use: Fruit and vegetable sales.

loan.name: Maria Gloria

texts.es:
Maria Gloria, 35, is married with 3 children. Her husband works in the fields growing maize. She has a small grocery store in her house where people in the neighborhood come to shop. She belongs to the Lourdes 3 group along with dona Adela Diaz Zuniga (sales of licores, a fruit- and sugar-based drink). With the loan, dona Maria Gloria will buy more merchandise to better stock her store and dona Adela hopes to buy kitchen equipment so that she can improve how she prepares the licores.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

MARIA GLORIA, tiene 35 aos, casada, 3 hijos, su esposo trabaja en el campo en la siembra del maz, ella tiene en su casa una pequea tiendita de abarrotes donde compran las gentes de la comunidad. Ella pertenece al grupo Lourdes 3 junto con doa ADELA DIAZ ZUIGA ( venta de licores de fruta y caa ). Con el prstamo doa Mara Gloria comprara mas mercadera para abastecer mejor su local y doa Adela espera comprar implementos de cocina para preparar en mejores condiciones sus jugos.

loan.use: Grocery store.

loan.name: Dora Maria

texts.es:
Dora Maria, 43, is married with 4 children. Her husband is an employee of a commercial store in the city and she works at home selling clothes and bottled drinks to people in the neighborhood. She belongs to the Tres Estrellas 2 group along with dona Alicia Rosalina Rodriguez G. (fruit and vegetable sales). Both hope to use the loan to increase their sales by acquiring more merchandise for stocking their businesses and by approving the look of the place where they sell their products a bit.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

DORA MARIA, tiene 43 aos, casada, 4 hijos, su esposo trabaja contratado como comerciante en un local de la ciudad, ella vende en su casa ropa y refrescos a las personas de su alrededor.
