Pertenece al grupo Tres Estrellas 2 junto con doa ALICIA ROSALINA RODRIGUEZ G. (vende frutas y verduras) Ambas esperan con el prstamo incrementar sus ventas adquiriendo mas mercaderas para abastecer sus negocios y hermosear un poco el lugar donde venden sus productos.

loan.use: Bottled drink sales.

loan.name: Hiris Cristal

texts.es:
Hiris, 25, is married with one child. Her husband is a musician with a group that plays at various places that hire them. She has a grocery store in her house. She belongs to the Tres Estrellas 2 group along with dona Engracia Gomez L. (grocery store). Both hope to combine their loans to buy stocks of groceries for their stores and, consequently, have more to offer their customers in the communites where they live.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

HIRIS, est casada tiene un hijo y su edad es de 25 aos, su esposo es msico y toca junto a un grupo en lugares donde los solicitan, ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa. Pertenece al grupo Tres Estrellas 2 junto con doa ENGRACIA GOMEZ L. (tienda de abarrotes). Ambas esperan juntar sus prstamos y comprar mercadera de abarrotes para surtir sus tiendas y as tener ms surtido que ofrecerles a sus clientas de la comunidad donde viven.

loan.use: Grocery store.

loan.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita has a grocery store in her home. She's 34 years old and married. Her husband is a driver at the public transportation collective and they have two children. She belongs to the Tres Estrellas 2 group along with dona Lucia Hernandez Gonzalez (grocery store). They want to go to a wholesaler where they can buy merchandise in bulk so that they can lower their costs which, in turn, will allow them to stock their stores with more goods and increase their sales.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

MARGARITA, tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa, es casada tiene 34 aos, su esposo trabaja como chofer de la locomocin colectiva tienen 2 hijos, ella pertenece al grupo Tres Estrellas 2 junto con doa LUCIA HERNANDEZ GONZALEZ (tienda de abarrotes) .Ellas esperan ir a un lugar donde venden las mercaderas al mayoreo y de esta forma rebajar sus costos de compra y lograr abastecer sus locales con mayor cantidad de productos y lograr de esta forma mas ventas.

loan.use: Grocery store.

loan.name: Sebastiana

texts.es:
Sebastiana raises pigs at her house and then sells them for consumption. She's 40 years old and married with 13 children; her husband is a campesino. She belongs to the Tres Estrellas 2 group. She hopes to use the loan to buy more piglets along with feed to fatten them up and, in this way, increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

SEBASTIANA, se dedica a la crianza de puercos en su casa para posteriormente vender para consumo, ella tiene 40 aos, es casada y tiene 13 hijos, su esposo es campesino. Ella pertenece al grupo Tres Estrellas 2. Con el prstamo espera comprar ms puercos pequeos y tambin alimento para su engorda y de esta forma aumentar sus ventas.

loan.use: Pig farming.

loan.name: Liberiana

texts.es:
Liberiana works at home selling bottled drinks to people in the surrounding area. She's 28 years old and married with 4 small children; her husband grows maize. She belongs to the Tres Estrellas 3 group along with dona Pascuala de Jesus L. L. (who makes corn tortillas for sale to people in her neighborhood). They hope to use the loan to invest in their respective businesses: Pascuala, buying maize in bulk for her tortillas, and Liberiana, to add a place in her house for selling her bottled drinks.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

LIBERIANA, se dedica a la venta de refrescos en su casa para las personas que habitan a su alrededor, tiene 28 aos es casada con 4 hijos pequeos, su esposo se dedica a la siembra del maz, Pertenece al grupo Tres Estrellas 3 junto con doa PASCUALA DE JESUS L. L. (hace tortillas de maz y las sale a vender entre las personas de su comunidad). Esperan con el prstamo invertir en sus respectivos negocios , Pascuaza comprando maz por quintales para tener abastecimiento de materia prima para sus tortillas y Liberiana colocar un lugar en su casa para la venta de sus refrescos

loan.use: Bottled drink sales.

loan.name: Ciria Lidia

texts.es:
CIRIA -62 years old- runs a small grocery store at home. She is a widow and has 8 children. She belongs to the group Tres Estrellas 3 (Three Stars 3), along with Ms. DOLORES CASTELLANOS J. (who makes bread at home and sells it door to door). With her share of the loan, Ms. Ciria hopes to stock her store better, buying more groceries and beverages; and Ms. Dolores will buy a hundredweight of flour to scale up her bread production.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

CIRIA, de 62 aos de edad, posee una pequea tienda de abarrotes en su casa. Es viuda y tiene 8 hijos. Pertenece al grupo Tres Estrellas, junto con doa DOLORES CASTELLANOS J. (quien prepara pan en su casa y lo comercializa de puerta en puerta). Con su parte del prstamo, doa Ciria espera abastecer mejor su local, comprando ms mercadera y bebidas, y doa Dolores comprar un quintal de harina para poder as aumentar la preparacin de su pan.

loan.use: Grocery store (Tienda de abarrotes)

loan.name: Trinidad

texts.es:
JUANA buys natural flowers, fruits and vegetables at a nearby city and she then sells them at home to people who live in her neighborhood. She is 54 years old, has 7 children and her husband works as a carpenter at a furniture shop. She belongs to the Tres Estrellas (Three Stars) 6 group, along with Ms. TRINIDAD P. S. (who is dedicated to raising and selling pigs). With the loan, Ms. Juana hopes to install a small shop at home to sell her flowers and fruits, and Ms. Trinidad will buy more pigs, as well as food and vitamins to maintain her animals disease-free.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

JUANA compra en una ciudad cercana al lugar donde vive flores naturales, frutas y verduras, y posteriormente las vende en su casa y a las personas que viven cerca de su domicilio. Tiene 54 aos, 7 hijos y su esposo trabaja como carpintero en una mueblera. Ella pertenece al grupo Tres Estrellas 6, junto con doa TRINIDAD P. S. (quien se dedica a la crianza y venta de puercos). Con el prstamo doa Juana espera poder instalar un pequeo local en su casa, donde pueda vender sus flores y frutas, y doa Trinidad comprar ms lechoncitos, as como alimento y vitaminas para evitar las plagas entre los animales.

loan.use: Selling flowers, fruits and vegetables.

loan.name: Porfiria Faustina

texts.es:
Porfiria works at home selling fruits and vegetables that she buys in the city market. She's 36 years old and married with 5 children; her husband grows maize. She belongs to the Tres Estrellas 6 group; with the loan, she hopes to renovate the part of her house where she sells her produce so that she can display the fruits and vegetables better and increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

PORFIRIA, se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras en su casa la cual compra en el mercado de la ciudad, es casada tiene 5 hijos y 36 aos de edad, su esposo se dedica a la siembra del maz. Pertenece al grupo Tres Estrellas 6, con el prstamo espera acondicionar mejor el lugar de su casa donde vende sus productos y as al tener mejor presentacin de la fruta y verdura aumentar sus ventas.

loan.use: Fruit and vegetable sales.

loan.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena, 33, is married with 4 children; her husband works in the fields planting maize. She travels to the city of San Cristobal, two hours away, to buy clothes for children and women to sell from her house to the people in her neighborhood. She belongs to the Lanza 3 group which includes Margarita Cruz Bautista (sales of prepared chicken), Lina Zuniga Vasquez (wholesale bread sales), Bonifacia Molina Coello (who raises pigs). With the loan, all hope to expand their businesses, by buying necessary equipment or supplies to stock their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

ELENA, esta casada, tiene 33 aos, 4 hijos, su esposo trabaja en el campo en la siembra del maz, ella viaja a la ciudad de San Cristbal a 2 horas de su casa a comprar ropa para nios y mujeres y luego las vende en su casa entre las gentes de su comunidad. Pertenece al grupo Lanza 3 y las otras integrantes son: MARGARITA CRUZ BAUTISTA (venta de pollo trozado), LINA ZUIGA VASQUEZ (compra pan por mayoreo en la ciudad y luego lo revende en su comunidad), BONIFACIA MOLINA COELLO (se dedica a la crianza de puercos). Con el prstamo todas esperan incrementar sus negocios comprando ya sea implementos de elaboracin o materias primas para abastecer sus negocios..

loan.use: Clothing sales.

loan.name: Yean

texts.en: Mrs. Yean S. is 26 years old, married and lives with her husband and her 1 young child in Siem Reap province, in Cambodia. Mrs S. runs a small laundry shop in her community, while her husband is employed at a private company. Together, they generally earn $5 each day. Eventually, this loan will be used to repair their house, which normally suffers from heavy leaking during the rainy season.

loan.use: To repair her house

payment.comment: Congratulations to Yean Sarin for repaying the Kiva loan early!

loan.name: Choeun

texts.en: Mrs. Choeun S. is 31 years old, married and lives in Siem Reap province, in Cambodia. She is a housewife and has to take care of her four school-aged children, while her husband works as a Tuk Tuk driver (a passenger cart attached to a motor-bike) and can earn approximately $5/day of income. This loan will be used to purchase a Tuk Tuk and the remainder of the money is to repair their house.

loan.use: To purchase a Tuk Tuk and repair their house

payment.comment: Congrats! Your Kiva loan has been repaid early. Thank you for taking a sincere interest in helping Cambodian entrepreneurs like Choeun Sonin start and sustain their businesses. Your willingness to share your financial resources has made a difference. We hope you continue to lend through CREDIT in the future. Sincerely, Joshua Benadum, CREDIT Intern, Phnom Penh Office.

loan.name: Matluba

texts.ru:
Matluba has been in business for the last few years. She purchases and re-sells dried fruit, namely apricots. She purchases apricots that are of low quality, takes them home, sorts through them, and then takes the good fruits to the market. She gains profit from the difference in the sales price. Her older daughter helps her at the market.

Matluba is married, she is 43 years old, and she has 5 children. Her husband does not have a job, and sometimes he comes to help her in the market. Matluba must cover all of her family's expenses.

She has been partnering with MicroInvest for the past 2.5 years. She started with a $300 loan and eventually raised the sum to $900. August is the time when dried fruits sell cheaply, and Matluba would like to receive a loan to purchase apricots.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva

. , . , . . . , 43 5 . , . . 2,5 . $300, $900. .

loan.use: to purchase dried apricots

loan.name: Cheng

texts.en: Mrs. Cheng Y. is a 37 year old widow living in Phnom Penh with her only child and her mother (both pictured here). She sells fruit at the local market and earns about $4/day of profit. With a loan of $1,000, she will be able to purchase more fruit for selling, a business that she knows to be profitable. In the future, she hopes to continue accessing credit in order to start a small grocery store.

loan.use: To purchase fruit

loan.name: Theng

texts.en: Mrs. Theng L. is 51 years old and she works selling snacks in front of a garment factory. Her husband and their 2 children live with her, but unfortunately her husband is too ill to work. Their two children help to support their family by working at the garment factory. This loan will be used by Mrs. Theng L. to purchase more snacks. She hopes to open a small restaurant selling rice and Khmer food someday.

loan.use: To purchase snacks for her inventory

payment.comment:
Congratulations! Theng Long has fully repaid this Kiva loan early.
Thank you for your support of Cambodian entrepreneurs. Lenders like you allow entrepreneurs around the world access to low-interest loans to finance their small businesses and support their families.
We hope you will continue your support by reinvesting in another Kiva entrepreneur.
Sincerely, Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loan.name: Rajabhon

texts.ru:
Rajabhon is not married, she is 46 years old and does not have children. Rajabhon and her elderly mother live with the brother's family. Her brother has a large family, and to not be a burden on him, Rajabhon trades on the market. She has 8 years of experience purchasing dried fruit on one market, sorting through it, and then reselling quality fruit on another market. Her mother helps her. The financial gain is small, but it helps to cover the costs.

Rajabhon received her first microcredit loan from MicroInvest 2 years ago; she used the money to purchase fresh apricots and dry them with the help of her family. Since then, she has been receiving loans from MicroInvest.

In August, the price for dried fruit is low, and Rajabhon would like to receive a new loan to purchase and store dried fruit. In January and February, when the prices rise, Rajabhon will be able to receive good profit from her sales.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva

, 46 . . , , . 8 . . . , . 2 . . . .

loan.use: to purchase and store dried fruits

loan.name: Keo

texts.en: Mrs. Keo S. is 54 years old and lives in Phnom Penh with her husband and their 6 children. Mrs. Keo S. works by selling vegetables, and can earn about $3/day. Her husband is a driver at a private company, while her eldest son is a mechanic. This loan will be used to provide her son with tools for his business.

loan.use: To purchase tools

payment.comment: Congratulations to Keo Sarin for repaying her loan early!

loan.name: Touch

texts.en: Mrs. Touch I. is 42 years old and lives in Phnom Penh, Cambodia with her husband and their 7 children. She sells fruit, and earns $6/day, while her husband earns $3/day workI. at a private company. Three of their children also contribute to the family's income by workI. at a garment factory. This loan will be used for Mrs. Touch I. to purchase more fruit for sellI..

loan.use: To purchase more fruit

payment.comment: Touch Ing has successfully repaid her loan early! Thanks to you, she was able to expand her business and improve the life of her family. Thank you for your support!

loan.name: Ibodat

texts.ru:
Ibodat has a secondary school education and after finishing school she did not work anywhere. Currently she is a businesswoman and sells childrens clothing and shoes. She is married, is 41 years old and has 3 children. Her husband is in Russia earning money and sends money home to support the family.

Ibodats oldest daughter needs to get married soon and Ibodat would like to use the profits from her business for her daughters dowry. She has been a client of MicroInvest for one year and is an exemplary client. She would like to use the new loan to purchase school uniforms.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

. . , 41 3 . . , , . . ..

loan.use: to purchase school uniforms

loan.name: Shoira

texts.ru:
Shoira has known the trading system since childhood as her father worked in a big store. When Shoira was not able to find a regular, stable job she started selling goods at the market. She is divorced and is raising 2 small children. This year she turned 30.

Shoira sells mens shoes and every day travels to different markets in kishlaks (villages). MicroInvest loans have helped her to expand the quantity and selection of her products. Shoira plans to use this loan to purchase fall shoes.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

. . 2 . 30 . , . . .

loan.use: For purchase of autumn assortment of footwear

loan.name: Zarrina

texts.ru:
Zarrina works as a nurse in the city hospital in Isfara. Her husband is always sick and cannot work. Zarrina is 42 years old and has 4 children. A nurses salary is small and in her free time Zarrina sells goods at the market. She has a small business and sells perfumes. She travels to Khudzhand once a week to purchase products. Despite the small size of the business Zarrina has many regular clients and makes good profits that contribute substantially to the family budget.

Zarrina has been working with MicroInvest for 6 months. She plans to use this loan to further expand her business.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

. . 42 4 . . . . . . 6 . .

loan.use: to expand business

loan.name: Rafig

texts.en:
Rafig A. operates a photo-developing studio. He is married with two children. His shop is located in Beylagan, a small town in southern-west Azerbaijan near the Iranian border. He has operated this business since 1995. Rafig develops photos using a large photo-processing machine. He also works as a photographer at weddings.

Rafig has more experience in this business than his competitors. This is his first loan and he plans to remodel his shop and purchase a digital camera. This new camera will allow him to take better photos and increase his business.

loan.use: To repair his shop and purchase a digital camera

loan.name: Shafoat

texts.ru:
Shafoat buys and resells apricot pits. In Isfar, there is a tradition to crush the pits and take out the soft core called magz. A lot of local entrepreneurs involved in magz trade. Shafoat buys magz at the nearby markets and then resells it at the central market. Shafoat, 42 has 2 children. Her husband works as a collective farmer. His salary is very small, so he helps Shafoat to sell. The workday starts early in the morning and ends at the lunch time. When the trading day is over, Shafoat and her husband transfer the remaining magz home and sort it there to increase its price. Recently, Shafoat received a loan from MicroInvest and increased the volume of magz that she sells. Shafoat plans to use this loan to further expand her business.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

. , . - . . 42 , 2 . . . . . . -. .

loan.use: Business expansion

loan.name: Kin

texts.en: Mrs. Kin C. is 27 years old and lives in Phnom Penh with her husband and their 2 children. She earns a living renting rooms, a business that earns her $1/day. Her husband earns $5/day as a policeman, and the couple's combined income is enough to send their children to school. This loan will be used to purchase a cart to sell sugar cane juice. Mrs. Kin C. has free time to sell juice, and knows it will be a good way to increase her income.

loan.use: To purchase a cart to sell sugar cane juice

payment.comment:
Congratulations! Kin Chaivath has fully repaid this Kiva loan early.
Thank you for your support of Cambodian entrepreneurs. Lenders like you allow entrepreneurs around the world access to low-interest loans to finance their small businesses and support their families.
We hope you will continue your support by reinvesting in another Kiva entrepreneur.
Sincerely, Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loan.name: Soum

texts.en: Mrs. Soum S. is 50 years old and works as a seamstress in Phnom Penh, earning $1/day. She lives with her husband, a bodyguard, who earns $4/day, and their 5 children. Mrs. Soum S. will use this loan to purchase a motorcycle to help her business, and also to help the family cut down on transportation costs.

loan.use: To purchase a motorcycle

loan.name: Prek

texts.en: Mrs. Prek A. is a 53 year old widow living in Phnom Penh with her 5 children. She works two jobs - selling porridge and raising pigs. Combined, these businesses earn her $3/day. She would like to take out a loan in order to purchase more pigs to raise. When they mature, she can sell them to the market and earn additional income to support her family.

loan.use: Buy pigs

loan.name: Un

texts.en: Mr. Un T. is 59 years old and lives in Phnom Penh with his wife (pictured here). He works as a traditional Khmer doctor, using herbs and natural subsititutes for healing. This occupation pays him $2/day. He and his wife also operate a small business selling fruit. This loan will be used to purchase more fruit for selling so he and his wife can improve their lives.

loan.use: Mr. Un Ton would like to purchase fruit for his stand.

loan.name: Touch

texts.en: Mrs. Touch S. is 34 years old and lives in Phnom Penh with her husband and their two children. She works selling fruit at the market, and earns $2/day. Her husband works as a soldier and also contributes to the family's income. The couple can now send their children to school, but they are still working to increase their incomes. This loan will be used to purchase fruit for selling, and also soft drinks.

loan.use: Touch would like to purchase fruits and soft drinks to sell.

loan.name: Heng

texts.en: Mrs. Heng K. is 41 years old and lives in Phnom Penh with her husband and their five children. She works selling bananas and farming the family's land, and can earn about $3/day. Her husband helps with the farming, but they need a better way to water their crops. This loan will be used to purchase a waterpump to increase the yield from their land. In the future, she hopes her husband can handle the farming so she can open a clothing shop at the nearby open air market.

loan.use: Heng would like to purchase a water pump for her farm.

loan.name: Ma

texts.en: Mrs. Ma S. is a 48 year old widow living in Phnom Penh with her five children. She runs a wholesale clothing business that gives her $5/day income. Her eldest children work at private companies, while the younger 2 are still students. Mrs. Ma S. will use this loan to purchase more clothes for her business.

loan.use: Ma would like to purchase clothes for selling at her small business.

payment.comment: Congratulations! Ma Samang paid back her loan early!

loan.name: Uktam

texts.en:
Uktam B. is 29 years old, an inhabitant of the Tursun-zoda district. He is married and has a secondary education. After school graduation, he worked in small firms as subprofessional staff. Two years ago, he started farming. He is planting potatos, tomatoes, peppers, onions, flax and wheat.

Currently he has 5 hectares of land where he is going to plant onions and winter wheat. His brothers and relatives help him in farm. With this loan, Uktam is going to buy onion seed and the rest of loan he will spend for cultivation, planting, petrol and a tractor driver. The client is going to pay off the loan in 12 months.

loan.use: To buy seeds and other expenditures for onion planting

loan.name: Malika

texts.ru:
Malika is a single mother. She is raising a daughter. Malica, 46 has high school education. Malica sells womens shoes. Her daughter sells in a small store at the central market, while Malica travels to sell on the markets nearby. Two years ago, when Malica received her first loan to expand her business, she did not own the store. Gradually growing the business, Malica opened the small store. Today, Malica continues to collaborate with MicroInvest. She asks for another loan to continue expansion of her business.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

. 46 , . . , , . 2 . . . .

loan.use: Business expansion

loan.name: Chun

texts.en: Mrs. Chun S. is a 47 year old widow living in Phnom Penh with her only child. She rents out rooms in her home, and her daughter helps support her by working at a garment factory. This loan will be used to repair her home so she can continue to rent out rooms.

loan.use: Chun would like to repair her house so she can rent out a room

payment.comment: Congrats! Your Kiva loan has been repaid early. Thank you for taking a sincere interest in helping Cambodian entrepreneurs like Chun Sambun start and sustain their businesses. Your willingness to share your financial resources has made a difference. We hope you continue to lend through CREDIT in the future. Sincerely, Joshua Benadum, CREDIT Intern, Phnom Penh Office.

loan.name: Sum

texts.en: Mrs. Sum S. is 54 years old and lives in Phnom Penh with her husband and their two children. She earns a living selling fruit, while her husband works as a security guard. The couple earns $6/day, but they are also helped by their two children that work as security guards just like their father. This loan will be used for Mrs. Sum S. to purchase more fruit so she can expand her business.

loan.use: Sum would like to purchase fruit to sell.

payment.comment:
Congratulations! Sum Som has fully repaid this Kiva loan early.
Thank you for your support of Cambodian entrepreneurs. Lenders like you allow entrepreneurs around the world access to low-interest loans to finance their small businesses and support their families.
We hope you will continue your support by reinvesting in another Kiva entrepreneur.
Sincerely, Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loan.name: Sou

texts.en: Mr. Sou S., 48 years old, and his wife (pictured here) live and work together in Phnom Penh Cambodia. They produce and sell brooms, and can earn $8/day in this business. They have five children, two of whom work at a garment factory, and three of whom are students. This loan will be used for the couple to purchase more materials so they can continue in their broom business. They earn good income from selling brooms, and they hope to continue accessing credit to expand their business in the future.

loan.use: Sou would like to buy more brooms to sell.

payment.comment: Congrats! Your Kiva loan has been repaid early. Thank you for taking a sincere interest in helping Cambodian entrepreneurs like Sou Samuo start and sustain their businesses. Your willingness to share your financial resources has made a difference. We hope you continue to lend through CREDIT in the future. Sincerely, Joshua Benadum, CREDIT Intern, Phnom Penh Office.

loan.name: Munira

texts.ru:
Munira has been a MicroInvest client for more than 2 years. Over this time, big changes happened in her life. In the past, Munira had no house of her own. Since she started her business, by putting aside a fraction of the profits, Munira was able to buy a parcel of land and begin a house construction. Munira, 35 is married and has 3 children. Her husband has no permanent job and puts all his efforts to help her wife in her challenging business. Munira buys dried apricots and pit. She and her family then sort the purchases and re-sell them based on the sorted grades. With help of MicroInvest loans, Munira significantly increased the asset value of her business. Following Muniras advice, many other women, who sell dried fruits, became MicroInvest borrowers. Now, Munira asks for a new loan to purchase dried fruits.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

2 . . . . 35 , 3 . . , . , , , , . .

loan.use: to purchase dried apricot and pit

loan.name: Yin

texts.en: Mrs. Yin M. is 46 years old and lives in Phnom Penh with her husband and their child. She works selling brooms, a good business that gives her $20/day in revenue. Her husband helps with the broom business, but also works renting rooms to garment factory workers. This loan will be used for Mrs. Yin M. to purchase more brooms for her inventory.

loan.use: Yin would like to purchase brooms to sell.

loan.name: Thun

texts.en: Mrs. Thun M. is 59 years old and lives with her husband and their child in Phnom Penh. She works both selling brooms and renting rooms of the family's home. Her husband helps with renting rooms, and their family income is around $8/day. This loan will be used for Mrs. Thun M. to repair her home so they can continue renting out rooms. She hopes to continue with this business in the future because affordable room rentals are in high demand in Cambodia.

loan.use: Thun would like to repair her home for renting out rooms.

loan.name: Suon

texts.en: Mr. Suon C. is 62 years old and married with two children. He and his family live in Phnom Penh and earn a living by renting rooms. His wife (pictured here with one of their grandchildren) also works as a seamstress and earns $2/day. This loan will be used for the family to build more rooms that they can rent out monthly. With this loan, they will be able to increase their income now, and also provide their children with a good business in the future.

loan.use: Suon would like to build more rooms for renting out.

payment.comment: Congrats! Your Kiva loan has been repaid early. Thank you for taking a sincere interest in helping Cambodian entrepreneurs like Suon Chuon start and sustain their businesses. Your willingness to share your financial resources has made a difference. We hope you continue to lend through CREDIT in the future. Sincerely, Joshua Benadum, CREDIT Intern, Phnom Penh Office.

loan.name: So

texts.en: Mr. So R., his wife, and their four children live in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. The couple sells brooms for a living, and can earn about $8 per day. This income is just enough to put their four children through school. This loan will be used for Mr. So R. to purchase more brooms for selling. He would like to continue stocking brooms so their business can grow in the future.

loan.use: So would like to purchase brooms to sell.

loan.name: Phen

texts.en: Mr. Phen C. is 59 years old and lives in Phnom Penh with his wife and their two children. He works producing and selling brooms, a business that gives him $8 per day. His wife is a landlord, and can earn about $2/day. Mr. Phen would like this loan so he can buy bulks of grass that will eventually be made into brooms. His business is succesful now, and with access to this loan, he will be able to improve his family's situation.

loan.use: Phen would like to puchase bulks of grass to produce brooms to sell.

payment.comment: Congrats! Your Kiva loan has been repaid early. Thank you for taking a sincere interest in helping Cambodian entrepreneurs like Phen Choeun start and sustain their businesses. Your willingness to share your financial resources has made a difference. We hope you continue to lend through CREDIT in the future. Sincerely, Joshua Benadum, CREDIT Intern, Phnom Penh Office.

loan.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience O. is 39 years old, married, and has 2 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, in Nigeria. She sells used clothes. She began her business in 2004, and has been in LAPO for two years. She would like a loan to improve her business.

loan.use: To buy more clothes for sales.

loan.name: Philomena

texts.en: Philomena N. is 32 years old, married, and has one child. She owns a business center where she types and photocopies documents for clients. She would like a loan to purchase a computer and scanner, as well as a Photostatting machine and printer.

loan.use: To buy computer, scanner & printer.

loan.name: Ozoda

texts.ru:
Ozoda buys and resells clothing for children. She is 34, married, and has 3 little children. Ozoda has no other job and her small business is her main source of income, because her husband is also unemployed. Over the six months of being a MicroInvest borrower, Ozodas business has shown noticeable improvements. The sales volume increased and the assortment of the goods expanded. Ozoda asks for the new loan to continue expansion of her business.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

. , 34 3 . , . . , . .

loan.use: for further expansion of business

loan.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella O. is 42 years old, happily married, and has five children. She sells drinks and pepper soup. She lives with her family in Benin City, Edo State, in Nigeria. She would like a loan to purchase additional crates of drinks and ingredients for her soups.

loan.use: To buy crates of drinks & wines

loan.name: Matluba

texts.ru:
Matlubas husband, just like many other men in the region, is working as a seasonal laborer in Russia. He sends some money, but the transfers are catastrophically low to pay for his familys necessities, while life is getting more expansive every day. To make ends meet, Matluba sells clothing for children and light fabrics at nearby markets. Matluba, 30 is a mother of 2 children. Her business pays for most of her family expanses. A year ago, Matluba heard of MicroInvest and came for her first loan. According to her, the loan gave her business a boost and brought additional income. A season of strong sales is approaching and Matluba wants to receive a new loan to buy school uniforms.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

. , , . . . 30 2 . . . . .

loan.use: To purchase school uniforms

loan.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary A. is 49 years old, married, and has six children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She has been with LAPO for four years. She would like a loan to purchase more crates of drinks and expand her business.

loan.use: To invest on her business

loan.name: Mavjuda

texts.en:
Mavjuda has big family. She has 4 children and her husband's salary is not enough to support the family. Mavjuda has been engaged in trade for over 14 years. Her business is sewing oriental robes and selling them in the market. This is their family business, a tradition that has been transmitted from mothers to children. Since childhood, Mavjuda and her sisters helped their mother sew robes for the market.

Now her mother is an old woman and Mavjuda and her elder sister sell robes in the market. Their trade place is located in Jumabazaar, a big clothing market in Khujand. Now the turnover of her business is fast and she has many clients. She wants purchase fabric for the next batch of robes. She is requesting $500 for this purpose.

loan.use: Purchase fabric to make robes

loan.name: Cecelien

texts.en: Cecelia E. is married, and has eight children. She is 52 years old, and lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. Cecelia has owned a restaurant for the past six years. She would like a loan to purchase more foods and drinks.

loan.use: To buy more foodstuffs and drinks

loan.name: Vohida

texts.en:
Vohida has her own beauty salon. She has been engaged in this business since 1995. Before, she taught mathematics in school for 15 years She loved her work, but her salary was not enough for her familys needs.

She rented the second floor of a little shop for her beauty salon. Today she has many clients and her business is going well. In the future, she wants to open a wedding salon near her beauty salon. She has free room for this purpose. She has also ordered wedding dresses from her friend from Dubai. She needs in $600 for purchasing mannequins for her wedding salon.

loan.use: Purchase of mannequins for wedding salon

loan.name: Munojot

texts.ru:
Munojot, 35 is married and has 3 children. She has been selling on a market for 6 years. The goods that she sells include clothing for children, socks for men and women, and other small items. Munjots children are small and Munjots mother-in-law takes care of them. Munjot buys and delivers her goods from a wholesaler in Istaravshan. Munjot does not have a permanent trading spot, so she has to sell wherever she can find a place. Her husband sends money from Russia, where he works as a seasonal laborer. Munjot became a MicroInvest borrower a year and a half ago. Then, her business assets were about $450. By now, Munjot more than doubled the value of her business. Munjot hopes to use the new loan to continue expansion of her business.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

35 , 3 . 6 . , . . . . . . 1,5 . $450. 2 . .

loan.use: Business expansion

loan.name: Odion

texts.en: Mrs. Odion A. is 36. Married with three children, she hails from Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells blocks of ice, provisions, and drinks. Odion is requesting a loan of $400 to buy an ice-making machine. She is optimistic that this machine can improve her business and allow her to better care for her family.

loan.use: To buy a machine to make ice blocks

loan.name: Uche

texts.en: Uche O. is married with four children. She is 32 years of age and hails from Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She has been a member of LAPO for 4 years. She sells provisions and is requesting a loan of $325 so that she can further expand her micro-business. Uche is hard-working and has about 4 years' experience in running her little grocery store.

loan.use: To expand the inventory of her little grocery store

loan.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy Ogbonaye is married with four children. She is 35 years of age and hails from Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She has been a member of LAPO for 5 years. Mercy sells provisions at the open-air market and needs a loan of $400 to expand the inventory of her micro-business.

loan.use: To expand the inventory of her market stall

loan.name: Okoye

texts.en: Okeke N. is 26 years old, unmarried, and lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She is a hair stylist and needs a loan of $250 for the purchase of a hair dryer and hair relaxer, hair cream, hair extensions, etc. With the above loan, Okeke is optimistic that her business will improve.

loan.use: To buy hairdressing equipment i.e., dryers etc.

loan.name: Rachael

texts.en: "I'm requesting a loan of $400 to invest in soft drinks and my yam business," says Mrs. Rachael E. who lives in Oguosa, Benin City. She is married with 3 children. Racheal is 48 years old and has 10 years' experience in her micro-business.

loan.use: To invest in her business

loan.name: Mahbuba

texts.ru:
Mahbuba and her husband make a living by preparing and selling shish kebab. They have been doing this for 4 years. They have no other permanent jobs and their business is the only source of income. Mahbuba and her husband travel among all markets in the region, so they have to work every day of the week. Selling at a single market brings them $150-200 in earnings. Mahbuba became a MicroInvest client 6 months ago. Now, she plans to take another loan to increase the volume of goods sold. The Juraevs are on the photo.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

. 4 . . , . $150-200. 6 . . .

loan.use: Business expansion

loan.name: Felicia

texts.en: Mrs. Felicia E. sells kitchen utensils and sewing materials. She needs additional funds to boost her business. Felicia lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria, with her five children. She is 53 years old. She became a LAPO member 2 years ago.

loan.use: To improve my micro-business

loan.name: Susan

texts.en: "I hope to buy a refrigerator to enable me sell cooled drinks and water," says Mrs. Susan E., who lives in Ofumwengbe in Benin City. She is married with 3 children and is 35 years old. She has 3 years' experience in running her business.

loan.use: Purchase of fridge and provisions

loan.name: Doris

texts.en: "I learnt how to run a grocery store and sell provisions from my mother. I hope to buy more drinks and provisions to expand my inventory," says Mrs. Doris A.. She is 41 years old, married with 5 children. She lives in Ewakpe Lane in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. Doris started her business last year.

loan.use: Purchase of generator and provisions

loan.name: Blessing

texts.en: "I am proud to be a LAPO client." says Miss Blessing E., who lives in Obasuayi, Benin City. She styles hair and sells "weavons" (hair extensions). She is 27 years of age and has 3 years' experience in her business. Blessing hopes to buy more "weavons" and other hairdressing equipment for her little salon.

loan.use: purchase hair extensions etc. for her hairdressing business

loan.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Mrs. Rebecca I. is 32 years old, married, with 2 children. She lives in an urban area of Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. "I'm requesting a loan of $400 to invest in my timber business," says Rebecca. She has 4 years' experience in her business and has also been a member of LAPO for four years.

loan.use: To buy more timber

loan.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose O. is 45 years old and hails from Asaba in Delta State. She sells soft drinks (mineral water, Malta, etc.) and cooked food to her community. She is requesting a loan of $800 to buy a deep freeze and more goods for sale. Rose has been a LAPO client for 5 years.

loan.use: To invest in her little restaurant

loan.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica O. is 43 years old. She is a native of Iselu-Uku in Delta State. She sells soft drinks (mineral water, Malta, etc.) and cooked food to her community. She is requesting a loan of $400 to buy more goods for sale. Veronica has 7 years' experience in her business.

loan.use: To purchase food items for sale

loan.name: Anthonia

texts.en: Mrs. Anthonia A. is 50 years old. She is a mother of three children and has been a member of LAPO since 2001. She is requesting a loan of $400 to enable her to expand her micro-business, a little restaurant.

loan.use: To buy more food items for sale

loan.name: Paul

texts.en: Mr. Paul E. is a farmer who specializes in the production of fish and turkeys for sale to his community. He is 52 years old, married, and blessed with four children. Paul needs a loan of $1,175 to buy more fingerlings and feed for the fish he farms. He has been in the farming business since 1994.

loan.use: To buy more fingerlings (little fish) to raise and fish feed

loan.name: Nkem

texts.en: Nkem N. is 55 years old and is the mother of 8 children. She is from Okpanemu town in Delta State. She learnt the business of selling provisions and soft drinks from her mother. Nkem needs a loan of $625 to invest in her business.

loan.use: To invest in drinks and provisions for resale

loan.name: Aneen

texts.en: Aneen N. is 47 years old and a native of Okpanamua town in Delta State. She specializes in the preparation and sale of local dishes in her little restaurant. Aneen is the mother of four children. She is requesting a loan of $400 to expand her micro-business.

loan.use: To buy raw materials for preparing foodstuffs

loan.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary O. is 36 years old. A native of Okpanamu, a town in Delta State, she is the leader of a LAPO group. She has 2 years' experience in her business, i.e., in the sales and rental of video CDs. Mary is requesting a loan of $625 to purchase more CDs and expand her little micro-business.

loan.use: To buy more CDs for her inventory

loan.name: Josephine

texts.en: Mrs. Josephine O. specializes in the sale of provisions and foodstuffs. She is 56 years old, mother of eight children. She has been running a little grocery store for 5 years. She is requesting a loan of $800 to buy a wider range of goods for her inventory.

loan.use: To buy more provisions and foodstuffs for sale in her little grocery store

loan.name: Nwanbuoku

texts.en: Mrs. Nwanbuoku C. is 40 years old. She is happily married with six children. She is requesting a loan of $800 to buy more goods for sale in her little grocery store. She has 3 years' experience in her business and has been a member of LAPO for three years as well.

loan.use: To buy more provisions and foodstuffs to sell in her little grocery store

loan.name: Mary

texts.en: Mrs. Mary A. is 40 years old and is happily married with eight children. She lives in Ezenchi in Asaba, Delta state, Nigeria. She sells soft drinks, dried fish, and provisions. Mary is requesting a loan of $400 for the purchase of provisions and other foodstuffs for sale in her little grocery store. She started this business last year.

loan.use: To buy provisions & food items for sale

loan.name: Beatrices

texts.en: "I am proud to be a Lift Above Poverty Organization member," says A. Beatrice, who is married. She is 27 years old and lives on Cowan Street in Asaba, Delta state. She sells weavon, hair cream, and relaxer. She also fixes hair, and does pedicures & manicures. "I hope to buy more weavon, hair cream and relaxer," says Mrs. A. Beatrice. She has been in this business since 2005.

loan.use: To buy weavon, hair cream and relaxer

loan.name: Uche

texts.en: "The sewing of clothes in Asaba is a very good business, as everyone always wears clothes," says Uche E., who lives in Asaba, Delta State. She is married with a child, and is 30 years old. She would like to invest this loan in the purchase of sewing materials and weavon. She has been in this business since 1997.

loan.use: To improve her business

loan.name: Paulina

texts.en: Paulina A. is a widow who is 50 years old and has ten children. She is a native of Imo State but resides in Delta State, in Nigeria. She sells drinks, water and provisions to the community. She needs the loan for the growth of her business. She has 5 years of experience in her business.

loan.use: To buy more provisions, drinks and water for sale

loan.name: Maryam

texts.en: Mrs. Maryam L. Okeya is a business woman who sells fairly used clothes, and also has a hairdressing salon. She is 47 years old and is married with 7 children. She hails from Asaba, Delta State, and wishes to improve her business with the above loan.

loan.use: To buy fairly used clothes and weavon cream and relaxer

loan.name: Eunice

texts.en: Mrs. Eunice L. is married with two children. She has spent 7 years as a Lift Above Poverty Organization member. She sells engine oil and motorcycle tyres to people living in her community. She is requesting the above loan in order to expand her business. She has 8 years of experience in her business.

loan.use: To buy motorcycle tyres and oil for sale

loan.name: Esther

texts.en: Mrs. Esther E. is 42 years old and is married with six children. She is requesting the above loan to buy frozen chicken, turkey, provisions & foodstuff for sale. "I am proud to be a Lift Above Poverty Organization member for the past eight years, and a union leader," says Esther. She hails from Umuisor, Asaba, Delta State, Nigeria.

loan.use: To buy more provisions, foodstuff, frozen chicken and turkey for sales

loan.name: Vegina

texts.en: Vegina E. is 40 years of age, and is married with three children. She started her business in 2004 has been with Lift Above Poverty Organization for eight years. She hails from Asaba, Delta State, Nigeria. She specializes in cooked food, and the sale of drinks and water. She is requesting the above loan for business expansion.

loan.use: To buy drinks, flour & food items

loan.name: Mary

texts.en: Mrs. Mary N. is happily married with a child; she is 40 years of age. She is a native of Aba but resides in Asaba in Delta State, Nigeria. She specializes in the preparation & sale of local food & pepper soup. People living in the area like her food. Hence she is referred to as home food. She also sells drinks. She is requesting the above loan to enable her to purchase a generator & foodstuff. She has eleven years of experience in her business.

loan.use: To buy a generator & food stuff.

loan.name: Helen Iloba

texts.en: Mrs Helen Iloba O. is 43 years old and is married with three children. She specializes in the sale of provisions, drinks and cooking utensils. She lives in Asaba, Delta State, Nigeria. She needs the above loan to buy a deep freezer and more goods for sale, and has been in this business since 2003.

loan.use: To buy a deep freezer & more goods for sale.

loan.name: Florence

texts.en: "I hope to use this loan for the purchase of a generator, weavon hair cream & relaxer," says Mrs. Florence Chukwuji, who lives in Asaba, Delta State, Nigeria. She is 37 years old, and is happily married with (4) children. She started this business eight years ago.

loan.use: To buy a generator, weavons hair cream & relaxer.

loan.name: Veronica

texts.en: Mrs. Veronica A. is a businesswoman who sells provisions and drinks. She is 51 years old, and is married with 4 children. She wishes to buy drinks and provisions with the loan that will be given to her, and she has been in this business since 1986.

loan.use: To buy more provisions & drinks for sale.

loan.name: Hilda

texts.en: Mrs. Hilda I. started her business 3 years ago and it has helped to take care of her family. She lives in Asaba, Delta State, Nigeria. She sells provision & foodstuff to her community. Mrs. Hilda I. is married with (5) children. She intends to expand her business with the above loan.

loan.use: To buy more provision & foodstuff for sale

loan.name: Tina

texts.en: Mrs. Tina L. lives in Asaba, Delta State. She is happy to be a Lift Above Poverty Organization member. She is married with five (5) children. She said LAPO has brought rain to her family and she needs the above loan to expand her business. She has 5 years of experience in her business.

loan.use: To buy more provision & foodstuff for sales

loan.name: Benedette

texts.en: "Lift Above Poverty Organization has brought rain to my family," said Mrs. Benedette A., a native of Anambra State, but residing in Asaba, Delta State. She is 32 years old and married with four (4) children. She deals with foodstuffs and she intends to purchase more with the above loan.

loan.use: To buy more foodstuff for sales

loan.name: Bosede

texts.en: Mr. Bosede O. is a young woman of 31 years, and married with 3 children. She is a native of Ekiti State, Nigeria. She specializes in the sale of clothes, shoes and bags. "I need the above amount to expand my business," said Mrs. Bosede, who has been in this business since 2002.

loan.use: To buy more clothes, bags and shoes

loan.name: Josephine

texts.en: Mrs. Josephine A. is married with six (6) children, and is 45 years old. She hails from Delta State, Nigeria. She is proud of her business and promises to effectively use the above loan to expand her foodstuffs business. She has 25 years of experience in this business.

loan.use: To buy provisions and foodstuffs

loan.name: Roseline

texts.en: Roseline O. is a dedicated client of LAPO, who specializes in the sale of foodstuff, drinks and provisions to her community. She is a native of Ekiti State but resides in Asaba Delta State, Nigeria. She is married with three (3) children, is 40 years old, and wishes to improve her business with the above loan. She has been in business since 2004.

loan.use: To buy provisions and foodstuffs

loan.name: Janet

texts.en: "Lift Above Poverty Organization gave me joy and hope in my business and I am very happy to be a LAPO member," says Mrs. Janet S.. She sells ice blocks and renders a laundry service to people in her area. She is 48, has five children, and hails from Asaba, Delta State. She hopes to improve her business with the above loan.

loan.use: To buy deep freezer and sachet water

loan.name: Francisca

texts.en: "I derive joy in knitting caps, cardigans and babywear. I wish to invest the loan that will been given to me, by purchasing knitting materials," said Mrs. E. Francisca. She is 35 years old, married with a child, and a native of Enugu State of Nigeria, but residing in Asaba Delta State. She has been in this business since 1998.

loan.use: To buy more knitting materials

loan.name: Clement

texts.en: Mr Clement O. is 45 years old and has five children. He is from Uromi town in Edo State. He sells and repairs electrical appliances and needs the above loan to expand his business. He has been in this business since 1985.

loan.use: To expand his electrical appliances business

loan.name: Edwin

texts.en: Edwin Bar is a 40-year-old married man of with four children. He runs a bar and needs an additional deep freezer and chairs. He learned the bar business from his brother and is proud of his business, which he has had since 1999. Mr. Bar would like a loan of $550 to buy a freezer and more chairs for the bar.

loan.use: To buy an additional deep freezer and chairs for his bar

loan.name: Godwin

texts.en: Godwin is a 48 year old fashion designer with six children. She is from Uromi town in Edo State and needs the loan to expand her business. She has been in this business since 1982 and LAPO has helped her improve it.

loan.use: To buy machine, clothes and tailoring materials

loan.name: Patience

texts.en: Mrs. Patience O. is a 28 year old married woman and is from Uromi of Edo State. She is a Hair dresser by profession and has studied hair dressing for three years. She is and has been a LAPO client for 4 years and has been in the hair dressing business for seven years. She needs the above loan to expand her business.

loan.use: To buy freezer, weavons and ladies wears

loan.name: Okoduwa

texts.en: Mr. G. Okoduwa is 31 years old and married with one child. He is an industrious man who has a shop where he sells leather boxes, shoes and bags to the public. He needs the loan for business expansion and has been in this business since 2001.

loan.use: To buy leather boxes, shoes and bags for resale

loan.name: Adolphus

texts.en: Mr. Adolphus I. is 46 years old and married with five (5) children. He is a farmer and has been in this business since 2003. He needs the loan to expand his poultry farm.

loan.use: To buy more poultry for his farming business

loan.name: Stella

texts.en: Mrs. Stella J. is 42 years, has four children and lives in Benin City, Edo state. She wholesales and retails drinks. She has been in this business for nine years and a LAPO member for eight years. She hopes to improve her business with the loan.

loan.use: To buy more drinks for resale.

loan.name: Esohe Azuka

texts.en: Mrs. Esohe Azuka O. is 43 years old, happily married with 4 children. She is from Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria and has been a LAPO member for 5 years. She sells provisions & cosmetics and has been in this business for eight years. She needs the above loan to buy more inventory for re-sale.

loan.use: To buy more goods for sales.

loan.name: Charles

texts.en: Mr. Charles U. has been a LAPO member for 5 years. He lives in Ewa Road, Off Ikpoba Slop, Benin City, Edo State. He states that LAPO has been a sources of income to his business and has helped improve his business and pay for his three children to go to school. He hopes to expand his business with the above loan.

loan.use: For business expansion.

loan.name: Shabani Ally

texts.en:
Shabani is a 33-year-old resident of the Kinondoni area in Central Dar Es Salaam. He has been a technician for aluminum frames for the past five years and has been contracted to design aluminum frames in various offices in Dar es Salaam.

His work is seasonal, so if the contracted work terminates, he looks for another contract immediately. To sustain a living, he has a restaurant at his place where he prepares chips, fried eggs and chicken each evening.

He is in need of US Dollars 1,200 to help him acquire more equipment for his aluminum cutting business so that he can favorably compete and satisfy all his clients.

loan.use: Buying the Aluminium cutting Equipments

loan.name: Ortencia

texts.es:
Ortencia owns a kiosk where she sell sweets in the Plaza 16 de Julio in the city of El Alto. The business allows her to support her entire family, particularly her 4 school age children.

Ortensia has been a Pro Mujer partner for 12 years now. She is a member of the communal association Villazn. Three years ago she started a new business.

At the present time Ortencia is a vendor of wool from the vicua, an animal similar to the llama. She is principal provider of this fine wool for the Norwegian Mission, an organization that demands a lot of this product.

Right now Ortencia needs capital to be able to increase her stock of merchandise, both for her wool business, to meet the demand she's seeing, and for her sweets kiosk. Her objective with the investment is to prepare both businesses for the holidays at the end of the year.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Es duea de un Kiosco de dulces en la Plaza 16 de Julio de la ciudad de El Alto, negocio que le permiti dar sustento a toda su familia, principalmente a sus 4 hijos, los que se encuentran en edad escolar.

Ortencia T. es socia de Pro Mujer hace ya 12 aos, pertenece a la asociacin comunal Villazn, y hace tres aos dio inicio a un nuevo negocio.

En la actualidad Ortencia es comerciante de lana de vicua, y principal proveedora de la Misin Noruega, organizacin de demanda exigente para este producto.

Actualmente Ortencia precisa de inversin de capital para poder incrementar su mercadera, tanto para la demanda de lanas de vicua, como para su kiosco de dulces, todo esto preparando la venta para las fiestas de fin de ao.

loan.use: Ortencia needs capital to be able to increase her stock of merchandise, both for her wool business, to meet the demand she's seeing, and for her sweets kiosk. Her objective with the investment is to prepare both businesses for the holidays at the end of the year.

loan.name: Grace

texts.en: Mrs. Grace O. is a 43 year old widow and LAPO union leader who believes LAPO has really helped her business. She lives in Osazua Street in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria with 5 children. She sells items for babies and hopes to improve her business with the above loan.

loan.use: To buy more baby wares for sale

loan.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio Q., father of 6 children and an artisan shoemaker by profession, has owned a sales stall in the Avenida Circunvalacin for 8 years. He has been a Pro Mujer partner for 12 years. He is one of Pro Mujer's longest standing partners, and belongs to the communal association Villazn.

When he first started his business, Antonio worked in the street, covering his stall with a plastic tarp so he could work through inclement weather, all to support his large family.

At the present time Antonio owns a kiosk on the same street, where he is now better able to work.

Despite his success, he needs to inject capital into his business to be able to buy a motorized sander to use in his kiosk. The sander would allow him to meet his client demand and thereby increase his income, which is important now that his children are growing and their needs are greater.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Antonio Q., padre de 6 hijos y de profesin Artesano Zapatero, hace ms de 8 aos tiene su puesto en la Av. Circunvalacin. Socio de Pro Mujer hace ms de 12 aos, es uno de los ms antiguos, y pertenece a la Asociacin Comunal Villazn.

En sus inicios, Antonio trabajaba en la calle, instalando una carpa de plstico y expuesto a las inclemencias del tiempo, todo para poder llevar el sustento a su numerosa familia.

Actualmente Antonio es dueo de un Kiosco en la misma avenida, donde puede desarrollar de mejor forma su trabajo.

Pese a todo, el necesita de una inyeccin de capital para poder adquirir un motor de lijar, para implementar en su kiosco, de esta manera hacer frente a la demanda de los clientes y de esta manera incrementar sus ingresos, ya que sus hijos van creciendo y sus necesidades son mayores.

loan.use: He needs capital with which to buy a motorized sander to use in the kiosk where he makes shoes. The sander will allow him to meet client demand and increase his income, which in turn will help him support his 6 growing children.

loan.name: Edith

texts.en: Mrs. Edith O. is 45 years old with (6) children and lives in Siluko Road, Benin City Edo State. She sells provisions, kerosene and food stuff. She needs the above loan to improve her business which she has been in since 2002. She is a LAPO member.

loan.use: To buy more food, provisions & kerosene for resale

loan.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa Q. Vda. De Bautista lives in the Sajama area of the city of El Alto with her children and her 9 grandchildren.

She has been a Pro Mujer partner for 5 years. Teresa handcrafts sweaters from wool and then sells her products in the streets of the southern part of the city of La Paz.

With her first Pro Mujer loan, she was able to increase her inventory, which in turn later allowed her to acquire a sewing machine. The machine has allowed her to substantially increase her income. Currently Teresa is making both wool sweaters and baby's clothing (baby's sweaters/jackets). She needs capital to be able to buy raw materials with which to fulfill existing demand, and at the same time plans to expand the variety of products that she offers.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Teresa Q. Vda. De Bautista, vive en la zona Sajama de la ciudad de El Alto, en compaa de sus hijos y sus 9 nietos.

Socia de Pro Mujer hace 5 aos, Teresa se dedica a la confeccin de chompas de lana, mismas que comercializa de forma ambulante en la zona sur de la ciudad de La Paz .

Con su primer desembolso, logra incrementar su mercadera, para posteriormente adquirir una mquina de costura, lo que le permite mejorar sus ingresos sustancialmente.

Actualmente Teresa paralelamente a la confeccin de chompas de lana se dedica a confeccionar ropa de bebe (chambritas), y necesita de ms capital para poder comprar materia prima que le permita satisfacer la demanda existente y del mismo modo aumentar la variedad de sus productos.

loan.use: Buy raw materials with which to meet existing demand and offer a wider variety of products

loan.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther E., is a 62 year old widow with 5 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She has being with LAPO for 5 years and believes it has been a source of financial strength for her business. She sells food stuff and needs the money to buy more food for resale.

loan.use: To purchase food for resale

loan.name: Ruth

texts.es:
Ruth Morn Salazar is married to a taxi driver and is the mother of 4 children. She has been a Pro Mujer partner for more than 2 years. She prepares and sells a type of fried empanadas known as empanadas tucumanas, by contract and to order. At the same time she also works selling various products, decorative items, small appliances, jewelry and other items that she brings from the city of Oruro.

At the present time Ruth is simply maintaining her commercial business while focusing principally on her fried empanada business. She acquired an industrial frier, which allows her to sign contracts for greater volume and in this way increase the income she provides to her family. Ruth needs capital to be able to build her inventory of merchandise now, in preparation for the holidays at the end of the year. As December nears, the prices she pays for the merchandise she sells will increase, reducing her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Ruth Morn Salazar, casada con un chofer de taxi, y madre de 4 hijos, es socia de Pro Mujer hace ms de 2 aos, se dedica a la preparacin de empanadas fritas (tucumanas) segn contrato y a pedido. Paralelamente a esta actividad, la seora Ruth se dedica a la comercializacin de productos varios, como ser adornos, electrodomsticos, joyas, y otros que trae de la ciudad de Oruro.

En la actualidad la seora Ruth, mantiene su negocio de comercio de productos y principalmente la preparacin de empanadas fritas a contrato. Para esto ella adquiri una freidora industrial, la que le permite firmar contratos por una mayor cantidad, de esta forma generar mayores ingresos para su familia.

Ruth necesita de capital para poder preparar toda su mercadera en vista de la cercana de las fiestas de fin de ao, puesto que a medida de que pasa el tiempo y se acerca el mes de diciembre, los precios de la mercadera que comercializa, se incrementa y por tanto reducen sus ganancias.

loan.use: Ruth needs capital to be able to build an inventory of merchandise now in preparation for the holidays at the end of the year. As December nears, the prices she pays for the merchandise she sells will increase, reducing her earnings.

loan.name: Nicolasa

texts.es:
Nicolasa works in a primary school in which she has been provided with an area where she can sell her typical local foods, including tacos, tortas, chalupas (stuffed tortillas) and empanadas, along with sweets, cookies and soft drinks. She is 48 years old and married with 5 children. Her husband works in construction as a bricklayer. She belongs to the loan group Fanny 7, together with Mrs. Carmen Garca Snchez, who sells sweets and cookies, and Mrs. Alicia Gmez Cruz, who owns a grocery store. With the loan they hope to make improvements to their work places and Alicia will buy merchandise with which to better stock her grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Nicolasa trabaja en una escuela primaria en donde le facilitan un lugar en donde pueda vender productos tpicos de la zona (tacos, tortas, chalupas, empanadas) y adems dulces, galletas y refrescos. Ella tiene 48 aos, casada, cinco hijos y su esposo trabaja en la construccin como albail. Ella pertenece al grupo Fanny 7, junto con: doa Carmen Garca Snchez (venta de dulces y galletas), y doa Alicia Gmez Cruz (tienda de abarrotes). Con el prstamo esperan poder acondicionar los lugares de trabajo y Alicia comprar mercadera para abastecer mejor su tienda de abarrotes.

loan.use: sales of typical foods

loan.name: Patience

texts.en: Mrs. Patience E. is 58 years old and happily married with 5 children. She hails from an urban sector of Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She makes soap and sells oil wholesale. She needs the above loan to buy gallons and drums of oil for making soap.

loan.use: To buy oil for her soapmaking business

loan.name: Mkwamba

texts.en:
Mkwebmba is a 53-year-old resident of Dar Es Salaam, Tanzania. She is married with four children and two other dependents. For the past three years, she has been running a charcoal business at her home. She has suppliers from up-country, mainly from the Morogoro and Pwani Regions of central Tanzania, and she sells at place as a retailer. Apart from charcoal, she also rents chairs for various functions like weddings and other public gatherings, and this business is still in its initial stages.

She is need of 450 US dollars to help her boost her charcoal business.

loan.use: Expand Stock

loan.name: Selma

texts.es:
A member of the communal association Stars of the Sea of the Villa Adela center, Selma is a stylist by profession and the mother of 2 school age children. She joined Pro Mujer approximately a year and a half ago.

She used to work as an assistant in various beauty salons on the Avenida 16 de Julio, dreaming of the day when she would be able to have her own business.

Two years ago, thanks to the help of a relative, Selma succeeded in opening her own beauty salon, very modest and with barely the space necessary. Thanks to her first loan, she was able to buy hair color, creams and other products she needs for her work.

At the moment Selma needs capital to be able to expand her business. Thanks to her good work, demand for her services is outpacing her capacity to provide them. For this reason, she would like to buy a stylist's table and more materials to be able to hire employees and establish herself in the industry, thereby improving her quality of her life and that of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Pertenece a la Asociacin Comunal Estrellas de Mar del Centro Focal de Villa Adela, de profesin estilista, Selma R. es madre de 2 hijos en edad escolar. Ingresa a Pro Mujer hace aproximadamente 1 ao y medio.

Trabaj como ayudante en varios salones de belleza de la Av. 16 de Julio, soando siempre en el da en que podra tener su propio negocio.

Hace 2 aos y gracias a la ayuda de uno de sus familiares, Selma logra la apertura de su propio saln de belleza, muy modesto y con el mobiliario apenas necesario. Gracias al primer crdito desembolsado, logra comprar tintes, cremas y otros productos para poder realizar su trabajo.

Actualmente Selma necesita de capital para poder ampliar su negocio, puesto que gracias a su buen trabajo, la demanda de su clientela rebasa su capacidad, es por eso que quiere comprar un tocador y ms material de trabajo para poder tener algunos dependientes y establecerse en el rubro, mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

loan.use: Selma needs capital to be able to expand her business. Thanks to her good work, demand for her services is outpacing her capacity; she would like to buy a stylist's table and more materials which would allow her to hire employees and establish herself in the industry.

loan.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia sells clothes that she buys at the border with Guatemala, in a place called Mesilla, because they're less expensive there; she then sells them in a shop that she borrows or, sometimes, from her house. She is 40 years old and married with four children. She wants to use the loan to get her own shop so that she can display her products there. She belongs to the Francelia 3 group along with dona Martha Navarro Diaz (grocery store) and dona Guadalupe Navarro Diaz (grocery store). They'll combine the loan and buy merchandise at wholesale that they'll then divide up to stock their stores.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

ALICIA se dedica a la venta de ropa que compra en la frontera con Guatemala en un lugar llamado Mesilla ya que ah es ms econmica, posteriormente lo vende en un local que le prestan y a veces en su casa. Ella tiene 40 aos, casada, cuatro hijos. Con el prstamo quiere conseguir su propio local y exponer ah sus productos. Pertenece al grupo Francelia 3 junto con doa Martha Navarro Daz (tienda de abarrotes) y doa Guadalupe Navarrro Daz (tienda de abarrotes). Ambas juntaran su prstamo y compraran mercadera al por mayor y luego se la repartirn para abastecer sus tiendas.

loan.use: Clothing sales.

loan.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy D., a member of the Villa Adela Association, is a mother of 3 school-age children. She joined Pro Mujer approximately 1 years ago and worked, from 5 years ago, as a beautician at businesses dedicated to that field.

Three months ago, she changed her line of work and now sells electrical appliances that she brings from the city of Oruro, a business that seems to be more lucrative than what she was doing before.

Nancy now needs to pull together enough capital so that she can take an empty store in her house and convert it to a shop for the sale of electrical appliances, etc., but that will only be possible when she pulls together around $2,000. In the meantime, her goal is to travel to the Oruro to be able to take advantage of the prices before the holidays at the end of the year.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

Nancy D., pertenece a la Asociacin Villa Adela, es madre de 3 hijos en edad escolar. Ingresa a Pro Mujer hace aproximadamente 1 ao y medio y trabaja hace 5 aos como consultora de belleza en empresas dedicadas a este rubro.

Hace 3 meses cambia de rubro y se dedica a la comercializacin de electrodomsticos que trae de la ciudad de Oruro, negocio que al parecer le trae ms rditos que su anterior actividad.

Actualmente Nancy precisa reunir capital, puesto que ella tiene una tienda vaca en su domicilio, que quiere convertir en un centro de venta de electrodomsticos y varios, pero esto solo ser posible cuando ella rena aproximadamente 2 mil dlares. Mientras tanto su objetivo son los viajes a la ciudad de Oruro para poder aprovechar los precios antes de las fiestas de fin de ao.

loan.use: Nancy needs to pull together enough capital so that she can take an empty store in her house and convert it to a shop for the sale of electrical appliances, etc.

loan.name: Mayda Araceli

texts.es:
Mayda sells perfumes and cosmetics to the people of her neighborhood. She also sells clothes from her house that she buys in San Cristobal de las Casas. She is 28 years old and married with two children. Her husband works in the fields planting maiz. She belongs to the Fracelia 3 group with dona Delsi P. P. (perfume and cosmetics sales) and dona Hilse Ovando Ramirez (footwear sales). They hope to use the loan to buy more merchandise so that they have better supplies to offer their customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

MAYDA, se dedica a la venta de perfumes y cosmticos a pedido de la gente de su comunidad, adems vende ropa en su casa la cual va a comprar a San Cristbal de las Casas, ella esta casada, tiene 28 aos, dos hijos y su esposo trabaja en el campo en la siembra del maz. Ella pertenece al grupo Francelia 3 junto con doa Delsi Prez Prez (venta de perfumes y cosmticos) y doa Hilse Ovando Ramrez (venta de calzado). Con el prstamo esperan comprar ms mercanca para tener mayor surtido para ofrecerle a sus clientas.

loan.use: Clothing sales

loan.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria E. is 54 years old, happily married with 6 children and lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells used bed spreads, wrappers, curtains and shoes. She is a union leader and has being with LAPO for 4 years. She needs this money to expand her business.

loan.use: To expand her business

loan.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina M., a divorced mother of two, is the treasurer of the Estrellas de Mar association, of Villa Adela and a street vendor who earns her living making pastries: pan dulces, masitas, cookies, cakes, etc. She makes the pastries herself and then sells them at sports centers, plazas and parks in the area so that she can try and help herself and her children get ahead.

Cristina used to work at a company that exported broad beans but after a gall bladder illness, she had to leave the job. She subsequently worked at making traditional vicuna blankets but because her health was fragile, she wasnt able to continue. Back pains and some heart problems forced her to change her line of work so she taught herself the art of the pastry shop.

Cristina now needs capital so that she can buy an industrial oven that will allow her to increase her production, improve her earnings and get ahead with her two children.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

Cristina M., divorciada y madre de 2 hijos, es tesorera de la asociacin Estrellas de Mar, de Villa Adela, se dedica a la repostera, pan dulce, masitas, galletas, queques, productos que ella misma prepara y que luego deambula por los centros deportivos, plazas y parques de la zona, con lo cual trata de salir adelante en compaa de sus hijos.

Anteriormente, Cristina trabajaba en una empresa de exportacin de habas, pero a consecuencia de una complicacin vesicular, tuvo que dejar el trabajo. Posteriormente se dedico a la confeccin artesanal de mantas de vicua, pero la fragilidad de su salud no le permiti seguir, ya que los dolores de espalda y algunas dolencias pulmonares, la obligaron a cambiar de rubro y aprender autodidcticamente el arte de la repostera.

Actualmente Cristina necesita de capital para poder comprar un horno industrial que le permita incrementar su produccin, de esta manera intentar mejorar sus ingresos y salir adelante con sus dos hijos.

loan.use: Cristina needs capital so that she can buy an industrial oven that will allow her to increase her production, improve her earnings and get ahead with her two children.

loan.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz sells clothes which she buys in the city of Tuxtla Gutierrez (an hour from her town) and then sells on the streets of the neighborhoods near her town. She is a 52-year old widow with 9 children. She belongs to the Jastic 1 group along with dona Lorena Jimenez P. (clothes sales) and Carmen H. Morales (food and sweets sales). With the loan, they will buy more clothes to supply their businesses and Carmen wants to fix up a place at the school where she sells her products.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

LUZ se dedica a la venta de ropa la cual va a comprar a la ciudad de Tuxtla Gutirrez (a una hora de su localidad) y posteriormente la vende de manera ambulante en las colonias cercanas a su localidad. Ella tiene 52 aos, tuvo 9 hijos y esta viuda. Pertenece la grupo Jastic 1 junto con doa Lorena Jimnez Prez (venta de ropa) y Carmen Hernndez Morales (venta de comida y dulces). Ellas con el prstamo compraran mas ropa para abastecer sus negocios y Carmen quiere acondicionar un lugar en la escuela donde vende sus productos.

loan.use: Clothes sales.

loan.name: Adesuwa

texts.en: Adesuwa Igbeinovia is 40 yearls old and married with 5 children; she is from Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells clothes, shoes & bags. She needs the above loan for expansion.

loan.use: To buy shoes, clothes & bags for resale

loan.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia R., the head of the Flor de la Canela association, has been a member of Pro Mujer for approximately 10 years; shes married, with 5 grown children, and works at making all kinds of clothing.

Julia has worked at clothes-making since 1977; along with her husband, she was able to establish this business by introducing her products at the main street markets in the city.

Julia now needs capital to be able to buy a fusionadora (a machine for clothes-making) that will allow her to increase the variety of clothes that she makes. She has also started the process of legalizing her small business and completing the necessary requirements for registering it, with all the social obligations and taxes that entails, but all the benefits, too.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

Julia Rodrguez, es jefa de grupo de la asociacin Flor de la Canela, aproximadamente 10 aos que permanece en Pro Mujer, es casada, con 5 hijos mayores, se dedica a la confeccin de de todo tipo de prendas de vestir.

Desde el ao 1977, Julia se dedica a la confeccin, al lado de su marido pudo establecer este negocio, introduciendo sus productos en las principales ferias de esta ciudad.

Actualmente Julia precisa de capital para poder comprar una mquina fusionadora que le permita incrementar la variedad de piezas y confecciones. Del mismo modo ha iniciado el proceso de legalizacin de su pequea empresa y cumpliendo los requisitos necesarios para poder registrarse con todas las obligaciones sociales e impositivas y del mismo modo recibir los beneficios que esto conlleva.

loan.use: Julia needs capital to be able to buy a fusionadora (a machine for clothes-making) that will allow her to increase the variety of clothes that she makes.

loan.name: Lucinda Esperanza

texts.es:
Lucinda is 58-years old and married, with six children; her husband is a farmer. She sells fruits, vegetables, clay pots and other products that aren't readily available in the neighborhoods where she goes, from a pushcart. She belongs to the Jastic 1 group, along with dona Irene Jimenez Perez (clothes sales), Areli Hernandez Perez (baked chicken sales) and Floridalma Perez Lopez (shoe sales). With the loan, they will increase their supplies of goods for sale.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

LUCINDA tiene 58 aos, casada, seis hijos, y su esposo trabaja en el campo como agricultor. Ella se dedica a la venta de frutas, verduras, ollas de barro y en general productos que no se encuentran en las colonias a las cuales va a vender en un carro ambulante. Pertenece al grupo Jastic 1, junto con doa Irene Jimnez Prez (venta de ropa), Areli Hernndez Prez (venta de pollo horneado) y Floridalma Prez Lpez (venta de zapatos). Con el prstamo aumentaran el abastecimiento de mercanca.

loan.use: Fruit and vegetable sales.

loan.name: Teodocia

texts.es:
Teodocia Tinini, the mother of a 4-year old child, is single and a member of the Flor de la Canela community association; she operates a small grocery store that she managed to open with the help of Pro Mujer.

Previously, Teodocia worked at making and selling vicuna blankets, a business that supported her for almost 10 years and that was passed down to her by her family, her mother, mainly.
