Currently, Teodocia manages her own small store and needs capital to set up a telephone call station, something that will eventually lead to her getting a house for herself and her son; the house that she rents now takes so much of her earnings that she cant provide the things her little one needs.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

Teodocia T., es madre de 1 nio de 4 aos, soltera, y miembro de la asociacin comunal Flor de la canela, se dedica a la atencin de una pequea tienda de abarrotes, que logro abrir con la ayuda de Pro Mujer.

Anteriormente, Teodocia se dedicaba a la confeccin y venta de mantas de vicua, negocio en el que se mantuvo casi por 10 aos, y que era una herencia familiar, principalmente de su madre.

Actualmente Teodocia administra su pequeo almacn, pero necesita de capital para poder instalar una central de llamadas telefnicas, de esta manera ver la manera de conseguir una vivienda para ella y su hijo, ya que el alquiler de la casa donde vive, resta mucho sus ingresos y no permite brindar las comodidades necesarias a su pequeo.

loan.use: Teodocia manages her own small store and needs capital to set up a telephone call station, something that will eventually lead to her getting a house for herself and her son; the house that she rents now takes so much of her earnings that she cant provide the things her little one needs.

loan.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose O. is 39 years old and has 6 children. She lives in an urban area of Benin City, Edo State Nigeria. She sells food & provisions and needs the above loan to expand her business. She believes that LAPO has helped her business expand to a greater height.

loan.use: To buy more provision & food stuff

loan.name: Rosa Isabel

texts.es:
Rosa is a 30-year old single woman. To help her family, she has a cafe with a partner, Margarita M. J., who is another member of the Jastic 2 group. The other members of the group are Dona Ernestina Bautista (clothes sales) and Antonia M. J. (sales of plastic containers for storing food). With the loan, Rosa and Margarita will improve the look of the cafe to draw more customers; Ernestina will buy more clothes in different sizes to increase her customer base; and Antonia will buy more supplies of containers.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

ROSA tiene 30 aos, soltera. Para ayudar a su familia tiene una cafetera en sociedad con Margarita Mndez Jurez quien es otra integrante del grupo Jastic 2. Las otras integrantes del grupo son doa Ernestina Bautista (venta de ropa) y Antonia Mndez Jurez (venta de posillos de plstico para mantener alimento). Con el prstamo Rosa y Margarita hermosearan el local para una mejor atencin a sus clientes, Ernestina comprara mas ropa en diferentes tallas para aumentar su clientela, y Antonia comprara mas surtido de trastes.

loan.use: Cafe

loan.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel Manai de Chura has 7 children. She runs a small grocery store, and in additions she sells food. She distributes her efforts over the days of the week.

On Wednesdays and Saturdays, she sells vegetables in the market place of the Luis Espinal neighborhood of El Alto. On Thursdays and Sundays, she sells food in the marketplace "16 de Julio", also in the city of El Alto. The rest of the days she works in her grocery store.

She needs money to increase her merchandise, and to buy foodstuffs in order to be able to open a lunch restaurant as there is a great need for this in her neighborhood. This is the only way Isabel can maintain the large number of children she has.

Translated by Ramn F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer

Original description in Spanish:

Isabel M. de Chura, es madre de 7 hijos, se dedica a la atencin de un pequeo almacn de abarrotes, pero paralelamente vende comida, actividades que distribuye muy bien durante la semana.

Los das mircoles y sbado se dedica a la venta de verduras en la feria de la zona Luis Espinal, y los das jueves y domingo se dedica a la venta de comida en la feria 16 de Julio, tambin de la ciudad de El Alto, el resto de los das de la semana se dedica a la atencin de su almacn.

Ella precisa de dinero para poder incrementar su mercadera, y del mismo modo aprovisionarse de insumos para la atencin de sus comensales, ya que su principal objetivo es la apertura de un restaurante para la atencin de almuerzos, para satisfacer la gran demanda de su zona. Solo de esta forma podr dar sustento al gran nmero de hijos que Isabel tiene.

loan.use: To increase her merchandise and to buy foodstuffs in order to be able to open a lunch restaurant

loan.name: Priscilla

texts.en: Mrs. Priscilla O. is 35 years old, married with 3 children and hails from an urban sector in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. She has been with LAPO for 2 years. She sells drugs and need the above loan to improve her business. She has been in this business since 2000.

loan.use: To buy drugs for sale

loan.name: Maria Graciela

texts.es:
Maria Graciela sells refreshments from a small store she runs from her home in order to contribute to the family income. She is 21 years old and single. She belongs to the group "Jastic 2", together with Mrs. Mariana Hernndez Prez (sale of fruits and vegetables), and Mrs. Lili Cruz Narvez (sale of clothing). With the loan, Maria Graciela plans to expand her store, Mariana will buy a cart to go out and sell her products to nearby neighborhoods, and Lili will buy a large assortment of clothing.

Translated by Ramn F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer

Original description in Spanish:

MARIA GRACIELA se dedica a la venta de refrescos en un pequeo depsito que tiene en su casa y de esta forma contribuye al gasto familiar, es soltera y tiene 21 aos. Pertenece la grupo Jastic 2 junto con doa Mariana Hernndez Prez (venta de frutas y verduras) y doa Lili Cruz Narvez (venta de ropa). Con el prstamo Maria Graciela agrandara su local, Mariana comprara un carrito para salir a vender sus productos a las colonias cercanas, y Lili comprara un gran surtido de ropa.

loan.use: Sale of refreshments

loan.name: Lucefina

texts.es:
Lucefina is a widow of 63 years old, with 5 children. She has a small restaurant in her home. With the loan, she wants to do maintenance to her restaurant and improve it to provide a better ambient to her customers. She belongs to the group "Jastic 3" together with Mrs. Aurora Prez Mora (artist), Maria Victoria Prez Cruz (bakery), and Mara Molina Urbina (sale of bracelets, rings, and necklaces). With the loan, Aurora will buy thread and lace to make traditional clothes from Chiapas; Maria Victoria will buy a quintal (~100 lbs) of flour to increase her bread production, and Mara will buy a showcase to exhibit her products.

Translated by Ramn F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer

Original description in Spanish:

LUCEFINA es viuda, tiene 63 aos, cinco hijos. Ella tiene un pequeo restaurante instalado en su casa, con el prstamo espera darle mantenimiento a su local y adecuarlo de una mejor manera para la atencin de sus clientes. Pertenece al grupo Jastic 3 junto con doa Aurora Prez Mora (artesana), Maria Victoria Prez Cruz (panadera) y Maria Molina Urbina (venta de pulseras, aillos y collares). Con el prstamo Aurora comprara hilos, encajes para hacer trajes tpicos del estado chiapaneco, Maria Victoria comprara un quintal de harina para aumentar la produccin de su pan y Mara comprara una vitrina para exhibir sus productos.

loan.use: Restaurant

loan.name: Bola

texts.en: Mrs. Bola I. is 52 years old and married with 5 children. She lives in an urban area in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells clothing and needs money to buy more clothes. She has been in this business since 2002

loan.use: To purchase more clothing for sale

loan.name: Nidia Guadalupe

texts.es:
Nidia is 26 years old, married, with 1 child. Her husband is an electrician. She owns a beauty salon where she treats women of her community: hair cuts, manicures, and make-up for social events. She will invest the loan in the purchase of beauty products. She belongs to the group "Jastic 4" together with Mrs. Maria Candelaria Hernndez Lpez (door-to-door sales of tamales) and Mrs. Ana Isabel Valencia Daz (food sales). They will invest their loans in kitchen utensils and raw products to make their products.

Translated by Ramn F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer

Original description in Spanish:

NIDIA tiene 26 aos, casada, un hijo, su esposo es electricista. Ella una esttica en donde atiende a las mujeres de su localidad cortndoles el cabello, arreglo de uas, y maquillndolas para los eventos sociales, con el prstamo invertir en la compra de productos de belleza. Pertenece al grupo Jastic 4 junto con doa Maria Candelaria Hernndez Lpez (venta de tamales casa por casa) y doa Ana Isabel Valencia Daz (venta de comida). Ellas dos invertirn su prstamo en utensilios de cocina y materia prima para elaborar sus productos.

loan.use: Beauty salon

loan.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah O. is 44 years old and married with 4 children, she hails from an urban area in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She has been member of LAPO for four years. She sells smoked fish and needs the above loan to expand her business. She has been in this business since 1971.

loan.use: To invest in her fishing business

loan.name: Benita

texts.es:
Benita sells dairy products from her home (cheese, cream, yogurt, and milk). She is married, 64 years old, and has 5 children. Her husband is a farmer. With her share of the loan, she wants to buy a refrigerator to preserve her products for a longer time. She belongs to the group "Jastic 5", together with Mrs. Lucinda Hernndez Lpez (sales of tacos from her home), who, with her part of the loan, wants to set up a space and buy kitchen utensils for improved production of her food products.

Translated by Ramn F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer

Original description in Spanish:

BENITA se dedica a la venta de productos lcteos en su domicilio (queso, crema, yogurt, leche), ella es casada, tiene 64 aos, tuvo cinco hijos, su esposo es agricultor, con la parte de su prstamo quiere comprar un refrigerador para conservar sus productos por mas tiempo. Pertenece al grupo Jastic 5 junto con doa Lucinda Hernndez Lpez (venta de tacos en su casa) con la parte de su prstamo acondicionara el lugar y comprara utensilios de cocina para la mejor elaboracin de sus alimentos.

loan.use: Dairy sales

loan.name: Tina

texts.en: Tina Z. is a 35 year old single woman; she lives in an urban area in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She has been in business since 1999. LAPO has improved my financial life style she said, I have being in LAPO for the past 5 years as a leader of the union. I am 35 years old. She sells fabrics, shoes, bags and jewelery. She needs a loan to buy more goods for sale.

loan.use: To buy fabrics, shoes, jewelery & bags for sale

loan.name: Araceli

texts.es:
Araceli is 34 years old, married, and has three children. Her husband works in construction. She prepares food by order for social events in her community. She belongs to the group "Jastic 5", together with Eunice Snchez Beltrn (food sales to community- together with Araceli). With the loan, they want to buy kitchen utensils and to set up a kitchen where they can prepare food in large quantities.

Translated by Ramn F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer

Original description in Spanish:

ARACELI tiene 34 aos, casada, tres hijos, su esposo trabaja en la construccin. Ella se dedica a preparar comida a pedido para eventos sociales dentro de su localidad. Pertenece al grupo Jastic 5 junto con Eunice Snchez Beltrn (venta de comida en sociedad con Araceli) por lo tanto con el prstamo esperan comprar utensilios de cocina y acondicionar un lugar especial para preparar alimentos en grandes cantidades.

loan.use: Food Sales

loan.name: Iyobosa Isere

texts.en: "My LAPO loan has lifted my business," says Mr. Iyobosa Isere E., who lives in the urban area in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. He is 37 years old and has 2 children. He sells fairly used clothes and needs the above amount for the expansion of his business. He has been in business since 2000.

loan.use: To buy bales of fairly-used clothes to add to his inventory

loan.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mrs. Mercy O. is married with 4 children; she is 50 years old and lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. Mercy has been with LAPO for 4 years. She has a little restaurant and needs this loan to improve her micro-business. She hopes that with the loan of $275 she will be able to improve the quality and quantity of her food and provide services to more customers.

loan.use: To buy cartons of drinks & foodstuffs for her little restaurant

loan.name: Vera

texts.en:
Vera is a widow who is raising her thirteen year old daughter on her own. She supports herself and her daughter with an exciting cosmetics sales business in the city of Ivano-Frankivsk in western Ukraine.

Vera has a network of five sales kiosks and has hired sixteen employees to work for her. She took over running the business after her husband passed away. He originally started selling fifteen years ago. Lower prices than her competitors and good locations for her sales kiosks have been two factors contributing to the success of Veras enterprise. Loans received through Nadiya Ukraine have also helped her expand her business.

One of Veras present goals is to focus on developing her current sales locations. She has requested a loan to help purchase a bulk supply of perfume to sell in her kiosks.

loan.use: Purchase perfume in bulk for cosmetics business

loan.name: Sergei

texts.en:
Sergei owns a mens clothing business at the Sigma Sport market in Nikolaev, Ukraine. He started his business three years ago because he saw a potential for growth. Sergei has requested a loan to help accomplish some of that growth by opening a second sales location. He has developed a solid business and is looking forward to expanding.

Sergei is a hard worker and is very dedicated to what he does which shows in how he conducts his business. His large product selection and quality items are popular with his customers. Sergei is married and he has one daughter who is a college student.

Sergei is grateful for the financial assistance he has received from Nadiya Ukraine. Using capital from a previous loan, he was able to increase his sales and his profits went up. As a result of Sergeis experience using micro-lending, one of his neighbors in the market heard about the financial resources that are available from Nadiya Ukraine and was also able to obtain a business loan. We a happy for this and many other opportunities to make a difference in the lives of entrepreneurs like Sergei.

loan.use: Open second sales location

loan.name: Joy

texts.en: Mrs. Joy O. is married with 5 children and is 50 years old. She comes from Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. Joy has been with LAPO for 10 years. She sells foodstuffs and meats. She needs a loan of $325 to buy bags of rice, beans, and other foodstuffs to expand the inventory of her little shop.

loan.use: To buy bags of rice, beans, etc. to expand her inventory

loan.name: Alis

texts.en: Alis A. is 64, a widow with 6 children, from a semi-urban area in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She has been a member of LAPO for 7 years as a leader of a union. Alis sells drinks and operates a guest house. She needs a loan of $525 to buy more drinks and to maintain her guest house.

loan.use: To buy more soft drinks for resale

loan.name: Obosa

texts.en:
"I sell soft drinks wholesale to people in my community. Serving my customers gives me great satisfaction." says Mrs. Obosa U., a member of one of the LAPO branches in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria.

Obosa is 36 years old, married with two children. She hopes to expand her business with this loan of $800. Obosa has been in business since 2004.

loan.use: To buy more soft drinks for her wholesale business

loan.name: Habiba

texts.ru:
Habiba is 39 years old and works for the state. By her sister's advice she decided to start her own business in addition to her job. She travels to pick up the goods that her sister sells for her. The assortment of goods includes women's clothing and foot wear. Habiba has been an active Mikroinvest client since 2005. Her business has grown to twice it's original size. She purchases the goods not only from the local wholesale stores, but directly from the city of Alma Ata's wholesale dealers. Because of this she makes more profits. Currently Habiba has no permanent trading place, that is why she is applying for a loan to expand her business and use the profits towards rent. The picture shows Habiba's sister.

Translated from Russian by Elena Sheyner, Kiva volunteer.

. , , . , . 39 . . 2005 . . -. . , , , , . .

loan.use: to expand the business

loan.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 32 years old. She has 2 children whom she is responsible to support, since her husband was killed in a terrorist attack. She has a sewing business in her home. She has applied to get $1000 to purchase a new sewing machine and more cloth. She want s to develop her business and increase her sales to enhance her living standard .

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loan.use: Purchase new sewing machine

loan.name: Lus Carlos

texts.en:
Luis is a hard working man, born in the town of Linares in Nuevo Leon. He's married and has four children. His wife runs a small grocery store. After being laid off from his last job three years ago, Luis started a business renting video game machines. He started out with only two machines, but through hard work and good service his business has grown rapidly and he now owns fifteen video game machines.

Luis is requesting a loan of US $250 to buy new games with which to program his video game machines, allowing him to provide better service. He will repay this loan over a period of 3 months. Your support can help Luis expand his business.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

En estos momentos Lus est solicitando un prstamo de $ 250 dlares que destinar a la compra de discos de videojuegos recientes para actualizar la programacin de sus mquinas y mejorar la calidad de su servicio, l se compromete a retornar esta cantidad en 3 meses. T puedes ayudar a esta familia contribuyendo al crecimiento de su negocio, no lo dudes ms y decdete a apoyar a Lus.

loan.use: Maintenance and Updating of Equipment

loan.name: Martina Isabel

texts.en:
Martina is 35 years old and lives with her common-law partner and their children, 11 and 15 years old. Her partner works in construction. Two years ago, Martina started her own business preparing and selling foods to help improve her family's quality of life. She had gained experience in this industry while working with her sister, who ran a similar business. Little by little she has gained many customers and her business has grown significantly.

Martina also does catering for special events and she has been asked to cater a wedding. She is asking for a loan of US $250 to buy the ingredients and supplies she will need to meet this order. She agrees to repay the loan over a period of 4 months and thanks you for providing her with the opportunity to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Martina tiene 35 aos de edad, vive en unin libre y tiene dos hijos, de 11 y 15 aos de edad. Su pareja se dedica a la construccin y para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia Martina decidi iniciar su propio negocio hace dos aos con la elaboracin y venta de comidas, anteriormente le ayudaba a su hermana que tena un negocio similar, en donde adquiri experiencia y despus decidi independizarse, poco a poco fue dndose a conocer y gracias al buen servicio que ofrece ha logrado tener muchos clientes y hacer crecer su negocio.,

Martina tambin elabora banquetes para eventos especiales y en estos momentos tiene un pedido para boda, pero no cuenta con los ingredientes necesarios para la elaboracin de los alimentos, por este motivo est solicitando un prstamo de $ 250 dlares que emplear en la compra de los insumos que necesita, ella ofrece regresar esta cantidad en 4 meses. Hoy puedes ayudar a quien ms lo necesita, Martina y su familia agradecen mucho la oportunidad que les brindas de poder mejorar y hacer crecer su negocio.

loan.use: To purchase supplies

loan.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Maria Elena is 30 years old, lives with her domestic partner and has three children (3, 7 and 11 years old). Her partner Oscar is a construction worker, but his salary is insufficient to cover the basic needs of the family. For this reason, Maria started her grocery store business four years ago. Previously, she used to sell clothes, but the profit was not good. Now with her store she is doing much better and, little by little, has managed to increase the variety of the products she offers, as well as the number of her clients. The love for her family and her wish that their children have access to a good education motivate her to try harder every day.

In order to continue growing and to improve the quality of the service she offers, she is requesting a $250 loan, that shell repay in four months, and which she plans to use for the purchase of merchandise to cover the needs of her clients. Maria trusts people that help the most needful and is very grateful for the opportunity she is being given to improve and to make her business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Elena tiene 30 aos de edad, vive en unin libre y tiene tres hijos, de 3, 7 y 11 aos de edad. scar, su pareja, trabaja en la construccin, pero su salario es insuficiente para cubrir las necesidades bsicas de su familia. Por este motivo, Maria comenz su negocio de abarrotes hace cuatro aos. Anteriormente venda ropa pero no reciba buenas ganancias. Ahora con su tienda le ha ido mucho mejor y poco a poco ha logrado incrementar la variedad de productos que ofrece en su negocio, as como sus clientes. El amor hacia su familia y el deseo de que sus hijos puedan tener acceso a una buena educacin la motivan a esforzase ms cada da.

Para continuar creciendo y mejorar la calidad del servicio que ofrece, ahora Maria est solicitando un prstamo de $250 dlares, que regresar en 4 meses, y que planea utilizar en la compra de mercanca para cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes. Maria confa en las personas que ayudan a quien ms lo necesitan, ella agradece mucho la oportunidad que se le brinda de poder mejorar y hacer crecer su negocio.

loan.use: Purchase of merchandise

loan.name: Jos Hctor

texts.en:
Jose Hector is a 64 year old widower who has eight children. Finding it very difficult to find a job and needing to generate an income, he started his own small business six years ago selling groceries. He started out selling a small selection of basic products and added to his inventory as he gained more customers. His business has expanded greatly thanks to his efforts and he was recently able to purchase a larger refrigerator.

Jose is requesting a loan of US $650 to purchase additional merchandise to stock his store and meet his customers' demand. He will repay this loan over a period of 6 months. Your support will help improve his life and expand his business. Thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Jos Hctor es un hombre muy responsable y trabajador, tiene 64 aos de edad, es viudo y tiene 8 hijos. Ante la dificultad de encontrar un empleo y para obtener los recursos que necesita, Jos inici su propio negocio con la venta de abarrotes hace seis aos, comenz con muy pocos productos, los de mayor demanda, y poco a poco fue surtiendo mejor e incorporando la venta de ms productos, recientemente ha adquirido un enfriador ms grande y su negocio ha crecido mucho gracias al buen trabajo que realiza da con da.

En estos momentos, Jos necesita un crdito de $ 650 dlares que emplear en la compra de mercanca para continuar creciendo con su negocio y poder cubrir todas las necesidades de sus clientes, l se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. T puedes mejorar la vida de Jos y ayudarlo a continuar creciendo con su negocio, no lo dudes ms, tu ayuda ser de mucha utilidad para Jos, muchas gracias.

loan.use: To purchase merchandise

loan.name: Esteban

texts.en:
Esteban is married and has four sons and two daughters; he's originally from Veracruz, where he started his business selling elotes - corn on the cob -fifteen years ago. Seeking better opportunities, he moved his family to Linares, Nuevo Leon, where he continued his business assisted by his wife and children. Through hard work he has been able to buy two food carts that he uses to sell his products. He's also been able to finance his home and buy a pick up truck. When the opportunity arises, he also works as a mover and making deliveries.

Esteban is a very responsible and entrepreneurial man who wants the best for his family. He's requesting a loan in the amount of US $325 to buy supplies and to expand his elote business. He will repay the loan over a period of 6 months. You can become an important part of his family's life by supporting his business. He is grateful for the opportunity and considers any assistance a blessing.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Esteban es casado y tiene 4 hijos y 2 hijas, es originario de Veracruz, donde inici su negocio de venta de elotes hace quince aos, pero en busca de mejores oportunidades para su familia decidieron mudarse a la localidad de Linares en Nuevo Len, donde continu con su trabajo recibiendo la ayuda de su esposa e hijos. Gracias al esfuerzo y buen trabajo que realiza da con da, con el ingreso que obtiene ha logrado adquirir dos triciclos en donde vende sus productos, una camioneta y ha logrado financiar su casa. Cuando tiene oportunidad trabaja tambin realizando fletes, principalmente a personas que se cambian de casa.

Esteban es un hombre emprendedor y muy responsable que slo busca lo mejor para su familia, en estos momentos necesita de un prstamo de $ 325 dlares que emplear en la compra de insumos para la preparacin de los elotes y poder continuar creciendo con su negocio, l se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Forma parte importante en la vida de esta familia, Esteban agradece mucho la oportunidad que le brindas, tu ayuda ser de gran bendicin.

loan.use: To purchase supplies

loan.name: Bertha Lidia

texts.en:
Bertha is married and has six children - five are already married and another one is in school. Her husband is a merchant who doesn't have a steady income, so for the past fifteen years Bertha has been selling tacos and other foods to help with her family's expenses. She started out selling tacos to workers in the local market, and eventually obtained a license to set up a stall and sell her foods there. The high quality of her products gained her many clients and helped her business grow.

Bertha is asking for a loan of US $475 to buy supplies to help her meet the increased demand for her products. She will repay the loan over a period of six months. She thanks you for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Bertha Lidia es casada y tiene seis hijos, cinco de ellos ya estn casados y uno es estudiante. Su esposo es comerciante y no cuenta con un ingreso seguro y para ayudarlo con los gastos del hogar y la escuela de sus hijos, desde hace quince aos Bertha se dedica a la venta de comidas y tacos, inicialmente les venda tacos a las personas que trabajaban en el mercado y despus gracias a ellos logr conseguir un permiso para poder instalarse y vender ah mismo. Gracias a la buena calidad de los productos que elabora pronto logr incrementar su nmero de clientes y hacer crecer su negocio.

En estos momentos Berta necesita de un prstamo de $ 475 dlares que destinar a la compra de insumos que necesita para incrementar su produccin y poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes, ella promete regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Se parte importante en la vida de esta familia y contribuye al crecimiento de su negocio, Bertha agradece mucho tu apoyo.

loan.use: To purchase supplies

loan.name: Jos Ral

texts.en:
Jose Raul is married and has three children; his family is the motivation behind the start up of his own business selling food eleven years ago. Noticing the great opportunity and lack of competition, he decided to start selling tacos and added other products, such as roast meats, as demand increased. His business grew and he now sells his products in several markets.

Jose is requesting a loan in the amount of US $1200 to be used for supplies to expand his product line and improve his service. This will ensure that he meets his customers' demand, allowing his business to grow. Jose considers your assistance a blessing and he and his family thank you for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Jos Ral es un hombre emprendedor, est casado y tiene tres hijos, ellos han sido el motivo por el cual inici su propio negocio con la venta de comidas desde hace 11 aos. Al observar la oportunidad y poca competencia de este giro en los mercados decidi comenzar a vender tacos, obtuvo muy buena respuesta de sus clientes y gracias a la creciente demanda que tena fue incorporando la venta de otros alimentos como cabrito y carnes asadas, afortunadamente ha hecho crecer su negocio y ahora se instala en diferentes mercados.

Para poder mejorar la calidad de su servicio e incrementar la variedad de productos que ofrece, en estos momentos Jos est solicitando un prstamo de $ 1,200 dlares que emplear en la compra de insumos, con lo que espera cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y continuar creciendo. Forma parte de los logros de Jos, l y su familia agradecen mucho la oportunidad que les brindas de mejorar, tu ayuda es de gran bendicin.

loan.use: To purchase supplies

loan.name: Doralina

texts.en:
Doralina is 50 years old and has been a widow for more than 15 years. Since her husband died in a traffic accident, she has lived alone with two sons and a daugher, all of whom work and are financially independent.

She had the difficult mission of raising three children alone, as her oldest son was only 10 years old when her husband died. Today, her youngest daughter is 19 and works and attends school. Her middle son works and attends law school and her oldest son works as a teller at a bank. They all help her out in her business with a voluntary monthly contribution.

Doralina runs a small grocery store where she sells staples such as sugar, flour, milk, pasta and rice. Despite stiff competition, her business thrives and is the most successful in the neighborhood thanks to her good service and her extensive inventory.

Doralina is requesting a loan in the amount of US $200 to purchase additional inventory of soft drinks, dairy products, flour, sugar and canned goods at wholesale prices to take advantage of the growing population in her area and the increased demand for her products.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Doralina tiene 50 aos de edad, es viuda ya hace mas de 15 aos, su esposo falleci en un accidente de trnsito. Desde entonces vive sola con sus dos hijos varones y una mujer, quienes ya poseen independencia econmica pues todos trabajan.

Ella tuvo la difcil misin de criar 3 nios, sola, ya que su marido falleci cuando su hijo mayor contaba con apenas 10 aos. Hoy da, su hija menor tiene 19 aos estudia y trabaja, el segundo de sus hijos trabaja en un negocio y estudia leyes en la facultad; el mayor trabaja en un Banco de la zona como cajero, todos le ayudan a su madre en el negocio con un aporte mensual que cada hijo le entrega de forma voluntaria.

Doralina tiene una despensa donde vende productos de primera necesidad, como leche, azcar, harina, fideos, arroz, etc. Actualmente ya con mucha experiencia y clientela formada, y a pesar de que en la zona en donde se encuentra hay varias despensas, su negocio es el que ms xito tiene gracias a su buena atencin y variedad.

Doralina solicita un crdito de $ 200, pues desea adquirir en mayor cantidad bebidas como gaseosas y lcteos, adems de azcar, harina, productos enlatados y fideos de esta forma puede aprovechar mejor el crecimiento de la poblacin en la zona y poder satisfacer la necesidad de toda su clientela.

loan.use: To purchase inventory at wholesale - soft drinks, dairy products, flour, sugar, canned goods and pasta

loan.name: Mara

texts.es:
Ms. Mara Z. is 35 years old and married to Mr. Ramn, 40 years old ; they have two children: a 13 years old girl and a 5 years old boy; they both attend school; they all live in their own house, located in the San Pedro neighborhood, with all the basic amenities, a few minutes from the center of the city of Encarnacin.

Ms. Mara finished her university studies 10 years ago, as a pharmacist. Her husband is an ex soccer player, who played in several professional teams in Paraguay, but who had to abandon his passion early, as consequence of a serious injury in one of his knees he suffered then.

Mara is the owner of two pharmacies, one of which is run by herself and the other by her husband, both located in a strategical point going out of the city. She relates that, with great sacrifice, she saw her business grow and, thanks to that, they are able to provide a dignified life and education to their children.

Thanks to the good profits generated by both pharmacies, they are presently opening another one and, in order to stock it, Mara is asking for a $400 loan, with which to buy more supplies for the new location.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

La seora Mara Z. tiene 35 aos y est casada con el seor Ramn de 40 aos; tienen dos hijos: una nena de 13 aos y un varn de 5 aos; ambos van a al colegio; viven en su casa propia, ubicada en el barrio San Pedro, con todas las comodidades bsicas y a pocos minutos del centro de la ciudad de Encarnacin.

La seora Mara culmin sus estudios universitarios hace 10 aos, como licenciada en Farmacutica. Su marido es un ex jugador de ftbol profesional, quin jug en varios clubes importantes del Paraguay, pero tuvo que abandonar su pasin tempranamente, a consecuencia de una grave lesin que tuvo en aquel entonces en una de sus rodillas.

Mara es propietaria de dos farmacias, una de las cuales es atendida por ella y la otra por su esposo, ambas ubicadas en lugares estratgicos saliendo de la ciudad. Ella cuenta que, con mucho sacrificio pudo ver crecer su negocio, y gracias a ello pueden dar una vida y educacin digna a sus hijos.

Gracias a las buenas ganancias que le generan ambas farmacias, hoy da estn abriendo un local ms y para poder abastecer de mercaderas, Mara, solicita un crdito de $400, con los que podr comprar ms medicamentos para surtir su nuevo local.

loan.use: purchase of pharmaceutical products.

loan.name: Ramona

texts.es:
Mrs. Ramona C. D. Z. is fifty-nine. She is married and has three children. Two of her children are married, have steady jobs, and are well paid, thanks to the fact that they finished their university studies. The youngest daughter is currently studying economics at the university. Ramona is very proud of her children; she always gave the highest priority to their education, and today they are in professional careers.

The couple owns their own home. She lives with her husband, who runs a carpentry business from home, and her youngest daughter. Ramona runs a business selling women's, children's, and men's clothing, such as T-shirts, trousers, shirts, skirts, and so on. Thanks to their good location (in her neighborhood there are not many shops that sell this kind of merchadise), she has many customers.

It is now winter [in Paraguay], and it is bitter cold. For this reason, she wants to buy winter clothes, such overcoats, jackets, scarves, and so on. To finance these purchases, she is seeking a loan of $300.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio and Sarah Padial, Kiva Volunteers

La Seora Ramona D. 59 aos est casada, y tiene 3 hijos, dos D. sus hijos ya estn casados y cuentan con un trabajo estable, bien remunerado gracias a que culminaron sus estudios universitarios y la hija menor est cursando actualmente el ltimo ao D. la carrera D. Economa en la Universidad. Ramona est muy orgullosa D. sus hijos, ya que ella siempre prioriz el estudio D. estos y hoy da son excelentes profesionales. Ella vive en una casa propia con su esposo que es carpintero (posee su propia carpintera en su casa) y su hija menor. En su casa, Ramona, cuenta con un negocio donD. venD. ropas para damas, nios y caballeros tales como remeras, pantalones, camisas, faldas, etc. Gracias a la buena ubicacin, ella posee buena clientela, ya que en la zona no existen muchos negocios que se dediquen a la venta D. este tipo D. mercaderas. Ya que en esta poca del ao el invierno es bastante crudo, ella desea adquirir ropas D. abrigo en grandes cantidades, tales como buzos, camperas, bufandas, pulver, etc.; para poder financiar esta compra, ella solicita un crdito D. $ 300.-

loan.use: To buy winter clothing, such as overcoats, jackets, scarves, pullovers, and so on

loan.name: Graciela

texts.en:
Graciela is married and has two children ages 18 and 1. Her husband, Abelino Janeiro, is 41 years old and works as a construction worker.

Graciela sells spices such as pepper, oregano, cumin, anise, etc. She started out as an assistant in a business that processed, packaged and sold spices. After several years, she was able to pool together some savings and start her own business. She bought a packaging machine and with her eldest son's help she started processing and selling her own spices.

While her son tends to the business, she sells the spices door to door. Today, demand for her products has increased and she is requesting a loan in the amount of US $200 to invest in packaging materials, such as plastic bags, and an additional packaging machine.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

La seora Graciela es casada y es madre de 2 hijos, el mayor tiene 18 aos y el menor 1 ao. Su marido se llama Abelino Janeiro y tiene 41 aos, y es constructor de obras.

Graciela se dedica a la venta de especias tales como pimienta, organo, comino, ans y muchos otros ms. Ella empez como ayudante en un negocio que se dedicaba a la elaboracin y venta de los mismos, tras varios aos ella pudo juntar unos ahorros y monto su propio negocio. Compr una mquina empaquetadora y con la ayuda de su hijo mayor elaborar y empaquetan las especias.

Su hijo atiene el negocio, y Graciela sale a vender de forma ambulante sus productos. Hoy da la demanda de sus productos va en aumento, por lo que desea un crdito de $ 200, que los invertir en la compra de bolsitas y una mquina ms, para empaquetar mayor cantidad de condimentos.

loan.use: To purchase a packaging machine and bags

loan.name: Estela

texts.es:
Ms. Estela is married and has three children. Her husband, Fredy A., is 38 years old. He is a factory employee and they live in a house in the center of the city. Since her husbands income was not enough to support the family, she decided to make handiwork objects to sell. Thanks to previous loans, she was able to make progress and increase her production. Nowadays, she makes pillows, as this generates a higher profit. Since demand for her pillows is increasing, Estela is asking for a $200 loan, in order to buy fabrics in bulk, obtaining important discounts which will help increase her profit margin.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

La seora Estela es casada y tiene 3 hijos. Su marido, Fredy A. de 38 aos, es empleado en una fbrica. Viven todos juntos en una casa en el centro de la ciudad. Como el sueldo de su esposo no era suficiente para abastecer a la familia, ella decidi hacer manualidades para vender; gracias a prstamos anteriores pudo ir progresando y ampliando su produccin. Hoy da, ella confecciona almohadas, ya que esto le genera mayores ingresos. En vista de que la demanda de sus almohadas va en aumento, Estela desea un crdito de $200, con los que podr comprar telas al por mayor, obteniendo as importantes descuentos que ayudarn a aumentar significativamente su margen de ganancias.

loan.use: Purchase of fabrics in bulk

loan.name: Cndido

texts.es:
Mr. Cndido is 35 years old, married and the father of two children. He comes from a very poor family and, since he was a kid, he worked to contribute to the family income. He worked several years as an assistant in an auto repair shop and, after several years of learning and saving, he was able to set up his own shop, presently located at his home.

Because of the high quality of his work, he has a good number of clients. His work allows him to feed and provide education to his kids. Since he wasnt able to receive a school education due to his parents' bad financial situation, his biggest dream is that his children finish their studies.

He wishes to continue making progress and wants to buy replacement parts to sell at his repair shop; in this way, he will be able to make profit with both the sale of these and his labor. He is asking for a $300 loan towards this end.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Cndido tiene 35 aos de edad, est casado y es padre de 2 hijos. Cndido proviene de una familia muy humilde y desde muy pequeo empez a trabajar para poder aportar con los ingresos de la casa. Trabaj varios aos como ayudante en un taller mecnico para autos, y tras varios aos de aprendizaje y ahorro, pudo montar su propio taller, que hoy da se encuentra en su casa.

Posee una buena cantidad de clientes, ya que su trabajo es muy bueno; con su trabajo puede alimentar y dar educacin a sus hijos. Su mayor sueo es que sus hijos puedan culminar sus estudios, ya que l no tuvo la suerte de acceder a una educacin escolar por la mala situacin econmica que atravesaban sus padres.

El desea seguir progresando y desea comprar repuestos para la venta en su taller; de esta forma podr ganar con la venta de los mismos y la mano de obra de su trabajo. Para ello solicita un crdito de $300.

loan.use: Purchase of car replacement parts

loan.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Ms. Carmen is 51 years old, married and has 6 children; her husband has run a butcher shop in the center of the city for more than 15 years, and all of her children go to school in the city. They all live in a house a couple of minutes from the center of the city.

Carmen runs a grocery store at home, where she sells all kinds of basic needs products, such as oil, sugar, noodles, rice, dairy products and bread. With time, her business has grown and she now has a good sized clientele, due to location, as there are not many similar businesses in the area.

Thanks to her profits, she has been able to provide a dignified life to her children and have them study. Since she only finished elementary school, it is her dream that, one day, her children will obtain a college degree.

Carmen is asking for $200, that shell invest in the purchase of more merchandise, such as oil, sugar, noodles, rice and soda, the products that are in greater demand among her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

La seora Carmen tiene 51 aos de edad, es casada y tiene 6 hijos; su marido tiene una carnicera en el centro de la ciudad hace ya ms de 15 aos y todos sus hijos estudian en un colegio de la ciudad. Viven todos juntos en una casa ubicada a minutos del centro de la ciudad.

Carmen tiene una despensa en su casa, donde vende todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad, como aceite, azcar, fideos, arroz, productos lcteos y panificados entre otros. Con los aos, su negocio fue amplindose; ella cuenta con muy buen nmero de clientes gracias a la buena ubicacin, pues la zona no cuenta con muchos negocios del mismo tipo.

Gracias a las buenas ganancias, ella puede dar una vida digna a sus hijos y hacerlos estudiar. Ya que ella solo concluy sus estudios primarios, ella suea que sus hijos puedan recibirse en la universidad algn da.

Carmen solicita $200, que invertir en la compra de ms mercaderas para la venta, tales como aceite, azcar, fideos, arroz, y gaseosas, pues son estos los productos de mayor demanda por sus clientes.

loan.use: purchase of merchandise such as oil, sugar, noodles, rice and sodas.

loan.name: Marcial

texts.es:
Marcial is a 45 years old widower, in charge of two daughters who attend a public school; they all live at his mothers house.

Some years ago, Marcial moved to Argentina, looking for better work opportunities; he was a construction worker and, after saving enough money, he returned to Paraguay to start his own business.

He owns a grocery store at home, that he used to run with his late wife. After her passing, Marcial was left in charge of their daughters and the business. With great sacrifice, he saw his business grow and, today, it is one of the most popular grocery stores in the area.

Marcial wants to obtain a $600 loan, which hell invest in the purchase of more groceries to stock his store, such as canned and dairy products, candies and sodas.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Marcial tiene 45 aos de edad, es viudo y tiene 2 hijas que estudian en una escuela pblica; ellos viven todos juntos en la casa de la madre de Marcial.

Aos atrs, Marcial viaj a Argentina en miras de mayores oportunidades laborales, trabaj como ayudante de construccin y luego de ahorrar dinero suficiente, volvi a Paraguay para montar su propio negocio.

El posee una despensa en su casa, que atenda en principio con su esposa. Tras el fallecimiento de ella, Marcial qued a cargo de sus hijas y del negocio. Con mucho sacrificio pudo ver crecer el negocio y hoy da, es una de las despensas ms populares de la zona.

Marcial desea solicitar un crdito de $600, que invertir en la compra de ms mercadera para vender, tal como productos enlatados, lcteos, golosinas y gaseosas.

loan.use: Purchase of canned and dairy products, candies and sodas.

loan.name: Elsida

texts.en:
Elsida L. has lived in this house for the past eight years. She has had three children and is presently pregnant. Her business consists of cooking the traditional Dominican plates, such as rice and beans, chicken and goat meat. She sells these plates to laborers who have no other immediate source of food while working around the community. She tells us that business is good. Now she's looking to make her business larger.

Elsida buys the food ingredients in the local market. She wishes to be able to buy more in order to have a lower overall cost per unit of product that she uses.

With the new child, it's going to be five people that she will be supporting. This is obviously no small task, especially considering her husband is not around to help her. He works sporadically as a mason. She is placing her hopes very high, intending to send all of her children to the university in the capital city of Santo Domingo, some 45 kms. away from their home.

loan.use: Purchase raw ingredients

loan.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia has lived in this house for eight years. She has five kids, one with a former husband. Her present husband has a small shop where he dedicates himself to iron works. When we asked her husband about who helps whom in the family, he stated that it is he who helps her, as her business is smaller than his.

Julia's business is selling clothing which she normally buys in the capital, Santo Domingo, where there is a secondary market for the Haitian packs ("pacas") of new and used clothing that are sold in the border towns, which become major trading markets between Haitians and Dominicans at the beginning and end of the week. As the majority of the Haitian people are very poor, they get donations in the form of new and used clothing. They pack these into "pacas" and bring them to the border in order to convert the goods into money they can use to buy food and other necessities. Their Dominican counterparts take this opportunity to purchase goods at discount prices, so that they can in turn use these low-cost (usually high-quality) products for sale back in their hometowns.

Julia doesn't have the opportunity to make the long trip (usually a whole day) to the Haitian border. because the trip to Haiti is expensive. The cost runs anywhere from $25 to $30 in public transportation (roundtrip). However, she needs to take the time and trouble to buy these products if she wishes to make the profit margin which hopefully will more than justify the sacrifice involved.

loan.use: Take an expensive trip to the Haitian border to buy bundled clothing

loan.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria is originally from Escobedo in the Mexican state of Nuevo Len. She is a married mother of six children, all of whom are also married. Her husband is retired, and to be able to meet their basic necessities Gloria started her own business eight years ago selling clothes and toys. She has a post at the local markets, and little by little her stock has improved, increasing her sales. With the help of her children she has been able to make her business grow.

Currently, Gloria is requesting a loan of $550, which she will use to purchase supplies in order to offer her clients a wider selection and stay on their good graces. She plans to repay the loan within six months. You can be a part of Gloria's success. Gloria and her family are sincerely grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Gloria es originaria de la localidad de Escobedo en Nuevo Len, es casada y tiene siete hijos, todos ellos ya casados. Su esposo es jubilado y para poder cubrir las necesidades bsicas de su hogar Gloria inici su propio negocio con la venta de ropa y juguetes hace ocho aos, se instala en los mercados ambulantes y poco a poco ha estado surtiendo mejor, incrementando sus ventas y con la ayuda de sus hijos ha hecho crecer su negocio.

En estos momentos Gloria est solicitando un prstamo de $ 550 dlares que emplear en la compra de mercanca para ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad y continuar con su preferencia, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Forma parte de los logros de Gloria y decdete a apoyarla hoy, ella y su familia te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loan.use: Purchase clothes and toys

loan.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
Francisco is a hard-working and responsible man. He's married, and his wife stays at home and takes care of their three small children. Lacking employment and needing to provide for his family, Francisco started his own business six years ago. He installed a mechanic shop on his home's patio, taking advantage of his knowledge of the trade to provide a good service to his clients. He soon found success and grew his business by purchasing more specialized tools.

Currently, Francisco is requesting a loan of $925, which he will use to purchase equipment and tools he needs to keep his business growing and improving his service. He plans to repay the loan within six months. Your support will be a great help in this business' development. Francisco is very grateful for your confidence and support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Francisco es un hombre muy trabajador y responsable, es casado y su esposa se dedica al hogar y al cuidado de sus tres pequeos hijos. Ante la falta de empleo y la necesidad de darle sustento a su familia desde hace seis aos Francisco inici su propio negocio, en el patio de su casa instal un taller mecnico, aprovechando los conocimientos que tiene de este oficio pudo ofrecer un muy buen servicio y pronto logr hacer crecer su negocio comprando herramienta ms especializada.

Ahora Francisco necesita un prstamo de $ 925 dlares que emplear en la compra de equipo y herramienta que necesita para continuar creciendo y mejorando su servicio, l ofrece devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Tu ayuda ser de gran utilidad en el desarrollo de este negocio, Francisco agradece mucho la confianza y apoyo que le brindas.

loan.use: Purchase car repair equipment and tools

loan.name: Dalia

texts.es:
Dalila is a married mother of two children, students ages 15 and 17. Her husband worked at his father's printing shop, where he learned the trade. To cover household expenses and afford their children's education, Dalila and her husband decided to start their own business offering printing and bookbinding services. They started doing small jobs out of their home, and very soon they obtained many more clients thanks to the high quality of their services.

Dalila and her husband want to see their business continue to grow, and to achieve this they are requesting a loan of $925, which they will use to purchase computer equipment to improve the quality of their designs and printings. They hope this will increase their production and improve the services they offer. Dalila plans to repay the loan within six months. She and her family are sincerely grateful for your support and confidence.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Dalila es casada y tiene dos hijos, de 15 y 17 aos de edad, ambos estudiantes. Su esposo trabajaba ayudando a su padre en su propia imprenta, ah es donde aprendi el oficio y para poder solventar los gastos de su hogar y de la educacin de sus hijos entre Dalila y su esposo decidieron iniciar su propio negocio ofreciendo sus servicios de impresin y encuadernacin. Comenzaron realizando pequeos trabajos en su hogar, y poco despus gracias a la buena calidad de sus servicios lograron tener muchos ms clientes.

Dalila y su esposo desean que su negocio contine creciendo y para esto necesitan un prstamo de $ 925 dlares con los que comprar equipo de cmputo para mejorar la calidad de diseo e impresin, con esto esperan incrementar su produccin y mejorar el servicio que ofrecen, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Contribuye al crecimiento de este negocio, Dalila y su familia agradecen sinceramente la confianza y apoyo que depositas en ellos.

loan.use: Purchase computer equipment

loan.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
Maria is a very hard-working woman. She's a married mother of three. Her husband is a businessman, and their children are grown up and live outside their home. To help her husband with household expenses, Maria started her business selling lingerie six years ago. She started out selling to friends and family, and thanks to their recommendations she was soon able to increase her clientele and grow her business.

In order to offer a better service to her customers and to fulfill all their orders, Maria is requesting a loan of $200, which she will use to purchase supplies. She plans to repay the loan within three months. Maria is very grateful for the opportunity to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Maria es una mujer muy trabajadora, est casada y tiene tres hijos. Su esposo se dedica al comercio y ahora que sus hijos estn grandes y ya no viven con ellos, para poder apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar Maria emprendi su negocio con la venta de lencera hace seis aos, empez vendiendo entre sus familiares y amigos y gracias a las recomendaciones de stos pronto logr incrementar su nmero de clientes y hacer crecer su negocio.

Para poder ofrecer un buen servicio a sus clientes y surtir todos los pedidos que tiene Maria est solicitando un prstamo de $ 200 dlares que emplear en la compra de mercanca, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 3 meses. Hoy es momento de ayudar a quien ms lo necesita, Maria agradecen mucho la oportunidad que le brindas de mejorar y continuar creciendo con su negocio.

loan.use: Purchase lingerie supplies

loan.name: Martha Isabel

texts.es:
Martha Isabel is 33 years old, married and lives in Guadalupe in the Mexican state of Nuevo Len. Her husband works as rehabilitation assistant. To be able to support him with household expenses, Martha took an arts and crafts course five years ago, where she learned various techniques to make decorative works. Through this, she was able to earn extra income, and thanks to the originality of the products she makes, her customer base and her demand is growing.

To keep her business growing and increase her production, Martha is requesting a loan of $200, which she will use to purchase supplies. She plans to repay the loan within three months. You can be part of the growth of this business.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Martha Isabel tiene 33 aos de edad, es casada y vive en la localidad de Guadalupe en Nuevo Len. Su esposo trabaja como asistente de rehabilitacin y para poder apoyarlo con los gastos de su hogar desde hace cinco aos tom un curso de manualidades, donde aprendi varias tcnicas para elaborar artculos de decoracin, de esta manera es como obtiene un ingreso extra y gracias a la originalidad de los productos que elabora ha conseguido tener muchos clientes y una creciente demanda.

Para poder continuar creciendo con su negocio e incrementar su produccin Martha est solicitando un crdito de $ 200 dlares que emplear en la compra materia prima, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 3 meses. T puedes ser parte importante en el crecimiento de este negocio, decdete a apoyar a Martha.

loan.use: Purchase art supplies

loan.name: Rocio

texts.es:
Rocio is 26 years old, in an open relationship and has a 2-year-old son. To cover household expenses and improve the quality of life for her son, Rocio started selling shoes six years ago. She started out selling to family members and later, thanks to the simplicity of her payment plans, she increased her customer base. Fortunately today she supplies a larger number of orders and has been able to grow her business.

Currently, Rocio is requesting a loan of $200, which she will use to purchase supplies to offer her clients a wider selection and improve her service. She plans to repay the loan within three months. You can be a part of this business' development and help Rocio and her family. They are sincerely grateful.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Rocio tiene 26 aos de edad, vive en unin libre y tiene un pequeo hijo de 2 aos de edad. Para contribuir con los gastos del hogar y despus para mejorar la calidad de vida de su hijo Rocio se dedica a la venta de zapatos, inici hace seis aos vendiendo entre sus familiares y despus gracias a las facilidades de pagos que ofreca fue incrementando su nmero de clientes, afortunadamente hoy surte una mayor cantidad de pedidos y ha hecho crecer su negocio.

En estos momentos Rocio necesita un prstamo de $ 200 dlares que emplear en la compra de mercanca, con lo que espera ofrecer una mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes y mejorar su servicio, ella esta dispuesta a regresar esta cantidad en slo 3 meses. Se parte importante en el desarrollo de este negocio y ayuda a Rocio y su familia, ellos te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loan.use: Purchase supplies

loan.name: Eva Esmeralda

texts.es:
Eva Esmeralda is a married mother of two children, one in elementary school and an infant. Her husband works in an office, and to help him with household expenses Eva opened a convenience store a year ago in Sabinas, Nuevo Len, where they're from. She started selling only drinks and snacks at first, but now has been able to better stock her store and is making it grow thanks to the good service she provides.

To meet her customers' demands and increase the variety of products, Eva is requesting a loan of $925, which she plans to repay within six months. You can be a fundamental part of the growth of this business and help move Eva and her family forward. They are grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Eva Esmeralda est casada y tiene dos hijos uno estudia la primaria y el ms pequeo tiene poco tiempo de nacido. Su esposo trabaja como empleado en una oficina y para poder ayudarlo con los gastos del hogar Eva emprendi su propio negocio con la venta de abarrotes hace un ao en la localidad de Sabinas, Nuevo Len de donde son originarios. Comenz vendiendo slo refrescos y botanas pero ahora ha podido surtir bien su negocio y ha estado creciendo gracias al buen servicio que ofrece.

Para poder cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes e incrementar la variedad de los productos que ofrece Eva est solicitando un prstamo de $ 925 dlares, mismos que se compromete a regresar en 6 meses. Se parte fundamental en el crecimiento de este negocio y ayuda a Eva y a su familia a salir adelante, muchas gracias.

loan.use: Purchase supplies

loan.name: Manuela

texts.es:
Manuela is a married mother of three and lives in Sabinas, in the Mexican state of Nuevo Len. Her husband runs a carpentry business, and all of their children are married. They live alone except for one of their grandchildren who also depends on them economically. To help her husband with household expenses, Manuela started selling a few paper products five years ago. She later was able to better stock her business and now has a larger customer base.

Manuela wants to take advantage of her desire to keep working and continue growing her business, which is why she's currently requesting a loan of $475, which she will use to purchase supplies and a display window to showoff her products better. She plans to repay the loan within six months. You can contribute to the growth of this business. Manuela and her family are very grateful for your confidence and support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Manuela es casada, tiene tres hijos y vive en la localidad de Sabinas, Nuevo Len. Su esposo tiene una carpintera, todos sus hijos estn casados y con Manuela y su esposo slo vive uno de sus nietos que depende econmicamente de ellos, para poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar, desde hace cinco aos comenz vendiendo muy pocos productos de papelera y despus fue surtiendo mejor su negocio, ahora cuenta un amplio nmero de clientes y ha hecho crecer su negocio.

Manuela quiere aprovechar ahora que tiene fuerzas para seguir trabajando y desea hacer crecer su negocio por lo que ahora est solicitando un crdito de $ 475 dlares que destinar a la compra de mercanca y una vitrina para exhibir sus productos de una mejor manera, ella ofrece regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Contribuye al crecimiento de este negocio, Manuela y su familia agradecen mucho tu confianza y apoyo.

loan.use: Purchase supplies and a display window

loan.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es:
Maria del Rosario is a very hard-working and responsible married mother of three. To improve her family's quality of life, Maria started working as a door-to-door saleswoman, but she didn't earn a sufficient amount. She then decided to go out on her own and opened her own convenience store three years ago. Thanks to the good service she provides she has been able to grow her business and increase her sales. Love for her family is a constant motivator.

Currently, Maria is requesting a loan of $650, which she will use to purchase supplies to offer a wider variety of products. She plans to repay the loan within six months. You can be an important part in this business' development. Maria is grateful for the opportunity.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Maria del Rosario es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable, ella es casada y tiene tres hijos. Para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia Maria comenz a trabajar con las ventas, las realizaba casa por casa pero no reciba una remuneracin suficiente, entonces decidi independizarse y abrir su propio negocio con la venta de abarrotes hace tres aos, gracias al buen servicio que ofrece ha logrado hacer crecer su negocio e incrementar sus ventas. El amor hacia su familia es lo que la motiva a esforzndose ms cada da.

En estos momentos, Maria necesita un prstamo de $ 650 dlares que emplear en la compra de mercanca para mejorar la variedad de productos que ofrece y continuar creciendo con su negocio, ella promete devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Se parte importante en el desarrollo de este negocio, Maria agradece mucho la oportunidad que le brindas de mejorar.

loan.use: Purchase supplies

loan.name: Prom

texts.en: Mrs. Prom M. is 35 years old and lives in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia with her husband and their 3 children. She works selling bananas and raising pigs, and earns about $3/day. Her husband earns $2.5/day working as a horse-cart driver. This loan will be used to purchase pigs to raise and also bananas for her inventory.

loan.use: To purchase pigs and bananas

loan.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy Mukunga M. is a soft-spoken, 27-year-old single gentleman. He lives with his parents and two siblings at the Garden estate on Thika Road, Nairobi. Kennedy operates a cyber caf, at the Kenyatta Market, Golf Course Centre. He offers Internet services, photocopying, word processing and printing services and even telephone and document-binding services. He has often provided support services to the Action Now Kenya office, as well as to many other companies in the area.

Kennedy went to the Kenya School of Professional Studies where he took courses in IT (Information Technology) from 2001 to 2003. After his studies he got a job at a Video Library located at the Garden estate where he worked for two years. In the year 2005, he was employed at a hardware shop located at Donholm estate, East of Nairobi. He was inspired by his father to set up a cyber caf, and with his father's assistance together with the little savings he had put aside, Kennedy set up the cyber caf in April 2006. This has helped him a great deal because it has uplifted his life since then, and unlike many youths of his age in Kenya, he does not have to depend on his parents for his personal expenses.

Kennedy now wishes to expand his business in order to be able to do colour printing, which currently he is not able to do. He is therefore requesting a loan of US$ 250, which will enable him to purchase the colour printer. This will go a long way toward giving his clients quality services which will translate into higher income. Kennedy intends to repay the loan within 6 months.

loan.use: To purchase a colour printer

loan.name: Morn

texts.en: Mrs. Morn H. is 53 years old and lives in Kampong Cham Province with her husband and their five children. She and her husband own a grinding mill to service people in the local community that have rice crops. They also own some land where they grow their own rice. This business only gives the couple a combined income of $2/day. Two of their children work at a garment factory and are able to supplement the family income. This loan will be used for the couple to purchase a tractor to use on their land. It will help them to improve their efficiency and their income.

loan.use: To purchase a tractor for cultivating their land

loan.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Wainaina N. is a 42-year-old man, married with four children. Apart from his children, N. supports his aged parents and also takes care of HIV infected and affected people in his community by providing foodstuffs to the affected homes on a weekly basis.

Wainaina started his business in March 2007, his dream come true since he had had a passion to start up a kerosene pump business. Wainaina can be described as a very hardworking man. He previously had set up a small dry cleaning business, which was financed by his benefits from a Nairobi transport provider, Kenya Bus Service Company, after he was laid off. This business was operational from 1998 to 2002. Apart from his business, N. is also a community worker within Kayole where he resides. He runs a small community based organization by the name of AIDS Link, and he is sometimes hired by NGOs and social work groups to assist in matters affecting his community.

Through his hard work, and from the payments he received from the transport company, N. managed to save up Ksh 95,000 (US$ 1440), which he used to start off his kerosene-selling business. He has undergone several business management training courses and has gained a lot of experience, both from the dry cleaning business that he used to run and also from the kerosene business that he is currently operating.

N. wishes to expand his business. His vision for the business is to become able to sell on a wholesale scale in his area. His only difficulty is finances necessary to stock more kerosene, which is the main fuel used for cooking within his community. He is requesting a loan of US$ 800, which will be repayable within 12 months. The loan will enable him to expand his kerosene business and attract more customers, since he will have enough kerosene to meet the needs within his community. This will also enable him to make his prices more reasonable, a great advantage to his customers. The additional stock will also require him to employ 2-3 people from his community, to assist him in serving the customers. The additional loan will enable him to increase his income, hence improve his familys lifestyle.

loan.use: Purchase 5 empty metal drums and 1000 litres of kerosene

loan.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon Mwaniki is 38 years old and married. He has no children of his own but has two dependants, his aging parents whom Simon entirely supports. Simon Mwaniki lives in Ruai.

Simon was first employed in a lumber-selling business in the year 2000 and worked for three years. During that period, he managed to save Ksh 40,000 (US$ 615). The three-year experience also gave Simon enough confidence to start his own lumber business, which he still has to date, though with some struggles.

Simons business suffered a setback in the year 2006 due to his wedding preparations, which ended up causing him huge unforeseen costs relating to the culture and traditions of his tribe that he was expected to adhere to, if he was to receive their blessings to marry his bride. Through this time and due to the financial strain that Simon experienced, his business suffered and he still finds it hard to bring it back up again. Simon needs support in order to revive his business again. He is therefore requesting a loan of US$ 1000, which he will use to purchase lumber to restock his business. He will be very grateful if he can receive this support, in order to improve his business.

Simon believes that once he has additional stock, his customers will be able to purchase enough lumber to meet their needs, especially those who purchase in bulk. This will save them the inconvenience of having to travel all the way to the city center to buy lumber, at a much bigger cost to them. The loan therefore will enable him to serve his customers efficiently and effectively. He will also earn more income so as to uplift himself and his family. The loan repayment period will be 12 months.

loan.use: To purchase lumber for sale

loan.name: Kung

texts.en: Mrs. Kung B. T. is a 54 year old widow living in Kampong Cham Province with her 4 children. She works selling Khmer noodles to local villagers, and also raises pigs to eventually sell to the market. Through these businesses she makes about $1.5 per day on average. Her children work as translators and hair-dressers, and they each earn around $5 per day. This loan will be used to purchase more pigs to raise, a business that Mrs. Kung B. T. is comfortable with and would like to expand.

loan.use: To purchase pigs

payment.comment: Congratulations to Kung Bun Thoeun for repaying the Kiva loan early!

loan.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius M. is a 33-year-old man, married, with one child. Julius lives at Mlolongo, an informal settlement along the Nairobi Mombassa highway. Apart from caring for his young family, Julius has the burden of taking care of his brothers and sisters after losing both of his parents.

Julius started his restaurant business in the year 2006. This was after he and the other employees he worked with were sent home after the chain of supermarkets they were working for came under receivership. Since Julius had experience in dealing with customers while at the Uchumi supermarket, his former workplace, he decided not to waste his skills. He therefore ventured into the restaurant industry, where he felt that he could make use of his skills while at the same time earning some money for the upkeep of his family and siblings.

In order to finance the start-up of his business, Julius sold one of his cows for a total of Ksh 18,000 (US$ 300) and put this amount in, together with his personal savings of Ksh 40,000.00 (US$ 670), which he had put aside while still in employment. With this, he opened his business in the year 2006. The business has since been doing very well, and Julius now feels that he wants to improve the business by adding on some kitchen equipment. This will include a cooker, a refrigerator, a French fries warmer, a juice extractor, a blender, and some cooking fat. These will enable him to give his clients quicker and better service.

The population within the Mololongo area is rapidly growing and Julius wants his business to grow with the rising number of potential customers. For this reason he is kindly requesting a loan of US$ 1000 so that he can fully equip his restaurant.

Given this loan, Julius feels that he will be able to give his customers the very best service. He will also be able to employ 2 young men to assist him in running the business, thereby benefiting the community by creating employment. The repayment period for this loan will be 8 months.

loan.use: Purchase of restaurant kitchen equipment

loan.name: Yous

texts.en: Mrs. Yous N. is a 48 year old widow living in Kampong Cham Province with her two children. She works by farming their land, and also selling liters of gasoline. Her children help her to sell gasoline to motor-bikes and cars traveling by. The family can earn nearly $10/day when they pool their income. They currently don't have the capital to purchase more gasoline to sell, even though they know it is profitable. They will use this loan to purchase more gasoline to sell.

loan.use: To purchase gasoline

loan.name: Jonah

texts.en:
Jonah N. Kariuki is a 42-year-old man, married with two children. He lives in Kitengela town in Athi River, in the Eastern Province of Kenya. Jonah started singing while in school. His music teacher noticed his musical talent and nurtured him to the point where he became a seasoned singer by the time he was through with his music lessons.

After school Jonah married Bilha Njeri who also is a gospel singer. Together, in the year 1995, they released their first album by the name of Ngai oiga ni oiga meaning if God says he has said it, which consists of 12 songs. This album sold like hotcakes and with the proceeds Jonah was able to rent a shop in Kitengela and buy a generator which up to now he uses to preach the word of God and advertise his cassettes.

Jonah has a soft heart for children and has started a childrens home in Ruai town, on the outskirts of Nairobi. The childrens home, Fire Ministry Childrens Home, takes care of 45 orphans. Apart from the orphans at the childrens home, Jonah takes care of his sister and her 2 children because she is sick and unable to take care of them. He also takes care of the 5 orphaned children of his sister-in-law who died of HIV/AIDS in the year 2000.

Well aware of advances in music production used to recorded on CDs and DVDs, Jonah wants to go HI-TECH with his music. Therefore he is requesting a loan of US$1200. Given this loan, he will purchase a keyboard, amplifier, two speakers, and a microphone. With this equipment, he will be in a better position to produce music on CDs and DVDS and through this, he will earn more income. This will enable him to spread the gospel and provide for his very big family. The repayment period for the loan will be 8 months.

loan.use: Purchase of a keyboard, amplifier, etc. to use to produce gospel recordings

loan.name: Hong

texts.en: Mrs. Hong K. is 35 years old and lives in Kampong Cham Province with her husband and their five children. She works by selling porridge and helping her husband to operate their pool hall. The family makes a total of $7/day from these businesses, but they would like to build another pool hall for local youth to play at. This loan will be used to purchase another building in which they will put pool tables and charge hourly rates.

loan.use: To purchase a pool hall

loan.name: Kem

texts.en: Mrs. Kem S. is 43 years old and lives in Kampong Cham Province with her husband and their 3 children. She and her husband work on farming their land and buying and selling cows. Their children work at a garment factory and help to support their family. This loan will be used to purchase a horse and cart to transport passengers.

loan.use: To purchase a horse and cart for transporting customers

payment.comment: Congratulations to Kem Sophal for repaying the Kiva loan early!

loan.name: Achildi

texts.en: Achildi A. is 55 years old and lives in the Yavan district. He has a high education, specializing in pedagogy. He is married and has 7 children. He has his own storefront, where he has been selling food for 6 months. With $875 he plans to buy more foods to sell and increase the range of goods. This loan helps to improve the life of district; the next nearest food shop is far away. District inhabitants have opportunity to obtain food near their homes, they do not need go far for food. Achildi is going pay off the loan amount in 12 months.

loan.use: to buy foods and increase the range of goods

loan.name: Sek

texts.en: Mr. Sek S. O. is 24 years old and lives in Kampong Cham Province with his wife and their only child. He works as a cameraman and earns $3 per day, while his wife earns $2 per day working as a fruit-seller. This loan will be used to purchase a motorcycle. Public transportation is very expensive, so Mr. Sek S. O. knows this will save him money.

loan.use: To purchase a motorcycle for transportation to work

loan.name: Thum

texts.en: Mr. Thum P. is 66 years old and lives with his wife in Kampong Cham Province. He owns a plantation that grows various crops, which gives him an average income of $4 per day. This loan will be used to purchase seeds and farm supplies for him to increase his efficiency.

loan.use: To purchase seeds and farm supplies

payment.comment: Congratulations to Thum Phai for repaying the Kiva loan early!

loan.name: Toun

texts.en: Mrs. Toun C. is 37 years old and lives in Kampong Cham Province with her husband and their three children. She works as a farmer and earns $2.50 per day, while her husband earns $3 per day working as a construction foreman. This loan will be used to purchase a motorbike for her husband and sons to go to work. This way, they will not have to pay a moto-taxi driver daily and it will thus save the family transportation costs.

loan.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband to go to work

loan.name: Dib

texts.en: Mr. Dib D. is a 49 year old school director living in Kampong Cham Province. He earns $5 per day from his job, and he also works with his wife on their farm in their free-time. Together, they have six children. This loan will be used to purchase a thresher machine to harvest rice.

loan.use: To purchase a thresher

loan.name: It
