texts.en: Mrs. It S. lives in Kampong Cham Province with her husband. She works as a grocer, earning $2.5 per day, while her husband is a farmer who makes palm sugar. He can usually earn between $1 and $2 per day. This loan will be used to purchase grocery products and the remainder of the loan will be used to buy tools and supplies for producing wine.

loan.use: To purchase grocery products and to make wine

loan.name: Rashid

texts.en:
Rashid is a 35 year old multi business man. He is married with three children, all below ten years. Rashid is a cameraman: he runs a photo studio, a poultry business and a vegetable garden. He has been a cameraman for the past 15 years; the poultry and the vegetable businesses are just three years old. Rashid gets tenders to shoot and supply chickens for weddings and other ceremonies. He has recently received business training from Youth Self Employment Foundation and photo studio management training from KODAK. He has employed three people to assist him. His wife also assists him in the poultry and vegetable farming business.

Rashid is now requsting USD 400 to help him buy some equipment for his studio and to stock more chicks.

loan.use: Expand His Studio and Poultry farm

loan.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 30 year old dynamic mother of one. She is a resident of Vituka area in Dar Es Salaam. Mary runs a shop dealing in ladies garments, childrens clothing shoes and sandals. She deals in both new and used clothes. She buys her stock from Kariakoo, and she stocks depending on the season and the demand by the clients. She has been in business for the past three years and her business has been prosperingever since she joined micro finance institutions. She has received business training from the Modern Commercial Institute and others from the yearly trainings organized by Youth Self Employment Foundation.

Mary also runs a nursery school in Vituka area, where she employs four teachers. She is currently in need of USD 550, to help her expand her store's stock and invest more in her nursery school.

loan.use: Expand stock and the Nursery school

loan.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce, 35, is married with five children, two in secondary school and the rest in primary school. She runs a shop in Kariakoo, Dar es Salaams-and perhaps Tanzanias- biggest trading area. She deals in cosmetics, decorations, children's toys, and stationery. She has been in this business for the past four years and is both a wholesaler and retailer.

She currently faces a lot of competition and as such, has decided to attract more customers by increasing the variety of stock for her shop. She is also planning to open up another shop, outside the city center. Joyce recently obtained a loan of USD 1,000 which she paid back in full. She is now in need of USD 1,200 to help her buy more stock and expand her business.

loan.use: Buy Stock, expand bussines

loan.name: Mirzomiddin

texts.en: Mirzomiddin S. is 26 years old and lives in the Yavan district. He has a paraprofessional medical education. He is married and has 1 child. He worked as nurse in a local hospital. The salary was too low to take care of his family so he started his own business. He has a store in a central market of the Yavan district where he sells sport clothes and footwear. He has had this business for 6 years. For the loan amount for $750 Mirzomiddin is going to increase the range of goods he has to sell. Sport clothes are very popular among youth and now they would the opportunity to obtain them in a local market. Mirzomiddin is going to pay off the loan amount in 12 months.

loan.use: to obtain new range of sport goods and footwear

loan.name: Ikromiddin

texts.en: Ikromiddin S. is 32 year old and is married with 4 children. He got in first trading experience in Russia. He saved money and came back home to start his business in Yavan. Now he has had a storefront in the Tijorat market for the last 10 years, where he sells men's trousers and shirts. As the summer season is ending, Ikromiddin would like to borrow $575 to buy autumn mens wear. He has a wholesale trade so the prices to his goods are lower than other sellers. That helps to local habitants obtain goods in a lower price. Ikromiddin is going to pay off the loan amount in 10 months.

loan.use: to increase the range of goods (to buy seasonal menswear)

loan.name: Munavar

texts.en:
Munavar has a small shop selling women's garments in the Panjshanbe market. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is dead. Her elder son is old enough to help his mother to arrange her goods in her trading place. She currently brings her goods from Bishkek, Kirgizistan.

She became a client of Micro Invest in March, 2007. Her first loan was 100USD. The loan permitted her to expand her assortment and attract more clients. Now she wants to buy her goods from Turkey. The garments from Turkey have good demand among clients. She plans to spend her future loan for purchasing seasonal garments from there. She is requesting 800USD for this purpose.

loan.use: Purchase of garments

loan.name: Usmon

texts.en: Usmon P. is 33 years and is married with 4 children. He has had a shop in a Yavan market where he sells auto car parts for 6 months. For the loan amount for $1000 Usmon plans to obtain new auto parts for new types of cars, which are in great demand. This business brings locals benefit; it is means that they do not need go far from the district to obtain necessary auto parts. Usmon plans topay off the loan amount in 10 months.

loan.use: to obtain auto car parts

loan.name: Muhammadali

texts.ru:
Muhamadali is employed by a construction business which builds private houses. This is the main source of his income. He does this during active construction seasons. In his free time Muhamadali and his wife sell vegetables at a local market. His produce is in big demand and sells quickly. The profits are enough to supplement the family budget and provide for the family. Muhamadali is 42 years old and married with 3 children. He purchases vegetables from local farmers at wholesale prices and sells them retail. This year in January he took out a loan from Microinvest and used it to increase his working capital. Currently he wants to take advantage of low costs of potatoes and onions by using a new loan to purchase these products. The picture shows Muhamadali's wife selling her wares at the market.

Translated from Spanish by Elena Sheyner, Kiva volunteer.

. , . . . . , . , 42 . . . . .

loan.use: to purchase potatoes and onions

loan.name: Fri

texts.en:
Fri is a wife and mother of five children. Her husband does not make sufficient money to meet the educational needs of their children. This need and her desire to see her children educated and independent are her motivations. Her determination coupled with her training in marketing techniques and credit management and experience in retailing raw food stuffs have led her to start a small food retail business.

In the past she was forced to borrow money to purchase goods because the wholesalers used to charge her exorbitant prices for buying on credit. With her current loan request of $100, she will be able to take advantage of the benefits of having liquidity and will probably earn enough profit to help change her life for the better. The first loan repayment installment will commence at the end of the first month from the date of disbursement of the loan

loan.use: Retailing of tomatoes and pepper

loan.name: Bernabe

texts.es:
Bernab lives in the Antofagasta district of the city of El Alto. He makes novel glassware, in different and original shapes, according to the shape of the bottle from which the glass is made. His raw materials are recycled, half-liter, glass bottles. He also works as a driver in a public transportation company (Radio Taxis). With this income he supports his family--his wife and two children who still remain in his care.

He would use the loan to buy empty recycled bottles of different shapes.

This is his first loan with IMPRO. The evaluation conducted by IMPRO qualifies him to receive this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio and Sarah Padial, Kiva Volunteers

Bernab vive en la zona Antofagasta de la ciudad de El Alto; se dedica a la elaboracin de vasos novedosos, de formas diferentes y ornamentales, segn el tipo de botella, utilizando como materia prima botellas recicladas de vidrio de medio litro. Tambin trabaja como chofer eventual en una empresa de transporte publico (radio taxis).Con dichos ingresos mantiene a su familia que consta de su esposa y dos hijos que permanecen a su cargo El crdito le invertir en la compra de materia prima (botellas vacias de diferentes formas). Es el primer crdito con Impro; la evaluacin realizada lo califica para otorgarle el prstamo

loan.use: To buy recycled bottes for his glassware business

loan.name: Velushi Gillian

texts.en:
30 year-old Velushi Gillian V. is a single mother of three. She draws her motivation and determination from the difficulties she faces as a single mother in providing basic needs and education to her 3 children.

With a loan of $100, she intends to sell puff-puff and beans, a favorite dish among local inhabitants especially in the early hours of the day and towards the evening. With a regular income, she will be able to provide for her family's basic needs including education and food for her children. She plans to repay her loan in 15 months. Her first repayment will be made on the date that her loan is disbursed.

loan.use: Purchase flour, groundnut oil, firewood, beans

loan.name: Evelyn Mbilah

texts.en:
Born in 1970, Evelyn is married and a mother of five. Her husband does not make sufficient money to meet the educational and health needs of their children. This need and her desire to see her children educated and independent are her motivations. Her determination coupled with her training in marketing techniques and credit management, as well as experience in making uniforms (a skill she acquired as a young girl) have led her to start a business making uniforms and table place mats.

With a loan of $100 she plans to build her skills in taking credit and repaying timely. She said she will ask for bigger amounts once she is comfortable and sure of her ability to take and repay loans under agreed conditions. The first loan repayment installment shall commence at the end of the first month from the date of disbursement of the loan.

loan.use: Sewing of uniforms and table mats

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Stock more chicks and increase stock in the pharmacy

loan.name: Justina Bi

texts.en:
Justina Bi was born in 1954 and is a single mother of six children. She has suffered a lot of challenges after a car accident left her daughter handicapped, added to her own difficulty in single-handedly providing basic needs for her 6 children. This challenge led her to become a GHAPE member in 1999, where she was trained in business management, marketing techniques and credit discipline. Since then, she has obtained and repaid 5 loans. With these loans, she was able to pay for medication for her handicapped daughter and pay school fees for her children. She was also able to feed her children with some of the food she cultivates.

Justina is now requesting a loan of $800 with which she plans to fatten and sell pigs, sell foodstuff and cultivate crops. She will sell some of the crops and feed her family with some, while also paying for school and apprentice fees for her children. She plans to pay the loan in 24 months and the first installment of repayment will be made on the fourth month from the date of disbursement.

loan.use: Purchase pigs, till the farm, buy seeds

loan.name: Raymonde

texts.en:
N. Raymonde is 37 years old, a mother of 5 and married to a polygamist. Her toughest challenge has been her past sickness during which she spent all her capital on medication. This forced her to remove her children from school since she could no longer pay their school fees, and her husband was not able to shoulder this responsibility.

Her low self esteem, caused by all these set backs, hindered her from looking for help. She states that thanks to GHAPE women who talked to me and took me to centre meetings, I heard other women's experiences and realized that I am not alone. This is how I became a member.

She took her first loan in 2006 and is proud of having successfully invested and repaid this loan with income from her investment. With this loan, she was able to sell foodstuff, fish to her community and provide for some basic needs of her children.

N. is now requesting a loan of $300 with which she plans to sell smoked fish, which is a welcome soup ingredient in her community. She intends to continue using the proceeds from her business to provide for her children. She plans to repay the loan in 15 months.

loan.use: purchase smoked fish, baskets

loan.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is39 years old and married to a polygamist. She has been struggling to set up a business but lacked start up capital and also had difficulties paying for her children's education. Her sister, who was very supportive of her, died, making Veronica more frustrated.

With this loan of $100, Veronica plans to invest in buying and selling fresh corn and groundnuts. She believes that with this loan she will provide for her family's education and also provide food for her family. She plans to repay her loan in 15 months. Her first repayment will commence from the date her loan is disbursed.

loan.use: Buying and selling of fresh corn and groundnut

loan.name: Celine

texts.en:
S. Celine is 35 years old, married and a mother of six. Her motivation to become a GHAPE member in 2002 stemmed from the difficulty her husband faced in providing for her family's basic needs due to his low salary. Upon becoming a GHAPE member she was trained in business management, marketing techniques and credit discipline. She obtained loans and was able to raise money to pay school fees for her children and provide them with balanced meals.

Requesting another loan of $600, she now plans to cultivate crops, feed her family with some and sell the rest to raise money for their school needs. She plans to repay the loan in 24 months and the first installment of repayment will be made on the fourth month from the date of disbursement

loan.use: purchase seeds, fertilizer, house roof, pay for hired labor

loan.name: Pauline Mankaa

texts.en:
Born in 1949, Pauline Mankaa S. is married and is mother of three living children. Her husband is unemployed so he finds it difficult to provide education and food for his family. In order to assist her husband, she decided to start a business and sought a loan from GHAPE for start-up capital.

After successfully repaying the loan, she now requests another loan of $400 with which she plans to increase her business of cultivation and selling of crops and off-license (liquor store) so she can earn money to buy food for the family and pay apprentice fees for her children.

She plans to pay the loan in 18 months, and the first installment of repayment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of disbursement.

loan.use: Purchase food items, crates of beer, cigarettes, kola nuts, construct a canter

loan.name: Ndoh Vincent

texts.en:
Ndoh Vincent has been of great help to his family who look up to him as their provider. Even though he is unmarried and has no children of his own, his late younger brother left behind three children to care for. As an unemployed man, he found it difficult to provide for the children's basic needs so he sought help from GHAPE and was trained in business skills. He has already received loans up to $1,000 to pay for the children's education.

He is now requesting a loan of $1,200 with which he will buy and fatten pigs and goats to be sold for meat to restaurants. He plans to repay his loan in 24 months. The first loan repayment installment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of disbursement of the loan.

loan.use: Purchase piglets, pig feed, goats

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Purchase of motor bike

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Buy a computer

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Fix his store up

loan.name: Cruz

texts.en:
Cruz and her sister opened this store about 4 years ago. There they sell all types of products to the community ranging from jewelry to office supplies. Cruz and her sister started off by putting together savings and selling just paper, pens and other school supplies. As they grew, they began to invest in many different products to sell.

Although the business was going well, Cruzs sister married about a year and a half ago and made the decision to move to a new city. Obviously, this affected Cruz. She had to make monthly payments to her sister in order to repay for the capital she put up. Instead of having two people invest in the business, Cruz found herself alone and limited by the payments. She used a loan from Kiva and Mifex to help her get past the tough times and this resulted in a great deal of help for her.

Cruz is now seeking this loan in order to invest in completely new products now that she is finished paying her sister. She is confident in her ability to sell and assures lenders that there is sufficient demand to justify an investment. She is happy to be able t provide for her two children.

loan.use: Diversify her product line

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Buy more merchandise

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Invest in new merchandise

loan.name: Jesenia

texts.en:
Jesenia is 27 years old and works selling clothes in the local community. She started the business with about $400 she had accumulated as savings from a job in a factory. When she started off, she only sold clothes for babies and young children. As the time has passed she has began selling casual clothing for men and women.

She hopes that with this, her second loan, she will be able to continue to invest in cosmetics and accessories, which are much more profitable than clothing sales. Jesenia already has one child and is pregnant with another. She and her husband are hard workers who want to provide their children with good educations.

loan.use: Invest in merchandise

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Continue buying merchandise and making aesthetic improvements to her bakery

loan.name: Egamberdi

texts.en: Egamberdi E. is 72 years old and is married with 4 children. He lives in the Yavan district and has a secondary education. Egamberdi grow up in a village so animal restocking skills is easy for him. All his life he worked on a collective farm with cattle. He enjoyed his work which gives him an advantage. Nowadays he is in retirement so he devotes all his time for cattle breeding. By borrowing $1000 he is going to buy 3 bull-calves and feed. This loan helps locals obtain meat for a low price. Egamberdi plans to pay off the loan in 6 months.

loan.use: to buy 3 bull calves for breeding and selling

loan.name: Mehman

texts.en: Mehman A. is a 35-year-old married businessman. He runs his small shop in the southern Azerbaijan town of Imishli, where he was born and has lived for his entire life. He has 6 years of experience in his business. He opened his store in 2001 when he first borrowed $1,200 from Aqroinvest CU. He sells laundry detergent, shampoo, toothpaste and other items. These products are in high demand, and Mehman tries to be very polite with clients to gain return customers and attract new ones. Mehman is going to enlarge his store and begin to sell additional food products, for which he needs $1,200.

loan.use: To increase his product selection

loan.name: Zakir

texts.en: Zakir A. is a 57-year-old married man who has his own petrol station. Zakir lives with his wife and four children in the southern Azerbaijan region near Imishli, in the village of Boshallar. He rented his small petrol station in 1998, repaired the place and opened his business. He and his son work together and over the years they have earned constant customers. Since 2005 the price for petrol in Azerbaijan has increased by 50 percent. To keep his clients he is applying for $1,000 to keep buying the same amount of petrol he was selling before the price increased.

loan.use: To purchase more petrol

loan.name: Nariman

texts.en: Nariman R. is a 33-year-old single man. He lives in the southern Azerbaijani town of Imishli. He has seven years of experience; when he started selling goods in his store he was only 26. In the beginning, he sold only biscuits and candies. As soon as he found success, he borrowed $2,300 and purchased goods such as sugar, flour, salt, rice and other goods. Nariman is applying for a $1,200 loan to purchase more beverages and begin selling them, because they are in high demand.

loan.use: To add beverages to his inventory

loan.name: Nilufar

texts.en:
In the past, Nilufar earned a living by making confections at home. She used to sell her products to stores, which then paid Nilufar after selling the sweets to their customers. Gradually growing her business, Nilufar added other food products to her assortment of goods. In the beginning of the year, Nilufar received a MicroInvest loan to purchase more goods. She is single and lives with her parents. Nilufar, 29 has been in business for 5 years. She plans to continue expansion of her business.P.S in the photo you can see her little cousin,because Nilufar is very shy person.Her cousin helps Nilufar in trade during her summer vacation.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

loan.use: Business expansion

loan.name: Elnur

texts.en: Elnur H. is a 26-year-old single businessman. He lives in the southern part of Azerbaijan, in the center of the town of Imishli. He started his business 3 years ago. With money he borrowed form his friends he rented a small store and purchased pens, notebooks and markers. In less than one year his business increased and all these goods sold quickly. He enlarged his store and purchased more stationery. Elnur's store is open from early morning until late at night, and selling is going very well, so he decided to apply for $900 loan to add to his inventory computer accessories.

loan.use: To start selling computer accessories

loan.name: Muhaio

texts.en:
Muhaio started her business in 2002 with the trade of socks and underwear. She had $100 in inventory. Gradually she increased her working capital to $500. She brings her goods from Istaravshan, Tadjikistan.

Today she sells perfumes and womens head scarves. Her business is going well; she has many regular clients. Her trade place is located in Kistakuz, Tadjikistan. Her husband helps her to import her goods from the wholesale market of Istaravshan to her business place. She wants to expand her inventory and add new kinds of perfumes, for which purpose she needs $500.

loan.use: Expand inventory

loan.name: Mahammadali

texts.en:
Mahammadali H. is a 56-year-old married man who has two milk cows and a calf. He lives in the southern part of Azerbaijan, Bilasuvar town. Mahammadali is an IDP (internally displaced person) from Jabrail region who fled to Bilasuvar in 1993 during the Azerbaijan-Armenian conflict. He has been raising animals since 1997.

The first loan Mahammadali applied for was US$ 600. With that amount, he purchased his first milk cow and started to sell milk and yoghurt to the local people. These products are in very high demand in the small towns and villages of Azerbaijan. Later on, with the money he earned from his milk and yoghurt sales, he purchased a calf.

Mahammadali has a big family, a wife and 4 grown-up children, two daughters and two sons. The youngest son helps him to tend the animals, but to cover all the needs of their big family they have to expand their micro-business, so they have applied for this $1,200 loan to purchase one more cow and a calf.

loan.use: purchase one milk cow and a calf

loan.name: Bikenja

texts.en:
Bikenja has been selling children's clothes in the Kistakuz clothing market for three years. She loves children very much. She is married and has 3 children of her own. Her husband is in Russia. He sends money to his family, but it is not enough to support them, which is why Bikenja decided to start her own business. Bikenja brings her goods from the wholesale market, Panjshanbe , to Khudjand.

She is one of the active clients of Micro Invest. Her first loan was 100USD and she spent it for developing her business. Gradually she increased her working capital and expanded her inventory by including several lines of modern clothes for children. She wants to go to the Istaravshan district of Tadjikistan, to the big market there, to purchase goods. She is requesting 600USD for purchasing.

loan.use: Expand inventory

loan.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Born in 1977, Cecilia M. is married to Jonathan Suh and is a mother of 5 children. Her source of motivation is from difficulties she has faced, especially poor health which has resulted in a surgical operation on her leg. This further compounded the situation and the consequences include inability to educate her children even in primary school. Encouraged by GHAPE borrowers Cecilia became a member of GHAPE and received a loan of $40 in 2003 and since then has proven her ability to receive, invest and repay loans up to the amount of $400. From previous loans she provided her community with fresh food. She is very proud of her achievements especially her success in owning and managing her own business. With profits from these loans, she has been paying childrens school fees. Given a loan of $600, Cecilia plans to continue in the same line of business of selling water fufu and Eru and crop cultivation. Water-fufu is made out of fermented cassava. It is palatable with okra and Eru. Eru is green vegetables prepared with smoked fresh cow skin. When crayfish is added to it and a few magi cubes, even passers-by smell it and saliva is generated. Water fufu and Eru was once a highly appreciated traditional dish in the south west province of Cameroon but today it is widely eaten by most Cameroonians. Her intention is to use the profit to continue to educate her children and take care of her health. Cecilia plans to repay her loan during the loan term.

loan.use: purchase of foodstuffs, hire labor, buy wood, transport expenses

loan.name: Chunga Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a husband and father of five children. Health problems have rendered him not strong enough to cultivate crops which are the main economic activity in his community. As a result, he has resorted to rearing animals and producing honey which is less strenuous in his estimation. Due to inadequate capital, he could not raise enough revenue to meet the needs of his family. Motivated by other GHAPE members in his community, he joined the program and received loans of $40 and $130 in 2005 and 2006 respectively. The profit he got from the loans was used to pay tuition for his children. Given the high demand of his products, there is need for expansion.
Given a loan of $200, Emmanuel plans to repair his pig sty, buy more bee hives and feed for his pigs. His community will benefit from this in that there will be more honey, pork, and manure at their disposal for a better standard of living.
He plans to repay the loan during the loan term.

loan.use: Rearing of pigs, goats and production of honey

loan.name: Ochaoy

texts.en:
Ochaoy has over 8 year of experience in trade. She is a married and has 4 children. Her husband is a worker. They are a friendly family and they both work for their children.

Her business is trade of perfumes and it is located in the Kistakuz big market. Presently her business is going well; she has many clients and also she takes orders from them. Today she has one sales assistant and two places of trade. The turnover of her business is fast. She wants to expand her assortment of goods for attracting more new clients. For this purpose she is requesting $800.

loan.use: Expand inventory

loan.name: Bah Jeremiah

texts.en: As a young and aspiring man, Jeremiah has been finding difficulties trying to raise business capital. He is married and has one child. He had tried borrowing money from other financial institutions but had problems of repayment due to high interest rates. Pig farming is a very profitable business in his community when done on a large scale. Motivated by his ambitions, Jeremiah joined GHAPE in March 2007. His choice for this trade is as a result of his childhood experience in pig rearing and further business development skills acquired during GHAPE Initial training. Given a loan of $100, he plans to buy 240kg of pig feed since he already has the pigs but faces difficulties feeding them. He plans to repay the loan during the loan term.

loan.use: Rearing of pigs

loan.name: Jacinta.

texts.en:
Jacinta is newly wedded but her husband cannot provide her with the much needed capital for business. Things got worse when her supportive father passed away. The high interest rates of local banks discourage her from getting a loan but with the advent of GHAPE in her community, she has found refuge. She is confident investing in pig farming as it is an old activity and she has acquired a lot of training in this field. Her community has been benefiting from her activities in terms of the manure they get.
Given a loan of $100, Jacinta plans to buy two more piglets and 80kg of composed animal feed.
She plans to repay the loan during the loan term.

loan.use: Buying of piglets and feed.

loan.name: Theophilus

texts.en:
Theophilus is married and has three children. As an unemployed man, relying on crop cultivation was not sufficient to take care of his family. He thought of expanding his activities by rearing pigs but hadnt the capital. This pushed him to join GHAPE where he received his first loans of $40 and $120 in 2005 and 2006 respectively. These loans empowered him to open up a pig farm but with the increase in the demand of pork, there is need for him to increase his production.
Given a loan of $500, Theophilus plans to buy 10 more piglets and 800kg of animal feed. His community stands a great chance of benefiting from his activities as he will in the long run be supplying piglets to those interested in pig farming.
He plans to repay the loan during the loan term.

loan.use: Fattening of pigs for sale

loan.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha is a mother of six, five of whom are in school. Her father died when she was young and she didn't have the opportunity to go to school. Thats why she has made up her mind to give the best of education to her children. Realizing the heavy school needs, she vowed to work very hard and sought assistance from GHAPE. She joined the program in 2004. Since her restaurant is located near a school, there is always a ready market. School children have been benefiting a lot from her activities as they always have something to eat in the morning and during break. Given a loan of $300, Martha plans to buy Koki beans, palm oil, flour, yeast and sugar. She plans to repay the loan during the loan term.

loan.use: Cooking and selling of food

loan.name: Yadigar

texts.en:
Yadigar I. is a 37-year-old farmer who runs his own small farm with a little herd consisting of two cows and a calf. Yadigar lives in the southern part of Azerbaijan in Khochonbli village near Imishli town. Since 1993 when he fled to Imishli from Jabrail during the Azerbaijani-Armenian conflict, he has been an internally displaced person. Yadigar is married and has one child.

He started his business in 2000, when he borrowed money from his friends and purchased a cow. Later, when he had paid back the debts, the cow began to bring him income and in less than a year, he was able to purchase one more cow and a calf.

When his child was born, life become more difficult so Yadigar has decided to expand his business and purchase another cow and fodder for his cattle for winter. He has applied for a loan of US$ 900. He intends to purchase a good milk cow for about $730 and for the remaining $170, he will purchase fodder.

loan.use: purchase one cow and fodder for winter

loan.name: Achu Moses

texts.en: Moses is married and has six children. His ambition in life is to raise and own his own capital, and to see all his children become responsible citizens tomorrow. As small steps towards these goals, he joined GHAPE and requested $40 as take-off capital. With previous loans he started a pig farm. Gardeners in his community have benefited from his manure. Given a loan of $500, Moses plans to restructure his piggery and buy piglets, 160kg of feed and vaccines. He plans to repay the loan during the loan term.

loan.use: Reconstruction of pig sty and buying of piglets

loan.name: Zefer

texts.en:
Zefer Q. is 28-year-old retailer who runs a small cosmetics and perfume store in Qizilkend village near Imishli town, which is situated in the southern part of Azerbaijan. Zefer opened his store in 2003, when he was only 24. He recently got married and has 1 child. Summer temperatures in Imishli reach a sweltering 50C so people do not stay long when they come into the store.

Zefer has applied for a loan of US$1200 to purchase and install a new air conditioner and give his customers a chance to enjoy a cool comfortable search for the items they want to purchase. Zefer notes, "Most of the customers who come into my store are women. They like to spend a lot of time searching for cosmetics or perfume and I want to create a comfortable place for them, even in sumertime."

loan.use: purchase air conditioner for his shop
